Ainda não é fácil identificar as mudanças em termos de progressão no negócio pois está a pouco tempo no programa, contudo, tem poupado acima da taxa obrigatória.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng C. L. is a widow, aged 42 years, and lives with her single son in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a street vendor selling different kinds of fruits and can make about $5/day in revenue. Her son is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, whose income is potential for supplementing his household. This loan will be used by C. L. to purchase a motorcycle to help in operating her son's business.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her son to operate a business.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Seng Cheak Loeun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Eusébio João

texts.pt:
Eusébio João M. is 31 years old. He is the single father of 4 children. He lives in the neighborhood of Ferroviario, in Maputo. He sells bananas, which he buys in the provinces of Manica and Tete in bulk.

Eusébio joined the FDM development program in March of 2006. He borrowed 6.000MT as his first loan. He is now in the 4th stage of his program and plans on borrowing 30.000MT. With this loan he plans on investing on his business and on the buying of door frames in Chimoio to re-sell in Maputo. Eusébio has had noticeable improvements in his business since joining the program. Though he has had to face difficulties, such as the passing of his wife and daughter, he has shown the willingness and commitment to repay his loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Eusébio João M. tem 31 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 4 filhos.Vive no Bairro Ferroviário em Maputo.Vende Banana a qual compra nas províncias de Manica e Tete em grandes quantidades.

Entrou para o Programa em Março de 2006. tomou no 1º empréstimo 6.000MT e vai agora para o 4º ciclo e pretende um empréstimo de 30.000MT, montante este que pretende aplicar no negócio actual e parte do mesmo pretende comprar portas em Chimoio para revenda em Maputo. Nota- se um desenvolvimento do seu negócio e, apesr de ter enfrentado problemas como a morte da mulher e uma filha mostrou vontade e preocupação em reembolsar o empréstimo nas datas programadas.

loans.use: Increase stock - compra de stock

loans.name: Tersa Macaza

texts.pt:
Teresa Macaza C. is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Macaza C., a province of Maputo. She is a seamstress and sells drinks and sodas from her house.

Teresa joined the Fund for the Development of Women program in December 2006. She borrowed 6.000MT as her first loan. She is now on the 3rd stage of the program and plans on borrowing 10.000MT to invest in her business. It hasn't been long enough since Teresa joined the program to see concrete improvement in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Macaza C. tem 43 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Vive noTeresa Macaza C. Província de Maputo. É modista e também tem uma barraca em casa onde vende bebidas e refrigerantes.

Está no Programa desde Dezembro de 2006, tendo tomado 6.000MT como 1º empréstimo.Vai para o terceiro ciclo e pretende um empréstimo no valor de 10.000MT para aplicar nos dois negócios. Não é ainda notável um desenvolvimento substancial do seu negócio pois está pouco tempo no programa.

loans.use: Increase stock - aumento de stock

loans.name: Crimildo Eugénio

texts.pt:
Crimildo Eugénio M. is 29 years old. He is married and father of 2 children. He lives in the neighborhoods of Magoanine CMC, in Maputo. He sells charcoal - firewood - from his home.

He joined the credit program in June 2006; he borrowed 4,000MT as his first loan. He is now in the 4th stage of the program, and plans on borrowing 6.000MT. Crimildo plans to increase his stock, acquire a license for his business, and invest in the transporting of firewood in order to increase the profit margin of his business. It is too soon to see improvements in the business; Crimildo experienced some delay in the payments of previous loans and joined the program a little more than a year ago.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Crimildo Eugénio M. tem 29 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 2 filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine CMC em Maputo.Vende carvão na sua residência .

Entrou no Programa em Junho de 2006 e teve 4.000MT como 1º empréstimo.Está no 4º ciclo e pretende 6.000MT para aumentar o stock e tratar a licença de corte e transporte de carvão com vista a tornar mais rentável e seguro o seu negócio. É ainda difícil avaliar o crescimento do negócio, pois o cliente teve alguns atrasos noas prestações do último empréstimo e está a pouco mais de um ano no Programa.

loans.use: Increase stock - Compra de stock

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar M. is 70 years old, married, and lives with his 5 children in the Khoshchobanli village, situated in Imishli in the sothern part of Azerbaijan. Eldar has been running his small business since 1990 when he bought his first cow which started bringing him considerable income in less than six months. Eldar used his first income to buy a calf which has now grown up and produces milk. Supporting a family of six is not easy, and, because over the years the price of a lot of goods has increased, raising catle has become more difficult. To be able to better provide for his family's needs, Eldar has applied for a loan of US$1,200 to buy another cow and a calf. Their estimated prices are US$800 and US$400, respectively.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a calf

loans.name: Beltha

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Beltha N. is married, a mother of seven children and a grandmother.  Two of her children have died.  With a large family, she and her husband found it difficult to provide food and pay for school fees for her children since they were both unemployed.  This motivated her to become a GHAPE member in 1999.  She was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.  Since then, she has invested money from loans into selling foodstuffs and has raised money for food and school fees for her children.

Given a new loan of $600, she plans to increase her business and save for the future.  She plans to repay the loan in 24 months with the first installment to be made fourth months from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes, beans, corn, salt, and groundnuts

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Born in 1946, S. Magdalene is a widow with six children.  She has suffered from ill health, particularly pain in her legs.  As a widow, she has a lot of difficulty providing for the basic needs of her children and buying medication for herself.  This motivated her to became a member of GHAPE in 1999.  She was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since 1999, she has been able to apply for and repay all her loans.  She used the money to pay for school and apprentice fees for her children and to buy food.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to invest it in fattening and selling pigs, motorbike transportation and the cultivation of crops. Her profits will be used to increase the size of her business, repair her house and cater to her family's needs.  She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. Her first repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, pig feed, seeds, and a motor bike

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Pricilla is married and has eight children.  After a car accident, her husband spent almost all of their resources buying medications.  He also became unemployed as a result.  Providing food and catering to the family's needs became difficult.  This is when she decided to start a business. To obtain start-off capital, she became a member of GHAPE, where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all of her loans.  The money she earned was spent assisting her husband in paying for school fees and providing food for her children.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to fatten and sell pigs, cultivate crops and improve her business.  She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. Her first loan repayment installment will be made four month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and seeds and pay for hired labour and pig vaccines

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Born in 1944, Regina A. is married and is the mother of nine children. Her source of happiness has always been seeing her children educated or learning a trade.  However, this dream was shattered because her husband’s salary was not enough to pay for the associated costs. This motivated her to seek help and become a member of GHAPE.  She was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has taken out and repaid loans which have allowed her to assist her husband in paying for school fees for her children.

Given a loan of $700, Regina plans to fatten and sell pigs as well as cultivate vegetables to raise money for school fees and to improve her business. Given the fact that pig fattening takes some time, the sale of her vegetables will enable her to start repaying the loan when the time comes.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. Her first repayment will be made four months after the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and pig feed in addition to paying for transportation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1954, Mary T. is a widow with five children. Her desire to see all of her children educated was shattered when her husband died, leaving her to single-handedly provide for her family.  This motivated her to seek help.  She became a member of GHAPE, where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has taken out and repaid loans through her crop cultivation business.  This has also allowed her to raise money to pay for her children's school fees.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to sell spare motor parts (both secondhand and new) in the commercial zone of the town.  She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.  Her first repayment installment will be made four months from the date of the disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase spare motor parts

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
Namig A. lives in Beylagan city, situated in southwest Azerbaijan. He is married and he has 2 children. Namig has rented a small café in Beylagan. He prepares different meals at his café and sells beer in the summer.

He wants to repair his café and to buy some tables and chairs. He needs $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. was born in 1964.  She is married and a mother of five children. She has suffered from the death of her two sisters this year.  Additionally, she has been unable to provide enough food and pay school fees for her family. Motivated by these difficulties, she became a GHAPE member and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

She requests a first loan of $100 with which she plans to sell groceries. Her grocery store is situated in the residential area and will be profitable because the larger markets are far away.  She plans to raise money to pay school fees for her children and to provide balanced meals for her family.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper etc.

loans.name: Kenan

texts.en:
Kenan A. lives in Beylagan, a small town in southwest Azerbaijan. He is 23 years old and he is single. Kenan has a food market near his home. He is selling bread, tea, sugar, sweets, drinks, cigarettes, etc. at his market. His father helps him at his job.

Last mounth Kenan increased the area of his market. Now he wants to to buy more kinds of goods and increase his daily selling. Because of this, he applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan. Kenan needs $500 to buy more kinds of goods and to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Shu Godlove

texts.en:
Shu Godlove is one of the few bamboo suppliers in his area.  Bamboo is used to construct fences, animal sties and to make furniture. Before starting this business, he was unable to pay school fees for his two children.  His children were being continuously sent away on fee drives.   This led him to look for capital to start selling bamboo.  He came in contact with GHAPE through other members. Since then he has obtained three loans with which he has made money to pay for his children's school fees.

Given a loan of $500, he plans to continue in the same line of business and use the profits to pay his children’s school fees and to improve his business.  He plans to repay the loan in 18 months.  The first repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo and pay for transportation

loans.name: Zipporah Nchang

texts.en:
Born in 1959, N. Zipporah Nchang is married and is the mother of five children. She suffered from a sickness which required two surgeries which left her bankrupt. This made it difficult for her to invest in the business she was operating. She decided to contact GHAPE for help. After becoming a member, she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. She obtained two loans to invest in her existing business and raised money to buy a sewing machine.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to sew and sell dresses as well as sell food items. Her profits will go towards buying a plot and paying school fees for her children. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase food items and cloth

loans.name: Ruphina

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Rophina S. is married and is a mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. Education for her four children, both in the formal and informal sector, is her primary drive.  She used to borrow from neighbors at a very high interest rate before she received her first loan of $30 from GHAPE, which she invested in crop cultivation.  GHAPE also trained her in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, which has been reinforced by bi-monthly meetings. 

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to open a first aid store.  This will help her raise money to pay for school fees for her children and younger siblings. Her community stands to benefit from the supply of drugs.  She plans to repay her loan in 24 months.  Her first loan repayment installment  will be made four  months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and to pay rent for the store

loans.name: Anye Lawrence

texts.en:
Born in 1972, Anye Lawrence is divorced from his former wife. He had to provide for his three children which was difficult because he had no vocational training and little formal education. This motivated him to become a member of GHAPE where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has taken out and repaid loans. This has allowed him to pay for school fees for his children and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $600, he plans sell firewood, which is the most common source of energy, and earn money to continue paying for his children’s school fees and to improve his business. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. His first loan repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and pay for transportation

loans.name: Ndeh Joseph

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Ndeh Joseph is married and is the father of three children. All of his children are currently in school. He has spent a lot of money on medication in an attempt to cure his child of an illness that made him mute. In addition to this, he was unable to provide three square meals for his family and pay his children's school fees. This motivated him to become a member of GHAPE where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has taken out and repaid loans which enabled him to earn money to pay for school fees and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $1200, he plans to sell groceries in the residential areas. This will reduce the need for people to travel to the main market for groceries. He plans to earn money to feed his family and to pay for school fees. He also wants to use the money to get medical help for his sick child.

He plans to repay his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase meat, wine and groceries

loans.name: Nji Richard

texts.en:
Nji Richard M. is married and a father of five.  He greatly enjoys his family life thanks to the training he got from GHAPE.  Before this training, he suffered from marital misunderstanding due to ignorance and was also unable to provide for his family.  This motivated him to become a member of GHAPE where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has taken out and repaid loans which have enabled him to pay for school fees for his children and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $800, he plans to fatten and sell pigs, which are a commonly consumed meat in this area.  While waiting for his pigs to be fattened, he plans to cultivate short cycle crops to sell so that he can start repaying his loan.

He plans to repay his loan in 24 months.  His first loan repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase of piglets, pig vaccine and seeds as well as to finance the construction of pig sties

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is a 57-year-old energetic mother of six, a resident of the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the charcoal business for the past five years, and it has been improving and profiting ever since she received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. She travels monthly to nearby surrounding regions (Morogoro, Tanga and Pwani), where most of her suppliers are stationed, for charcoal. She is both a wholesaler and a retailer. On  average, she sells seven sacks of charcoal. She has a big store at her place and it’s her plan to open up other centers for her business. She is in need of USD 750 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Build another store for charcoal and expand on the stock

loans.name: Ngwa Odilia

texts.en:
Forty-one year old Odilia is a single mother of three and a hairdresser by profession. After she joined GHAPE she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.  She subsequently  received a loan of $40 which she invested in her hairdressing business. 

However, the business did not generate enough money to meet all of the basic needs of her children. She decided to ask for this loan of $300 to sell food items, firewood and basic commodities.  She plans to earn money so she can rent a workshop for her daughter who has just finished her apprentice course.

She plans to repay her loan in 15 months.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as corn, rice, cocoyam, garri, fowl etc.

loans.name: Fru Abednego

texts.en:
Fru Adednego is an ambitious father of eight.  His desire is to provide a bright future for all of his children by educating them to the necessary level. His dreams were almost shattered when the house he built with all of his resources was demolished by rain. He now has to work harder to rebuild the house while also providing for his family.  With this burden, he sought help from GHAPE.  GHAPE trained him in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. He has successfully invested and repaid all his loans.  These loans allowed him to earn money to build a house, pay school fees for his children and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $1200, he plans to sell pigs and piglets to raise money to continue paying his children’s school fees and to provide capital for his wife.

He plans to repay his loan in 24 months.  The first loan repayment installment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and the purchase of pig feed and pigs

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo owns his home in the Pasankeri neighborhood of La Paz, where he lives with his wife and two children. He is 38 years old and has worked as a printer for the past six years, making agendas, posters and notebooks. His wife helps him manufacture, bind and sell these products in local markets.

Guillermo's wish is to work side by side with his wife in their own well-equiped print shop, to create additional employment opportunities and increase their income. He is requesting this loan to purchase paper and supplies to manufacture calendar year 2008 agendas. He faces stiff competition for contracts and wants to be able to enter bids reflecting quality materials.

His credit history with IMPRO identifies him as an excellent client who qualifies for a new business loan. To date, IMPRO has made three loans to Guillermo: US $200 in June 2004, US $300 in August 2005 and US $350 in August 2006. All previous loans have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermo vive en casa propia en la calle 5 de agosto de la zona de pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos; tiene 38 años de edad y desde hace mas de 6 años trabaja como grafico elaborando agendas, afiches y cuadernillos. Cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien colabora tanto en la elaboración, compaginación etc. además de vender en las ferias.

El deseo de Guillermo es trabajar junto con su esposa y tener un buen taller y poder generar empleo y también mejorar sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de papel y material para elaborar agendas 2008 y como hay mucha competencia entrar a las licitaciones con un buen material (licitaciones son los bids en ingles).

Su antecedente histórico con Impro lo califica como un muy buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Hasta la fecha IMPRO ha concedido a Guillermo tres créditos: en Junio 2004 $200, en Agosto 2005 $300 y en Agosto 2006 $350. Todos los créditos han sido pagados en su totalidad.

loans.use: To purchase printing supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir and his family work together running a small business at the Central market in Kalush, Ukraine where they sell toys and office supplies. He and his wife, Svetlana, have three children – a son, 18, and two daughters ages 14 and 5. They have had their business for ten years.

Two factors contributing to the success of the business are the length of time they have been at the market and the financial resources they have received from Nadiya Ukraine. They have benefited from the capital available through Nadiya and have been faithful to pay each loan back, even when they were facing financial difficulties.

Volodimir has requested a short term loan of $300 to help purchase additional inventory for the business. He’d like to buy and assortment of office supply items and toys to increase his product on hand and allow him to continue earning a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of office suppies and toys

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Born in 1974, Godlove is married and has four children. He is proud of having executed the traditional rights to legally stay and have children with his very supportive wife. The deaths of his mother and brother caused him great pains that almost rendered him unable to work.

With his two previous loans he succeeded in providing his community with fresh tomatoes. Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy manure, fertilizer, and chemicals to expand his garden. He intends to buy goats and 10-day-old chicks to fatten and sell for food.

He plans to repay the entire loan by the end of the 18 months. The first loan repayment installment shall commence at the end of the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Buying manure, fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam A. lives in a home she owns in the Llojeta Bajo neighborhood of La Paz. She is a widow and has four children, but only one child who is still a dependent.

She works mornings at a bakery owned by one of her sons; in the afternoons, she works as a hair stylist in her own beauty salon. On Saturday afternoons she teaches hairstyling at a beauty school in the city of El Alto.

This loan is to be used to finance her son's thesis coursework at Salesiana University. This is the first time she has requested a loan through IMPRO, and IMPRO's financial analysis indicates that she has sufficient income to repay this loan and cover her and her dependent child's living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Miriam A. vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Llojeta Bajo en la calle Valle Vergelito Nº 1146 de la ciudad de La Paz. La señora es viuda tiene cuatro hijos, pero bajo su dependencia se encuentra solo uno.

Trabaja en la mañana en la pastelería de su hijo y luego en la tarde se va al salón de belleza de su propiedad, ubicado en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la ciudad de La Paz, donde se dedica a los peinados (ella es peinadora), y los días sábados en la tarde dicta clases de peluquería en un instituto de belleza de la ciudad de el Alto.

El destino del crédito es para colaborar a uno de sus hijos en la elaboración de su tesis de la Universidad Salesiana. No tiene crédito con Impro, pues es la primera vez que acude a nuestra Institución. El análisis financiero indica que cuenta con suficientes ingresos como para pagar el crédito solicitado y cubrir sus necesidades particulares y las de su hijo que aun depende de ella.

loans.use: To finance her son's thesis coursework at the university

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Born in 1945, Joseph is married and is a father of four children. His difficulty in his lifetime has been that of unemployment that made it tough for him to even provide a good meal for his family. His hardworking wife tried all she could to make a profit from her farming business, to no avail since she also had no money to buy farm implements. Moved by these difficulties, Joseph sought help from GHAPE and received a first loan of $30 with which he tapped and sold raffia wine. He has been able to repay loans up to $500, with which he raised money to pay apprentice fees for his children.

Given a loan of $600, he plans to tap and sell raffia wine, which is made from the raffia plant and is drunk in this area, particularly on special traditional occasions. He plans to raise money to feed his family and to pay school fees and increase his business.

He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of raffia wine, groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wood, rent a raffia bush, hired labour

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Alice N. is married and is a mother of five children. Her ill health caused her husband to sell some of their valuable properties and even exhausted all their money on medications. After that there was need for capital to start off a business that would be able to sustain the family. She then sought the help of GHAPE, became a member in 2002, and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has successfully invested, managed and repaid loans of about $600 with which she raised money to pay apprentice fees for her children, buy medications and pay school fees.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to sell fish, egusi and cultivate vegetables. Egusi is a rich source of protein and oil and is used as a thickener of soups and to make pudding. With the profit, she plans to increase her business and continue to pay school fees for her children.

She will repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase fish, egusi, vegetable seeds

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Born in 1950, Monica is married with three children and a grandmother. At her age, she has suffered from the death of her son and grandson and the inability to provide food for her family and buy medications for herself. She also has many grandchildren born out of wedlock looking up to her for food.
With these difficulties, she became a member of GHAPE and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

She now requests a loan of $100 with which she plans to buy and sell food items so she can raise money to provide for her family.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil, cocoyam, maggi, spices

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a 41-year-old mother of six. She runs a charcoal business in the Lumo area, Dar Es Salaam region. She has been in this business and she is lucky that it’s growing day by day. She gets her charcoal from Morogoro or Pwani regions. She sometimes goes to the bush and prepares it herself. She has got a quite big store at her home and is both a retailer and a wholesaler, and she has employed two people in her business.

She is in need of USD1200 to help expand her business, build a bigger store and open up more supply centers, and start another business (used clothes). The charcoal business is not healthy; the dust is problematic.

loans.use: Build a bigger store, open up another business

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Celine W. is married to Shadrack W. and is a mother of 7 children. Being unemployed and with the meager salary of her husband, they were unable to provide for the basic needs of their 7 children. Motivated by these difficulties, she joined GHAPE in 2001 and obtained a loan of $30 and since then has been able to invest and manage loan amounts up to $230. With these loans, she paid her children's school fees and provided a balanced diet for her children.

Given a loan of $600, she plans to sell cooked food, rear pigs and sell firewood. The fact that she is known by most hawkers and laborers as a good cook is of advantage as this increases the number of her clients. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children and provide for other basic needs. The fact that she sells firewood in her community will reduce indiscriminate exploitation of forests for firewood.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase rice, cocoyam, piglets, firewood, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Samuel Fru

texts.en:
Samuel T. is 55 years old, married and a father of five children. He first sought help from GHAPE in 1999 when he was unemployed and faced difficulties in providing food for his family and paying school fees for his children. Since 1999, he has successfully invested, managed and repaid loans up to $600 after he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. With these loans, he increased his business. His children were able to go to school and some learnt a trade.

Given a loan of $1200 and the training gotten from GHAPE, he plans to rear pigs, cultivate crops and sell food items and raise money to continue paying school fees for his children and provide them with food and medications. He will also provide pig droppings for the community to use as manure and sell piglets to those interested.

He plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, food items, work the farm

loans.name: Nyalwanda

texts.en: Nyalwanda is not a Rwandese, as her name may sound, but she is a 30-year-old mother of three, a resident of the Vituka area Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. She has been doing business for the past five years and she runs two businesses, charcoal and clothes.  She buys her clothes from from the wholesalers in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam’s biggest trading area,  and sells in the Lumo area as a retailer. Sometimes she supplies the clothes upcountry when she goes searching for charcoal.  She owns a shop and has got a charcoal store at her home, where she employs one person. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand both her businesses.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Maria Marcela

texts.en:
Maria Marcela is 46 years old and has nine children. She weaves blouses, skirts, tablecloths and shawls and then embroiders them in the style of her native village. She sells these pieces to middlemen who resell them in traditional markets and tourist areas. She belongs to a co-op called 3 Angels, along with artisans Narcisa Rosa G. H., Maria H. Perez, and Pascuala Perez G.. Their plan is to use this loan to purchase wholesale fabric and yarn to share among the four of them, lowering their costs and increasing their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA MARCELA, TIENE 46 AÑOS , 9 HIJOS, ELLA CONFECCIONA BLUSAS , FALDAS , MANTELES , CHALES Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA SEGÚN EL ESTILO DE LAS GENTES QUE HABITAN SU COMUNIDAD Y POSTERIORMENTE LO VENDE A PERSONAS QUE LO COMERCIALIZAN EN LOS MERCADOS TRADICIONALES O EN ZONAS DE MUCHO TURISMO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO 3 ANGELES 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA NARCISA ROSA G. H. ( ARTESANA ) Y DOÑA MARIA H. PEREZ (ARTESANA) Y DOÑA PASCUALA PEREZ G. ( ARTESANA). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN TODAS PODER COMPRAR HILOS AL POR MAYOR Y TELAS PARA DESPUES REPARTIRSE ENTRE ELLAS Y ASI PODER REBAJAR LOS COSTOS DE COMPRA Y OBTENER MAS GANACIAS AL VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and yarn at wholesale prices

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is an artisan, like the vast majority of the women in her village. She weaves blouses, skirts, tablecloths and napkins, and shawls and then embroiders them before she sells them to middlemen. They in turn sell her products out of state, where they are highly prized because of their beautiful colors and detailed work. Rosa is 34 years old, married and has five children. She belongs to a co-op called Fatima 7.

This loan will be used to purchase fabric and yarn to be used in expanding her production capacity so that she can sell her creations directly in high tourism areas.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANÍA AL IGUAL QUE LA GRAN MAYORIA DE LAS MUJERES DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE, ELLA CONFECCIONA BLUSAS, FALDAS, MANTELES, CHALES, SERVILLETAS Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA N Y LAS VENDE CON LOS MAYORISTAS QUIENES LO COMERCIALIZAN FUERA DEL ESTADO POR SER MUY APRECIADAS POR LA BELLEZA DE SUS COLORES Y BORDADOS. ELLA TIENE 34 AÑOS, CASADA, 5 HIJOS, PERTENECE AL GRUPO FATIMA 7. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS TELA, HILO Y AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION PARA PODER TAMBIEN ELLA COMERCIALIZAR SUS PRODUCTOS EN LAS ZONAS DE MAYOR AFLUENCIA TURISTICA.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and yarn

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is 39 years old and has five children. Her husband sells flowers and she's an artisan, weaving clothing items typical of her village. She embroiders and embellishes these pieces with lively designs and colors and sells them to the women in her area. Petrona belongs to the co-op Fatima 7.

She will use this loan to buy yarn, which she considers to be her main raw material, at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull Kiva Volunteer.

PETRONA , TIENE 39 AÑOS , 5 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FLORES Y ELLA ES ARTESANA DEDICADA A LA CONFECCION DE ROPA ARTESANAL TIPICA DE LA ZONA DONDE VIVE Y LAS BORDA CON LLAMATIVOS DISEÑOS Y COLORES Y LA VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU ZONA . ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO FATIMA 7 . CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA HILO AL POR MAYOR YA QUE CONSIDERA ESTO COMO LA MATERIA PRIMA EN LA PRODUCION DE SUS PRENDAS.

loans.use: To buy yarn wholesale

loans.name: Florentina Petrona

texts.en:
Florentina weaves blouses, skirts and tablecloths, which she sells to both middlemen and women in her village. She is 26 years old, is married and has one child. Her husband works as a chauffer.

She belongs to the co-op Fatima 7 and along with Magdalena Perez Hernandez and Guadalupe Jimenez Mendez, will invest the proceeds of this loan in additional yarn for their creations.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

FLORENTINA, SE DEDICA A BORDAR BLUSAS , FALDAS Y MANTELES POSTERIORMENTE LO VENDE A LOS MAYORISTAS Y TAMBIEN LO EXHIBE EN SU CASA PARA LAS MUJERES DE SU LOCALIDAD. ELLA TIENE 26 AÑOS , CASADA , 1 HIJO Y SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO FATIMA 7 JUNTO CON DOÑA MAGDALENA PEREZ HERNANDEZ ( ARTESANA) Y DOÑA GUADALUPE JIMENEZ MENDEZ(ARTESANA).TODAS INVERTIRAN SU PRESTAMO EN LA COMPRA DE HILO PARA SUS BORDADOS.

loans.use: To purchase yarn

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala is 45 years old and has 10 children. Her husband sells fruit and vegetables in his community and she dedicates herself to embroidering blouses and skirts and sells them to tourists who visit the area. She is a member of Grupo Clavel 5 along with Mrs. Juana Hernandez (craftswoman) and Mrs. Rosa Perez Perez (craftswoman). Their loan will be used to purchase large amounts of silk threading for their embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA, TIENE 45 AÑOS , TUVO 10 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES COMERCIANTE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN LOS ALREDEDORES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA BORDANDO BLUSAS, FALDAS, Y LAS VENDE CON LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO CLAVEL 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA JUANA HERNANDEZ L. (ARTESANA) Y DOÑA ROSA PEREZ PEREZ (ARTESANA). SUS PRESTAMOS LO INVERTIRAN COMPRANDO GRNADES CANTIDADES DE HILO DE SEDA PARA SUS BORDADOS.

loans.use:
Arts & Crafts

ARTESANA

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is 34 years old and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and she sells perfume and cosmetics by order to the women in her community. She is a member of the microcredit group Erasto Urbina 1 with Cecilia Hernandez Lopez who sells fruits and vegetables, Adela Gomez P. who sells thread, needles, buttons and other sewing supplies, and Rita Maria P. Penagos who sells candles.

With their loans: Martha will buy a display to exhibit her products, Cecilia will put up a stand in her house to sell fruits and vegetables, Adela will stock up on sewing supplies to offer her clients and Rita will buy paraffin, wicks, coloring and aromas for her candles.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

MARTHA, TIENE 34 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA Y ELLA VENDE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS A PEDIDO ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ERASTO URBINA 1 , JUNTO CON DOÑA CECILIA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS) Y DOÑA ADELA GOMEZ P. (VENTA DE HILOS , AGUJAS, BOTONES EN GENERAL PRODUCTOS DE MERCERIA )Y DOÑA RITA MARIA P. PENAGOS(VENTA DE VELAS ) .

CON SUS PRESTAMOS : MARTHA COMPRARA UN MOSTRADOR PAR AEXHIBIR SUS PRODUCTOS , CECILIA PONDRA UN PUESTO EN SU CASA PARA VENDER LAS FRUTAS Y ADELA COMPRARA MAS SURTIDO DE PRODUCTOS DE MERCERIA PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTAS Y RITA COMPRARA PARAFINA, MECHAS, COLORANTES Y AROMATIZANTES PARA SUS VELAS.

loans.use: Sale of perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia sells pefume and cosmetics in her neighborhood, is 31 years old, has two children and her husband works as a driver. She is a member of the microcredit group Erasto Urbina 2 along with Leticia Miguela Sanchez Hernandez who sells coal, Maria Irma Sanchez Lopez who sells perfume, Karla G. who sells clothing, and Elena Martinez who sells fruits and vegetables. They will use their loan to invest in each of their businesses, buying what they need to stock up on products.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

PATRICIA , SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS EN LAS CERCANIAS DE SU CASA, TIENE 31 AÑOS , 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ERASTO URBINA 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA LETICIA MIGUELA SANCHEZ HERNANDEZ (VENTA DE CARBON), MARIA IRMA SANCHEZ LOPEZ (VENTA DE PERFUMES), KARLA G. G. (VENTA DE ROPA) Y ELENA MARTINEZ MARTINEZ (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS) SUS PRESTAMO LO USARAN PARA INVERTIR EN CADA UNO DE SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO LO NECESARIO PARA MEJOR SURTIRLOS DE MERCADERIAS.

loans.use: Sale of Perfume and Cosmetics

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Christina L. is a widow with 6 children. Faced with the difficulties of singlehandedly providing for the basic needs of her family, she got her first loan from GHAPE in 1999, with which she raised money to pay school fees for her children and built a house for her family.

Having successfully invested and repaid all former loans, she now requests a loan of $800, with which she intends to carry out sales of foodstuffs and cultivate maize and cocoyam to sell for her family. With the profits she plans to continue paying school fees for her children and invest in her business.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase rice, corn, beans and other foodstuff

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.en:
Jhoana, like many women in El Alto, is a single mother of a 2 yeal old son. She was abandoned by her husband and lives with her parents in the Tahuantinsuyo neighborhood. She sells groceries and sweets from a small stand to support herself and her child.

This loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise for her small grocery stand. This is her second loan through IMPRO. Her positive credit rating and payment history qualify her for this additional loan to help her increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhoana, como muchas mujeres de la Ciudad de El Alto es madre soltera de un hijo de dos años de edad, el esposo la abandono; vive en las casa de sus padres en la Zona Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de el Alto. Es comerciante de Dulces y Abarrotes en su barrio y esta actividad es su principal ingreso con el cual se mantiene ella y su pequeño hijo.

El crédito es para incrementar mercadería en su pequeño puesto comercial. Este será el segundo crédito con Impro; su buen antecedente de pagos del primer crédito con la institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo para mejorar sus ingresos familiares.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

payments.comment: Early payoff. Client is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Senovio

texts.en:
Senovio has a small workshop where he manufactures chamarras (jackets), which he sells in the city of Cochabamba. This is how he makes his living and supports his six children - two who attend the state university and four who attend local schools. He lives in the Rio Seco neighborhood in El Alto.

He requests this loan to purchase raw materials (fabric and yarn). This will be his third loan through IMPRO. His excellent payment history qualifies him to apply for this loan, which will help him increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Senovio tiene su taller de costuras de chamarras, las cuales son comercializadas en la Ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta es su principal actividad y por ende su principal ingreso que le permite la manutención de sus 6 hijos, dos están en la Universidad Estatal y cuatro en la edad escolar. Vive en la Zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar materia prima (tela y fibra). Este será el tercer crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago de los créditos anteriores le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo para que mejores sus ingresos y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco is an artisan shoemaker specializing in men's shoes of medium quality. He has no family and lives alone in the Ferropetrol neighborhood of El Alto.

He is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials - leather, lining materials and inplants - to meet the increased demand he has seen since 2004.

This will be his 5th loan with IMPRO; his excellent payment history qualifies him to receive this loan, which will allow him to expand his shoe production and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es artesano y elabora calzados de varón de mediana calidad. Vive solo y no tiene familia. Su casa esta localizada en la Zona Ferropetrol de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que solicita será para comprar materia prima: cuero, forros y plantillas, y así satisfacer la demanda que de acuerdo a sus indicaciones se ha ido incrementando en el transcurso de estos años, desde el año 2004.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de pago de los cuatro créditos anteriores le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo para que mejoren sus ingresos e incrementar la producción de sus calzados.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio has two sons, ages 2 and 3. He works as a construction worker alongside his wife and they live in his parents' home. They have no other income.

Because construction work is too strenuous for his wife, they would like for her to start a business selling habas (similar to green peas) in the rural areas of La Paz.

The loan will be used as seed money to buy inventory to start her new business. Habas are a main food staple of the rural families of Bolivia; they are boiled and served with cheese and potatos.

This is Julio's first loan with IMPRO and he has been evaluated and found to qualify. The loan will enable him to improve his wife's working conditions while allowing her to contribute to the family's support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio tiene dos hijo de 2 y 3 años de edad. Trabaja de albañil juntamente con su esposa y viven en la casa de sus padres. No tienen otros ingresos. El trabajo de albañil es un trabajo muy pesado para su esposa, por tal motivo la señora trabajara de comerciante de Haba en las zonas rurales de La Paz. El crédito requerido será utilizado como capital de arranque para la compra de mercadería (habas) y así iniciar esta nueva actividad. Para vuestra información, las habas son hortalizas muy parecidas a las alverjas cuyo nombre en ingles es “green peas”, solo que son mas grandes. Las habas son alimento esencial para la gente del campo, pues se pueden hervir y se comen con queso y papa. Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado, de esa forma Julio podrá ofrecerle mejor condición de trabajo para su esposa y esta misma ayudara a la manutención de la familia.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a young entrepreneur who runs a small auto repair shop out of his home and employs an assistant. He lives alone in the Rio Seco neighborhood of El Alto and currently attends auto mechanic classes to specialize his training.

He will use this loan to acquire tools (specifically a bench drill) and raw material for repair work (copper).

This is his first loan with IMPRO; the socio-economic evaluation determined that he qualifies to receive this loan to enable him to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Andres, joven emprendedor que tiene su taller de Electro Mecánico de Vehículos en su domicilio, tiene un ayudante, vive solo en zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto, actualmente esta estudiando en un instituto para especializarse mas sobre la mecánica vehicular. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para comprar herramienta (taladro de mesa) y materia prima (Cobre). Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación socio-económica califica a Andres para otorgarle el préstamo y de esa forma incentivar el crecimiento de su taller.

loans.use: To purchase tools and raw material

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio runs a minibus transport service which generates enough income to support his wife and three small children. They live in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood in El Alto, where running water and sewer facilities are just now being installed.

He is requesting this loan to install the plumbing necessary to connect his home to the city sewer service. This will greatly improve the family's living conditions.

This is Patricio's first credit request with IMPRO and he has qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricio tiene un minibús de servicio público donde genera sus ingresos para la manutención de sus tres pequeños hijos y esposa; vive en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto, donde recién están instalando agua potable y alcantarillado. El crédito requiere para la instalación Alcantarillado en su domicilio. Se denomina Alcantarillado a la conexión que se efectúa para enviar las aguas usadas en la casa a la matriz de desagüe que pasa por la calle (debajo de la calle, actualmente). Así de esta forma las condiciones de higiene en la casa van a mejorar notablemente. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado. Este crédito cae bajo la línea de Vivienda, sector refacción.

loans.use: To connect his home plumbing to municipal sewer facilities

payments.comment: early pay off. Client is applying for a second loan.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Mr. Sandigo is a professional artist. His work is well known in his native country and he's beginning to gain international recognition due to the many tourists who purchase his paintings and take them abroad. He is married and has three children who attend school full time.

He is requesting this loan to purchase art supplies and materials to be used in the creation of his artwork - brushes, paints, canvases, solvents and, in particular, wood frames, which are the most expensive component but also provide the crucial finishing touch to his paintings. This loan will allow him to complete a large number of paintings to mount an exhibition and increase his sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. S. es artista de profesión, sus obras son muy reconocidas a nivel nacional y sus cuadros se están dando a conocer en el extranjero debido a que muchos turistas están comprando sus obras. Es casado y padre de 3 hijos, los cuales se están dedicando de lleno a sus estudios, en la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para comprar las materias primas con las cuales realiza sus obras de arte, entre los materiales que quiere comprar están: Pinceles, pinturas, lienzos, diluyentes y especialmente quiere el dinero para comprar los marcos de madera, ya que es lo más caro y es lo que le da el punto final a sus obras. El crédito le permitirá elaborar una cantidad mayor de cuadros y podrá por ende montar una exhibición para venderlos y elevar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials for his paintings and artwork.

payments.comment: During our latest audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Sandigo was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.en:
Mrs. Perez has been in sales for 15 years; she got started in business selling used clothing and cosmetics door to door and by visiting places of employment, where she offered convenient payment plans. She is currently married and has two school-age children.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the acquisition of second hand electronics and small appliances which she plans to repair, refurbish and resell. She hopes this increased inventory will help her expand her sales and result in improved living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. es comerciante desde hace más de 15 años, dio sus primeros pasos en los negocios vendiendo ropa usada y productos cosméticos en diferentes instituciones a las que visitaba y ofrecía sus productos al crédito, en la actualidad está casada y es madre de 2 niños en edad escolar.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos usados para repararlos o darles mantenimiento y posteriormente venderlos, espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus inventario y por ende se incrementen sus ventas para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase, repair and refurbish used small appliances and electronics for resale

payments.comment: During our latest audit, we were unable to verify that Ms. Perez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and hope you continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Mr. B. is married and has two children. He owns a small repair shop where he fixes and maintains electronics. He currently has a large number of customers and would like to expand his shop and hire another technician to help him expand and expedite service and improve customer satisfaction.

He hopes the capital from this loan will help give his shop a more professional appearance and result in additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. B. es casado y padre de 2 niños, además es propietario de un taller de reparación y mantenimiento de electrodomésticos, en la actualidad cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes y quiere agrandar su taller para brindarles una mejor atención, quiere contratar los servicios de otro técnico en reparación para acelerar los tiempos de entrega y que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con la rapidez del servicio. Espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus ingresos y que le de una presentación más profesional a su taller.

loans.use: To make improvements to his shop and to purchase supplies

payments.comment: Our latest audit was unable to verify that Mr. Baltodano was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and hope you continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Karla

texts.en:
Mrs. Pavon is a young single mother with a knack for sewing; she has used this skill to start a business manufacturing and selling mattresses, pillows, sheets and other products for the home.

She is requesting this loan to purchase raw material such as thread, needles, fabric, cotton and foam to be used in the fabrication of her products. This additional investment will allow her to increase her sales and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. es una joven madre soltera con mucha facilidad para la costura, debido a esto se ha dedicado a la confección de colchones, almohadas, sábanas y otros productos para el hogar. Esta solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales (hilos, agujas, tela, algodón, esponjas, etc.) que le permitan confeccionar sus productos. Con el crédito espera incremetnar sus ventas y por ende mejorar la situación económica de sus familiares.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for  the manufacturing of mattresses and pillows

payments.comment: Our latest audit was unable to verify that Ms. Pavon was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and hope you continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.es:
Mr. Eriberto is 54 years old, married, and he lives with his wife Porfiria Torres. They have four children, all adults. Two of them work in Argentina and send a bit of money home every month to support their parents; the other two live with them: one works for the city government and the other one works for the town management.

Several years ago, Mr. Eriberto opened a grocery store in their home, where he, with the help of his wife, sells all kinds of basic needs goods like sugar, pasta, flour, diary, eggs, etc.

His business is doing very well because it is located in an area where there is not much competition. Mr. Eriberto is requesting a loan of $300 that he plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of drinks like soft drinks, juices, and beer. The demand for these products is very high and this will help him to increase his profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

El señor Eriberto tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa Porfiria Torres; tienen cuatro hijos, todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos se encuentran en la Argentina trabajando y mensualmente envían un poco de dinero a sus padres para ayudarlos; sus otros dos hijos viven con ellos y uno trabaja en la Gobernación de la ciudad y el otro en la Municipalidad.

Hace siete años, don Eriberto abrió una despensa en su casa, donde ayudado por su esposa, vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, tales como azúcar, fideos, harina, productos lácteos, huevos, etc.

Su negocio marcha muy bien, ya que se encuentra en una zona donde no abundan negocios de este tipo. Eriberto solicita el crédito de $ 300 que los desea invertir en la compra al por mayor de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos y cerveza puesto que la demanda de estos productos es bastante alta y esto ayudará a aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: To invest in the wholesale purchase of drinks like soft drinks, juices, and beer

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Business: Tend the store, make traditional weaved cloth and do other home-based work. The loan will be invested in stocking the store with many things that are not stocked now. She hopes, as a consequence, to fill the store and increase her earnings.

Dona Catarina is married to don Jacinto Raymundo Santiago y they now have three children. Before, Jacinto wanted to continue his studies and, after some thought, they agreed to start their little store. She tended the store and made her cloth and last year, at last, her husband graduated as a teacher. This was one of dona Catarina’s dreams, a dream that she and her husband have now fulfilled, with her husband working in the community and she at her store. She hopes now to fill her store and increase her earnings.

Written by Juana Cedillo.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Actividad: cuido de la tienda y elaboración de tejidos típicos y actividades en su hogar. La inversión del crédito es para surtir su tienda ya que hay muchas cosas que no tiene la tienda. Los resultados que espera es tener lleno su tienda y obtener más ganancias.

Doña Catarina esta casada con don Jacinto Raymundo Santiago y actualmente tienen tres hijos, pero el esposo estaba ansioso de seguir sus estudios y se pusieron de acuerdo y pensaron su pequeña tienda. Y ella cuidaba la tienda y a la vez elaboraba sus tejidos, y por fin el esposo se graduó el año pasado como maestro de Educación y ese fue uno de los sueños que doña catarina logro con su esposo pues actualmente el trabajo en su comunidad y ella se dedica a su tienda.

Escrito por facilitadora Juana Cedillo.

loans.use: To stock her store with many things that she doesn't have now.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Ms. Irene is 47 years old and single. She lives with her two children. One of them is 16 years old and studies in a public high school in the city; her older daughter is 20 and is a dance teacher; she also helps her mother in her dressmaking workshop.

Irene has been a dressmaker for more than 30 years. She has her own workshop in her home. She studied dressmaking and tailoring in the city of Yaguarón, which is located a few kilometers from the city of Paraguarí, where she currently lives. Irane makes all kind of clothes, especially night gowns, pants, and skits. Thanks to her high quality of work, she has a good clientèle.

Irena wants to buy a new sewing machine, since she has recently gotten orders of shirts for school and office uniforms. The machine she currently has is not suited to make the collars of the shirts. The price of this type of machine is $600, and she is requesting a loan for this that she will pay back in 12 months.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra. Irene tiene 47 años; es soltera, y vive con sus dos hijos. Uno de ellos tiene 16 años y actualmente está estudiando en un colegio público de la ciudad, su hija mayor tiene 20 años es profesora de danza y también ayuda a su madre en su taller de costura.

Irene es modista hace más de 30 años, ella tiene su taller propio en su casa; estudió corte y confección en una ciudad llamada Yaguarón que queda a unos pocos Km. de la ciudad de Paraguarí, donde ella vive actualmente. Irene confecciona todo tipo de prendas, especialmente vestidos de noche, pantalones y faldas; gracias a su buen trabajo posee muy buena clientela formada.

Irene desea adquirir una máquina más de coser, pues últimamente ha recibido pedidos de camisas para colegios y oficinas y la máquina que tiene actualmente no realiza el tipo de costura necesario para el cuello de las camisas. El costo de la máquina de coser de este tipo es de $ 600 y para ello solicita un crédito que se compromete a devolverlos en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Diosnel

texts.es:
Diosnel is 32 years old, married, and the father of 2 girls. His daughters study in a private school in the city and are excellent students. Diosnel tells us that his ultimate goal is that they continue to study and that they will finish sometime in the future so they will have better opportunities in life.

In the beginning, Diosnel owned the only icecream store in the neighborhood that he ran with his wife. Over time, he was able to save some of his profits and he started a store selling spare parts for motorcycles. They started to assemble motorcycles in the country, and there is a increasing demand for spare parts. Thanks to this visionary idea, he has been able to get ahead and he obtained a higher income for his family.

His idea is to buy more spare parts for motorcycles and general accessories. For this, he is requesting a loan of $700 that he will invest in the purchase of these spare parts. This way, he will be able to increase his merchandise stock, especially since the demand has increased in the last few months.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Diosnel tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y es padre de 2 niñas. Sus hijas se encuentran estudiando en un colegio privado de la ciudad y son excelentes alumnas, Diosnel nos cuenta que su mayor anhelo es que ambas sigan estudiando y el día de mañana concluir una carrera para poder obtener mayores oportunidades en la vida.

En principio, Diosnel, tenía una heladería que era la única de la zona que atendía junto con su esposa; con el tiempo pudo ahorrar con las ganancias que le generaba la heladería y monto una casa de repuesto para motos, ya que en la actualidad en el país se está empezando a ensamblar motocicletas y hay una creciente demanda de repuestos, gracias a esta visionaria idea están logrando salir adelante, y obtuvo un ingreso más para la familia.

Su idea es comprar más repuestos para motos y accesorios en general, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 700 que lo invertirá en la compra de los repuestos; de esta manera podrá ampliar su stock de mercaderías, ya que en los últimos meses ha acrecentado la demanda de los mismos.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Nila Alonso D. O. is 58 years old, married, and has a 23 years old daughter. She is a student; she studies Business Administration at the university. Her husband has had a bakery for more than 15 years and together they run a bakery that they opened in their home.

Every day, Nilda and her husband get up early and start making bread. Once ready, Nilda opens up the store while her husband delivers to nearby customers like grocery stores, supermarkets, etc. Thanks to the profits the business generates, they have been able to pay for her daughter's studies and they can live in a dignified way.

Nilda is requesting a loan of $600 that she plans to use to buy more base materials line flour, sugar, yeast, anise, etc. because the demand of their products has increased significantly in the last few months.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra. Nilda Alonso D. O. tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene una hija D. 23 años, ella es estudiante y actualmente se encuentra cursando la carrera D. Administración D. Empresas en la Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la panadería hace ya más D. 15 años y juntos administran una panadería que abrieron en su casa.

Todos los días Nilda junto con su esposo, se levantan temprano y comienzan su labor D. preparar los panificados; una vez elaborados, Nilda abre su local y los venD. en la misma panadería, mientras que su marido sale a entregar los pedidos a clientes D. la zona, como almacenes, supermercados, etc. Gracias a sus buenas ganancias ellos han podido pagar los estudios D. su hija y vivir D. forma digna.

Nilda solicita el crédito D. $ 600 con los que desea comprar más materia prima tales como harina, azúcar, levadura, anís, etc. ya que en los últimos meses han aumentado significativamente la demanda D. sus productos.

loans.use: to buy more base material like flour, sugar, yeast, anise, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia C. T. works at weaving, as well as raising chickens and other home-based work. Her dream is to set up a tailoring shop and, to start, she’s already bought a sewing machine. Now, she’s mulling over shops where she can operate a tailoring business. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of cloth and other materials that a tailoring business requires.

Lucia and her husband, Jose, have three children and together they’re fighting to get ahead and provide schooling for their kids. Their dream is to see their family overcome every obstacle.

The loan that they’ve asked for will be used to draw a good base of customers so that in the future they’ll be able to have a tailoring business even larger than the one they used to dream about.

Written by Juana Cedillo.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia C. T. se dedica a las actividades en el hogar y el cuido de sus pollos y a la vez de sus tejidos. Su sueño es poner una sastrería, y para empezar ya compraron una maquina de coser ahora están pensando en un local donde pueda funcionar la sastrería. Este prestamo se usara para invertirlos en la compra de tela y otros materiales que son necesarios en una sastrería

Lucia está unida con José y tienen tres hijos y juntos luchan para poder salir adelante y darles el estudio a sus hijos. Que es el sueño de ellos es ver triunfar a su familia.

Los resultados que esperan es llegar a tener una buena clientela y así en un futuro mejor poder tener una sastrería más grande de lo que soñaban.

Escrito por Facilitadora Juana Cedillo.

loans.use: To Invest in her tailoring shop

loans.name: Alicibiades

texts.es:
Mr. Alcibiades Ramírez is 47 years old, and married with Mrs. Carmen Riveros (43). They have 3 children of 16, 15, and 6 years old respectively. The first two go to secondary school, the youngest is in primary school.

Alcibiades has owned a grocery store at his home for 7 years. He sells all kinds of basic goods like sugar, pasta, milk, eggs, vegetables, etc. Before that, he worked as a driver for a company that distributes bottled water. He decided to open the business because in the neighborhood where he lives, there are not many grocery stores and there is a not much competition.

He told us that the loan he is requesting is to buy wholesale merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, and herbs, which will allow his to lower the cost base of his merchandise and offer more variety to his customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

El señor Alcibiades Ramírez tiene 47 años y está casado con la señora Carmen Riveros de 43 años; tienen 3 hijos de 16,15 y 6 años respectivamente, los dos primeros están cursando la secundaria y el menor está realizando los estudios primarios.

Alcibiades posee una despensa en su domicilio desde hace 7 años, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, fideos, leche, huevos, verduras, etc.; anteriormente trabajaba como chofer para una Empresa dedicada a la distribución de Agua Mineral. Decidió abrir el negocio debido a que en la zona donde vive no cuentan con muchos comercios dedicados a ese ramo, por lo que no tiene mucha competencia.

Nos comenta que el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías en mayor volumen como ser arroz, azúcar, harina y yerba lo cual le permitirá abaratar el costo de sus mercaderías y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, and herbs

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana María A. is 58 years old. She has been separated for 20 years. She has 4 children: 3 sons of 36, 31, and 28 that work and live in Argentina (neighboring country). The youngest, a daughter, is 26 years and lives with her mother. She works in an import business and she helps her mother with the household expenses.

Ana tells us that she used to lived with her children in Argentina, but that she decided to return to Paraguay 15 years ago with her youngest daughter. With her modest savings, she opened a grocery store in her home, where she sells all kinds of basic needs products like rice, sugar, oil, flour, diary, meat, etc.

Ana also told us that thanks to a previous loan from the Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to grow and strengthen her business. At this point, Ana is requesting a new loan that she plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of sugar, flour, and meat. With this, she will be able to obtain good discounts and increase her profit margin.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

La señora Ana María A. tiene 58 años, ella es separada hace ya 20 años, ella tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son varones y tienen 36, 31 y 28 respectivamente, ellos trabajan y viven en la Argentina (país limítrofe), la más pequeña tiene 26 años vive con su madre y trabaja en una empresa de importaciones y apoya a su madre con los gastos de la casa.

Ana nos comenta que anteriormente vivía con sus hijos en Argentina, pero hace 15 años tomó la decisión de volver a Paraguay junto con su hija menor. Con unos pocos ahorros que pudo juntar, ella abrió una despensa en su casa, donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, tales como arroz azúcar, aceite, harina, lácteos, carnes etc.

Ana nos cuenta que gracias a préstamos obtenidos anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo ver crecer y fortalecer su negocio. Hoy, Ana está solicitando un nuevo crédito que lo desea invertir en compra al por mayor de azúcar, harina y carne pues con eso podrá obtener importantes descuentos y aumentar su margen de ganacias.

loans.use: wholesale purchase of sugar, flour, and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new styles of clothing

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Luis and his wife sell clothing. They have set up a part of their home as a store for their clients to come and visit. During the day, Luis travels to the rural sector of Ecuador in his truck offering his products in the small towns. While he is away, his wife sells the clothing from their home. Luis started selling clothes after losing a job he held in a large company for about 15 years. He bought a used truck and started investing all of his savings.

He now needs this, his second loan, because he wants to continue investing in new styles of clothing and shoes. He will also try to invest in a new line of products such as soaps, detergents and other household items. He is 65 years old and has 2 children with his wife.

loans.use: Invest in more clothes and a line of cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue buying more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a new glass display case and purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Dona Maria D. Jesus Lopez Villatoro and her husband, don Carlos Romeo Guzman Cruz, have 8 children. Dona Maria sells ice cream, but she needs a loan to build a large pen to raise chickens.

Dona Maria lives in the village of Rio Azul near the town of Nebaj. Don Carlos is a baker. He bakes bread to order and then distributes the bread to stores in the towns of Cotzal and Chajul.

Dona Maria’s dream is to buy a refrigerator to keep her ice-creams and choco-manias as the one that she used to have belonged to a sister. What she plans to do now is raise more chickens to add to the ones that you have already helped her to get.

Written by Juana Cedillo, a project coordinator at Friendship Bridge.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria D. J. L. Villatoro y esta unida con don Carlos Romeo Guzmán Cruz y tienen ocho hijos y su negocio es una venta D. helados y ella necesita un crédito para construir un corral granD. para la crianza D. pollos

Vive en la aldea Río Azul del municipio D. Nebaj Don Carlos es panadero y hace pedidos y los va a repartir en cada tienda que le hace pedidos en el municipio D. cotzal y chajul.

El sueño D. doña Maria es comprar una refri para poder seguir haciendo helados y choco manías ya que la que tenia era D. una hermana, pero lo que tiene previsto ahora es criar mas pollos. Ya que los que tiene pues la a ayudado mucho.

Escrito por Juana Cedillo, Facilitadora para Friendship Bridge.

loans.use: To build a large pen for raising chickens.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen S. is 32 years old and earns $3 a day selling fish. She has a husband (pictured) who grows a variety of vegetables. Together they have 3 children. Yen S. is a hardworking woman who would like to expand her business and improve efficiency by purchasing a motorcycle so that she can transport the fish that she sells more easily.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for business purposes

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Yen Sophea has successfully repaid this Kiva loan.

Thanks to your investment, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou S. is a 33 year old woman. She is married with 2 children, both of whom are students. She raises chickens and ducks on her husband's farm in order to sell their eggs for additional income. She currently earns $9 a day from this activity, but she feels there is much more potential for the sale of eggs and so she would use this loan to buy more ducks and therefore have more eggs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: Mrs. Ing Sarim is a 35 year old widow, with two chldren who are both students. Currently she makes $8 a day by making and selling beef soup. She would like to use the loan to increase the amount of beef soup she can make so as to meet growing customer demand.

loans.use: to invest in her shop

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat S. is a 32 year old widow who has one child who is too young to attend school. Phat S. earns $9 a day selling fruit. This loan is to help her mother, who currently earns $4 a day selling dry fish, who would like to expand her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.use: for her mother to purchase more dry fish

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Phat Sokhim has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thanks to support like yours, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. 

We hope you will continue your support of entrepreneurs through Kiva and CREDIT MFI.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mr. Thoung K. is a 57 year old widower who has one child who is a garment worker. Thoung K. currently earns $1 a day farming and selling fruit, and would like to expand his business by purchasing more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Yoeu

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeu P. is a 21 year old woman who currently earns $2 a day working as a grocer. She would like to receive a loan so that she can purchase more grocery products to sell. In the future she would like to expand her business further by adding a variety of products to her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin H. is 24 years old, and married with 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and earns $1 a day. Chin H. earns $5 a day by selling duck eggs to people in her community. She would like to purchase a motorcycle so that she can expand her business outside her community.

loans.use: to purcase a motorcycle so that she can make her business more mobile.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chin Houy has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you make it possible for entrepreneurs around the world to access loans to invest into their small businesses and families. 

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is 45 years old and mother to one child, who is employed by a nearby garment factory. She owns a stall selling porridge to the people in her community, while her husband is self-employed as a tuk tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motorcycle) driver.
Together, Sin S. and her husband can typically make up to $20 each day. They will use this loan to purchase some equipment for their stall and a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for her stall and a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin L. is 37 and married with 3 children. One of the children is a student and the others earn $2.5 per day selling sugar cane juice. Yin L. and her husband make $5 a day making and selling traditional Khmer  cake. Yin L. and her husband would now like to expand their business by buying a stall to sell vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a stall to sell vegetables.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
