He is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and earns up to $10 a day, while his wife makes around $2 a day working at a factory. This loan will be used to purchase another motorcycle for Mr. S. to operate his business.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Chu

texts.en: Mrs. Chou S. is 39 years old and earns $2 a day planting vegetables to sell. Her husband is a contruction worker who earns $2 a day. She has one child who is a goldsmith. This loan will be used to help him expand his business by allowing him to purchase more tools.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for her son who is a goldsmith.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chu Sakhorb has repaid this Kiva loan early!

Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help them support their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue investing in Kiva entrepreneurs.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N. is 42 years old and a widow. She works at a garment factory where she earns about $3 a day. She has 7 children, 2 of which are construction workers and 3 who are students. The other 2 sell eggs to people in the province. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorcycle so that her children can travel further and therefore sell more eggs.

loans.use: To purchase a motor cycle for her children to sell eggs to people in the province

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Bun Nath has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you make it possible for entrepreneurs around the world to access loans to invest into their small businesses and families. 

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun S. is 31 years old and married with one child. She earns $1 a day selling grocery products. Her husband works as a carpenter and earns around $5 a day. This loan will be use to improve and expand the carpentry business by purchasing more tools.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools to expand her husband's business

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart to all lenders.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im S. is a 50 year old housewife. She has 4 children, one of which is a student. The other three are garment workers. Her husband (pictured here) earns $5 a day charging batteries for vehicles. Their business would greatly improve if they had this loan so that they could buy a new battery charger. They have high hopes for expansion of the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new battery charging machine

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman H. lives in Beylagan, a small town in southwest Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fusuli region. He is married and he has two children. Suleyman is engaged in vegetable and fruit sales. He sells watermelon in the Beylagan city bazaar. Suleyman established his business 5 years ago. He has one employee who helps him to sell his goods. Suleyman sells watermelons and fruits in summer, potatoes in winter. He needs $1000 to increase his business and the number of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more kind of goods

loans.name: Gulsum

texts.en:
Gulsum J. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwest Azerbaijan. She is married and she has one son. Gulsum sells different clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. She rented a small booth there and she pays a daily tax it. She established her business 16 years ago. She goes to Baku two times a month to buy goods to sell.

Gulsum’s business is not going very well because she hasn't much money to increase the variety of her goods. She needs $700 to buy more kinds of goods and increase her daily income.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Loas

texts.en: Mrs. Loas Y. is a 37 year old widow. She has 2 children who are both students. Laos Y. earns $4 a day making rooves out of leaves and selling wood. She would like this loan so that she can purchase more tools to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tools for her business

loans.name: Elminaz

texts.en: Elminaz A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the southwest Azerbaijan. She is a Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region. Elminaz is married and she has 5 children and 4 grandchildren. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar, where she rented a small booth. She established her business 14 years ago. Her son helps her to sell fruits and vegetables. Elminaz needs $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun N. is a 34 year old widow. She is a farmer, who earns about $5 a day from this activity. She would like to use this loan to buy 10 more pigs to add to her livestock and also to purchase fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy 10 pigs and purchase fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher B. is a 26-year-old inhabitant of Fayzabad district. He has an advanced education, specializing in the law. He is married and has 1 child. After university graduation, Alisher entered a notarial office, but the salary was not enough and Alisher decided leave that job and look for a new job and source of income.

He started trading and set aside part of his home as a shop where he sells food products. Local inhabitants can buy the food products near their home, which helps to save time and money. He has been in this business for 2 years. For the loan amount of $1200 he is going to increase the range of his products. Alisher is going to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase turnover, and buy food products

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en: Nghem P. is 44 years old. She has 2 children. One is a garment worker, the other helps on her plantation. Her husband is a farmer who earns $2 a day by selling vegetables, which he grows on his plantation. Nghem P. herself is a talented weaver and earns about $2 a day from this activity. She intends to improve her business with this loan by buying a motorbike to transport her goods to market. She will also use the loan to purchase more weaving tools.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and weaving tools

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok N., 38, is a housewife living in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia with her husband, 32. They have 3 children, all of whom are students. Her husband works in retail - buying and selling motorbikes - and earns $6 a day from this activity. Sok N. would use the loan to purchase a motorcycle so that her husband can get to his place of work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to go to work

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang M., 35, and her husband, 45, live in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Her husband grows vegetables and works as a fisherman, earning $10 a day. Lang M. sells the vegetables that her husband grows and earns $8 a day. Lang is requesting this loan so that she and her husband can build a house. She is a hard working woman, who one day hopes to own her own stall at the market.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum T. is a 31 year widow with one child who lives with her mother (pictured here) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her entire family, she is employed at a garment factory and can earn around $2.5 each day. This loan will be used to repair their house in order to protect it from the leaking during the rainy season. In the future, Mrs T. hopes to save enough money to own a stall at a market selling food or vegetables.

loans.use: To repair a house

loans.name: Thuon

texts.en: Mrs. V. Thuon, who is 30 years old, lives in the Prey V. Province of Cambodia with her husband. She owns a grocery store, which earns her $6 a day. Her husband would like to work in the transportation business, but does not have the funds to buy the necessary motorcycle with a trailer attached. Mrs. V. Thuon therefore intends to use this loan to help her husband start this business, which they estimate will bring in $7 a day.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and a motorbike

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira worked at the hospital as a nurse for10 years, but today life conditions compel her to have a business for supporting her family. Her husband drives a microbus. They have two children, a boy and a girl, who are students.

Munira rented one little shop in the Kistakuz big market, in Khujand. She buys different kinds of dishes, makes presents from the dishes, and sells them. She also sells pillows and towels. She included these items to attract more clients. She orders her supplies from China. Her daughter helps her to sell the items in the shop after her lessons.

Munira requests 200USD to expand her assortment of items to sell. She wants to buy modern dishes from China.

In the photo, you can see her daughter Mutribahon.

loans.use: Business development.

loans.name: Bimarziya

texts.ru:
Bimarziya K. has a cattle farm at home. She is married and has 6 children. Bimarziya’s husband is retired; her children are all grown up and have their own families. For a few years now, with the help of her husband, Bimarziya raises and resells cattle. In 2005, when Bimarziya joined MicroInvest lending program, her business assets were worth $1200. After receiving the loan and through targeted investment, Bimarziya increased her business assets up to $2000. She used the money to purchase more cattle. In the future, Bimarziya plans to further increase the number of animals and improve the feeding area of the farm.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Калонова Бимарзия - занимается скотоводством дома. Замужем, имеет шестеро детей. Муж пенсионер, дети взрослые и каждый имеет свою семью. Вот уже несколько лет она занимается откормом и купля продажей крупнорогатого скота. В этой деятельности помогает ей, её муж. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2005 году, тогда у нее активы были на 1200$. После получения займа и целевого использования, её активы возросли до 2000$. Она приобрела крупнорогатый скот. В будущем планирует увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить место для откорма.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals and improve the feeding area of the farm

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich N. is 46 years old. She and her husband have 7 children - 2 are garment workers, 1 is a security guard and the rest are students. Her husband works as an intermediary, buying and selling plots of land for $6 a day. Pich N. is a fish-selling street vendor, which currently earns her $25 a day. She would now like to increase her earnings by buying a great stock of fish, which will allow her to more effectively meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for her inventory

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan S., 37, lives with her husband and her 5 children in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Mrs. Lan S., her husband and 2 of their children work together selling gasoline, earning $18 per day between them. The other 3 children are students. She would now like to increase their earnings by purchasing vegetables to sell at home, and for this reason she is taking out a $600 loan.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru:
Musharaf O., 50 is a married mother of 7 daughters. She has been raising cattle for 9 years. Musharaf’s husband works as a driver and her two daughters work at a confectionery. Musharaf began her cattle business since she moved to dacha.* Then, she had a cow and a calf. In 2005, when Musharaf joined MicroInvest, she received $150 loan. Gradually, she expanded the size of her farm and increased the number of cattle. Musharaf improved quality of life for her family. She increased her business assets to $1000 on which she receives $600 income. In the future, Musharaf plans to increase the variety and headcount of her livestock.

*TRANSLATOR’S NOTE. The meaning of the word dacha,as it used here, is different from that commonly found in an English dictionary. Since the late 80s, it became increasingly popular in the former USSR republics for the local government to sell or distribute small parcels of lend to people (oftentimes as small as 20 x 20 meters) for building dachas or summer houses. Since collapse of the USSR, many dacha owners turned them into tiny farms to feed their families.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Окилова Мушараф - 50 лет. Замужем, имеет семь дочек, опыт в скотоводстве 9 лет. Муж работает шофером, двое дочерей работают в кондитерском цехе. Начала заниматься животноводством, когда переехала на дачный участок, тогда она имела корову с теленком. Клиентом «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, она получила 150$. Постепенно она расширила место откорма и приобрела несколько видов скота. Также она улучшила уровень жизни своей семьи. Сейчас ее активы возросли до 1000$ и она получает 600$. В будущем планирует приобрести не только крупнорогатый скот, но и другие виды скотов.

loans.use: To increase the total number of livestock

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Mr. Korng I. is 68 years old and a father of 2 children. He and his wife ( picture here) own a store sellI. grocery products to the people in their community and can approximately make $2.50 each day. One of their children helps in financI. the household by workI. as a motor-taxi driver, while the other child is enrolled in school. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for the son to operate his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Meak

texts.en: Mrs. Meak N. is a widow and lives with her 6 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a fruit seller, earning around $2.50 each day, while three of her children work in a garment factory and the other three are students. This loan will be used to repair her house because it frequently leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair a house

loans.name: Hai Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Hai Kim E., who is 35 years old, and her husband (pictured) live in Phnom Penh together with 2 of their 4 children (both students). She is a garment worker who earns $2.60 per day. Her husband currently works as a '"cyclo" driver (a cyclo is a vehicle used for transporting people around towns in Cambodia. The driver sits on a bicycle at the back and peddles the people, who sit in chairs at the front, to their destination). However, now he wants to buy a motorcycle so that he can operate a motor-taxi, which is a more lucrative and less difficult business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Srouy is a mother of four children and makes her living by producing wine and selling it to a wholesaler or to the people in her community. This business venture earns her around $2 each day, while her husband earns between $3 to $4/day from working as a mechanic. The loan will allow her to purchase tools to help in her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools to help in her business

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Kim Srouyq start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Nghul

texts.en: Mrs. Nghul P. is 61 years old and a housewife living in Phnom Penh with her son, who is employed as a security guard and earns $7 per day. She would like to purchase this motorcycle for her son, so that he can make additional income from operating a motor-taxi business when he has time off from work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son so that he can operate a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea L. is 62 years old and lives with her husband, who is 63 (pictured), in Phonm Penh, Cambodia. She currently earns $3 per day selling vegetables at the market. Her husband would like to become a moto-taxi driver, from which he expects to earn $2 a day. Chea L. endeavors to use her loan to help her husband start this business.

loans.use: To buy a motor-cycle for her husband to run a business

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chea Leng start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Mrs. Noy K. is 57 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She stays at home to look after her grand-daughter. She has one son, who is married and who would like to run a motor-taxi business. Noy K. would like to take out this loan of $400 so that she can help her son start his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to run a business

loans.name: Mohy

texts.en:
Mohy rented one corner in the pharmacy of Kistakuz region, in Khudjand. She started her business in 1990. She used to work in the hospital as nurse, but the salary was not enough to support a big family. She is married and has 4 children.

She buys her medicine from Istaravshan, in Khudjand. Today the turnover is good and she has many customers. As her business is located near the big market of Kistakuz, Mohy sells her goods quickly. She goes on a trip every week to buy the medicine to sell.

This summer her younger son was seriously ill, and Mohy spent all her money for her son. Now she needs extra capital to purchase the new batch of medicine for her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. is 53 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband who is 58, and their 4 children. Her husband works as a fisherman, earning $3 a day. Two of their children are garment workers, one is an electrician and one is a student. Ly Y. would like to invest in an electric shop. She will use the loan to purchase second-hand televisions and radios, which she will then repair, enhance and finally re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase second hand televisions and radios to repair and enhance for re-selling

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a teacher of literature and worked at the school for 8 years. She is married and has two children. In 1990 she decided to start a business and opened her own shop. She sells pillows, towels and bedclothes. She travels herself to buy her goods from Bishkek, Kirgizistan.

Fotima became a client of Microinvest in 2003. Her first loan was $500, which she spent to purchase the goods to sell. Today she has many clients and her shop is one of the well known shops in the area.

In the autumn, she wants to purchase warm modern bedclothes to sell, and she requests $550 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchasing warm bedclothes to sell

loans.name: Sabajon

texts.ru:
Sabajon F., 35 is divorced and has one child. She has high school education. Her son attends school. Sabajon independently supports her family. She has been selling food products for 10 years. When Sabajon took her first MicroInvest loan in 2006, her total business assets were $750. Sabajon learned to run the business from her aunt. Gradually, step by step, she expanded the variety of goods sold and opened her own trading spot. Sabajon’s business assets have now grown to $2000. Sabajon began to sell retail as well as wholesale. She plans to purchase a store and expand the variety of goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзиева Сабачон – 35 лет. Разведенная, имеет одного ребёнка. Образование среднее. Сын ходит в школу. Семью содержит сама. Занимается реализацией продуктов питания, уже 10 лет. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2006году, тогда её активы составляли 750$. Она приобрела опыт в этой деятельности у своей тёте. Постепенно шаг за шагом она увеличила ассортимент товара, открыла свою торговую точку, сейчас её активы возросли до 2000$. Она стала продавать как в розницу, так и оптом. В будущем планирует приобрести магазин и увеличить наименование товаров

loans.use: To acquire a store and expand the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband and his two brothers have a big bakery at their big house. Their wives prepare the dough and bake the bread to sell in the bakery.

Today, they have many customers and they sell the bread quickly. Their bakery attracts more customers, because they use flour of high quality. Due to this fact, their bakery became one of the best bakeries in Kistakuz, Khudjand.

They received a lot of orders for September. So Mukaddas needs extra capital to purchase the flour for baking bread to fill the orders for September.

loans.use: For purchasing three sacks of flour

loans.name: Sotuk

texts.ru:
Sotuk YU., 52 is married and is a mother of 5 children. She has a high school education. For a few years, her husband has been working in Russia as a seasonal laborer. Sotuk’s children are all grown up. The two younger ones are helping their mother to sell (one of Sotuk’s daughters is on the photo). The older children have their own families. Sotuk has been in sales business for 5 years. She became a MicroInvest client in 2005. Then, all her business assets were worth $350. Before Sotuk learned about MicroInvest, she took out high-interest short-term loans from illegal local loan sharks. Gradually, with careful investment of the borrowed funds, Sotuk increased the variety of sold items. She also began to travel and purchase goods herself. Sotuk’s quality of life improved. She became an experienced borrower. Today, her business assets have grown four times to $1500. She now plans to open her own wholesale store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсуфова Сотук- 52года. Замужем, мать пятерых детей. Образование среднее специальное. Муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках. Дети взрослые, двое младших помогают матери в торговле, у остальных своя отдельная семья. Опыт работы в торговле продуктов питания 5лет. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 2005года, тогда её активы составляли 350$. До того как она была информирована о программе «Микроинвест» она брала краткосрочные кредиты с большой процентной ставкой у местных нелегальных кредиторов. Постепенно после активного использования займа она расширила наименования товара и кроме того сдала ездить за товаром сама. Изменилось уровень жизни, и стала информированной опытной заемщицей. Сейчас её активы достигли до 1500$. В будущем планирует открыть собственный оптовый магазин. P. S-На фото её дочь

loans.use: To open a wholesale store

loans.name: Ochaoy

texts.en:
Ochaoy is a pretty old woman. She has 7 children and 4 grandchildren. She is a pensioner, but she does not want to sit at home. She has her own stall in the Kistakuz market, in Khujand.

Ochaoy sells children's clothes and the national headdress, which she embroiders herself. Her sons help her bring the goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. She has little profit, but she loves her activity. She has many customers, and sells her goods quickly.

In the autumn, she wants to purchase warm children clothes to sell, and she requests $300 for this purpose.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Dilorom is 39 years old, is married and is the mother of 2 children. She has a high school education. Her husband helps her in her business, the children study in school. She trades in foodstuff and drinks. She owns a store and has a large selection of products.

She started working with MicroInvest by borrowing $150, back then she bought products on installment from local wholesalers because she did not have enough cash as she also sold products to her clients on installment. Today her inventory has reached $1400. In the future she plans to transition to selling products wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердиева Дилором – 39лет. Замужем, мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Муж помогает в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Она занимается реализацией продуктов питания и напитков. Она имеет магазин и большой ассортимент товаров. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 150$, тогда она покупала товар на рассрочку у местных оптовиков, так как у нее не было достаточно наличии. Поскольку, она тоже в свою очередь реализовала товар своим клиентам в рассрочку. В настоящее время её активы составляют 1400$. Она планирует на будущее перейти на оптовую продажу товаров.

loans.use: to transition to the wholesale sale of commodities

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru:
Soliha is 44 years old, is married and has 4 children. She has a high school education. Her husband is a shoemaker, two daughters are married and the two younger children study in school and help their mother in her business. Soliha has 15 years of experience in selling. She sells perfumes and cosmetics. She started her business with $100.

Soliha became a client of MicroInvest in 2002. Back then she sold children’s clothing and received a loan of $70. Slowly, after non-stop borrowing and full use of existing products she transitioned to cosmetics and changed her place of business. Today she is asking for a loan of $1,175 in order to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хусейнова Солиха – 44лет. Замужем, имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Муж мастер по пошиву обуви, двое дочерей замужем, двое младших учатся в школе и помогают матери в торговле. Опыт работы в торговле 15лет. Она занимается торговлей парфюмерий и косметики. Начала свою деятельность с 100$. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала 2002году, тогда она торговала детской одеждой и получила займ на сумму 70$. Постепенно после непрерывного кредитования и целевого использования она перешла на продажу косметики и изменила место деятельности. В настоящее время она получает займ в размере 1175$. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru:
Alijon is 21 years old, he is a bachelor and has a high school education. He has 3 years of trading experience. He sells bicycle parts. Prior to this he helped his father to trade and then took the initiative and took on family responsibilities. He also fixes bicycles and sells bicycle parts at home.

Alijon became a MicroInvest client in 2006 when he received a $350 loan. In the beginning he only had one kiosk and his assets were worth $700. After receiving credit he acquired a second kiosk. Today his assets have increased to $1,120 and he has all types of parts in his inventory, not just locally made ones, but also ones made abroad. He plans to use the new loan to expand his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гаффоров Алиджон-21лет. Холост образование среднее. Опыт работы в торговле три года. Он торгует запчастями велосипеда. Раньше помогал отцу в торговле, затем взял инициативу и заботу о семье в свои руки. Также он занимается ремонтом велосипеда и продажей запчастей дома. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2006 году. Он получил займ в размере 350$. В начальном степе кредитования у него была только одна торговая точка (лавка) и активы его составляли 700$. После получения кредита он приобрел еще одну торговую точку. Сейчас его активы возросли до 1120,$ и он имеет в ассортименте все виды запчастей для велосипеда не только местного производства, но и производства других стран. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара.

loans.use: to increase product assortment

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina L. is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children in the neighborhood of Mahotas, in Maputo. She sells various food products from a bungalow in her home.

She joined this credit program in January 2006. Cristina took part in the group loan of 1,800MT, now she is entering the 5th stage of the program and plans on borrowing 8,000MT - payable back in 6 months - in order to increase the stock in her shop. Cristina has experienced gradual positive changes in her business and plans on investing the full value of the loan into her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina L. tem 35 anos de Idade e vive maritalmente com o seu esposo e 5 filhos no Bairro das Mahotas em Maputo. Tem uma barraca na sua residência onde vende diversos produtos alimentares.

Entrou para o Programa em Janeiro de 2006, tendo começado com um empréstimo grupal de 1.800 MT.Vai para o 5º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 8.000 MT pagaveis em 6 meses para reforçar o stock . Tem verificado melhoria gradual no seu negócio uma vez que todo o valor dos empréstimos é investido no mesmo.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a 42-year-old creative and energetic father of four, and a resident of Bobubomu, a Dar es Salaam city suburb. He is a trained technician, and has been in business running a workshop for welding and metal cutting. He has also a stationery shop alongside his workshop. He has got five people employed in his business and two relatives helping him. He welds and fabricates door and window frames, chairs and tables.

He is in need of USD 1200, so as to buy a modern cutting machine for his workshop, and expand stock in his stationery shop.

loans.use: Buy equipment for his workshop

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 30-year-old mother of two, a resident of the Lumo area in Dar Es Salaam. Rehema operates a salon and has a shop alon side her salon selling both used and new clothes. She has been in business for the past seven years. She started with petty businesses but ever since she joined YOSEFO, her life has changed tremendously. She is a recipient of Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) business training, which is conducted every year.

Her shop specializes in ladies' and kids' clothing; most of her customers in the salon are ladies. She can now afford to take her two kids to school, get a surplus to save, and pay back the loans she gets. Rehema is currently in need of USD 550 to buy a drier and chairs for her salon, and expand stock in her clothing shop as well.

loans.use: Buy equipment for her salon and expand stock in her shop

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela has more than 13 years of experience in the production and selling of clothing. She learned the trade from her mother and set up her own business after saving up money from a job as a housekeeper. She has a very modest workshop that is in need of more fabrics and other materials, but she works long hours in order to make ends meet. As a single mother, she relies heavily on this business and a part time job cleaning houses in order to feed and educate her 2 children. She is seeking her second loan with our program in order to continue buying more materials and improving her shop.

loans.use: Elaboracion de prendas de vestir

loans.name: Sembuli

texts.en:
O. Sembuli is a 31-year-old resident of Mbagala, married with one kid. She buys the rejected vitengi (cloth for ladies' garments) from the mills, modifies them by treatment with various colors and chemicals, and resells as both a wholesaler and a retailer. She is always on the move, in a group of her fellow business people, from one village to another targeting the weekly markets that are always conducted the villages. She has employed one person in her business who is always at the work site making the clothing when O. is away for business.

O. is currently in need of USD 750 to help her expand her business, buy huge quantities of the rejects from the industries, and more chemicals and colors for treatment. It’s her dream to get a permanent shop for her business in more than three villages.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials and pay employees

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.es:
Description of Business

Jhoana sells various snack items in her shop, as well as everyday products such as gift wrap, notebooks and drinks. She has been running this business for 7 years, opening the shop at 8 in the morning, and staying open until 9 at night every day of the week. Her husband helps her tend to the business, lending the necessary support that Jhoana requires.

Loan Use

Jhoana needs the loan to improve her shop, stock better merchandise and snack products. Some of her principal clients are the children from the neighboring area. In addition, with the level of clients she now has, and as a result of the efforts realized day after day, Jhoana needs to improve her location

Personal Information

Jhoana is 31 years old, and lives with her husband and her two children. As the children are still very young, they are not yet in school. Jhoana also works as a teacher in a school near her neighborhood. Jhoana aspires to grow her business, generating more revenue for the well being of her family, especially her children.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Jhoana se dedica a la venta de confites como: cachitos, chupetes galletas y venta de productos de bazar como: papel de regalos, alcoholes, cuadernos, etc... Teniendo como experiencia 7 años, trabajando en este tipo de negocio, abriendo el local muy temprano en la mañana desde las 8am hasta las 9pm, todos los días de la semana. En la cual su esposo le ayuda con la atención del negocio brindándole el apoyo necesario que Jhoana requiere.

Uso del Préstamo

Jhoana necesita el préstamo para adecuar el local, surtiéndolo de mayor mercadería y productos de confitería, ya que uno de sus principales clientes son los niños aledaños al sector. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Jhoana necesita adecuar el local, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Jhoana tiene 31 años de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad en la que por ser pequeños todavía no estudian, a parte Jhoana también es maestra de una escuela cerca del sector. Los anhelos de Jhoana es salir con su negocio a delante y extenderlo mucho mas, a mas de generar muchos mas ingresos, por el bienestar de su familia especialmente el de sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Improve and invest in her shop

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mwajabu is a 56-year-old energetic and dynamic mother of eight, a resident of the Kigamboni area in Dar es Salaam. She runs a shop selling cosmetics and a commuter bus for transport services within Kigamboni area, for which she employs a driver. She has been in business for the past four years, and ever since she joined micro finance institutions her life has positively changed. She attended business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation, and the knowledge she acquired has helped her improve her businesses.

She has recently repaid a loan of USD 750 within a shorter period of time than agreed, and now she is greatly in need of another USD 1200, to buy more stock for her shop and recondition her commuter bus.

loans.use: Expand business and recondition her commuter bus

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don José dedicates himself to the sale of encebollados, a traditional Ecuadorian dish, from his home and as a street vendor. He has 20 years of experience in this type of business , working every day of the week, from 6am to 11 am. His daughter takes charge of the business at home while he goes out to sell.

Loan Use

José needs the loan to improve his business at home and while selling as a street vendor by improving the aesthetics as a way to differentiate himself from the competition. As a result of his daily effort and due to the level of his customer base, José needs to upgrade his business.

Personal Information

José is 52 years old and lives with his wife and 3 adult children. His daughter is responsible for the business at home and his wife is a homemaker. His goals are to refurbish his home with safe and sound materials and to generate more income as a way to improve his family's well-being.

Descripción del Negocio

Don José se dedica a la venta de encebollados tanto en su domicilio como ambulantemente, teniendo como experiencia 20 años, trabajando en este tipo de negocio, abriendo el local muy temprano en la mañana desde las 6am hasta las 11am, todos los días de la semana. En la cual su hija le ayuda con la atención del negocio en el domicilio y José en la calle ambulantemente.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita el préstamo para adecuar su negocio, tanto en su domicilio como el que tiene ambulantemente, ponerlo mas bonito y agregarle detalles que lo hagan diferente a la competencia. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, José necesita adecuar el negocio, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad José tiene 52 años de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos pero todos de mayoría de edad, ya quien le ayuda en el negocio es su hija y su esposa es ama de casa. Los anhelos de José es incrementar su negocio y redecorar su domicilio con materiales estables y fuertes, a más de generar otros ingresos, por el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use:
Better the appearance of his business

Mejorar la aparencia de su negocio

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Business Description

Olga has 10 years of experience in her business. She previously sold poultry, but due to the difficulty of selling chickens, she decided to use the capital she had to set up a shop in her home. She sells all types of items needed for school, as well as sweet drinks and cola. She has her business close to a school where she has access to more customers. She works from 6.30 in the morning until 8pm at night every day, and counts on the help of her daughter with the business.

Use of Loan

Olga hopes to use the loan to buy more snack products like juices, yogurts, crackers, etc. since the location of her business in front of a school means there is a lot of demand for these products.

Personal Information

Olga is 47 years old and is married with 3 children who are all studying. Her husband is a a merchant marine and often away on the boat. He helps with the costs of the school and their home and children. Their house is a one story cement house but is still under construction. Olga aspires to grow with the help of this loan, improving her way of life and allowing a better future for her children.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Olga tiene 10 años de experiencia en el comercio, ella anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pollo, pero como se puso difícil la venta decidió con el capital que tenía poner un bazar en su domicilio. Ella vende todo tipo de útiles escolares, pañales y colas. Ella tiene su negocio cerca de una escuela lo que le permite captar más clientes. Atiende desde las 6:30am hasta las 20:00pm todos los días. Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para atender el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Olga desea con el crédito compra productos de confiterías, como cachitos, jugos, chupetes, yogurt, etc. ya que su negocio esta frente de una escuela y tienen la demanda de estos productos en su negocio.

Información Personal

Doña Olga tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que esta estudiando. Su esposo es marino mercante y el pasa embarcado. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la escuela y del hogar de sus hijos. Su casa es de 1 piso de cemento pero aun esta en construcción. Ella aspira crecer con nosotros y a su vez ir mejorando su vivienda y poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Improve product inventory

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Business Description

Lupe has had her business for 25 years, and she works with Chileans who brought this business to the country. She takes photos which are developed using oil paints. They take photos of the client and someone else develops the picture. They have been fortunate to have lots of clients. She works everyday from 9am – 5pm. Her husband travels to other provinces to attract more clients during the week. She is also starting to sell chicken by the pound from her house.

Loan use

She will use the loan to buy what her clients have asked for. This demand has grown thanks to the good customer service that she offers. She will also invest in chickens to sell from her home.

Personal Information

Lupe is 45 years old, married and has 4 kids; two of them work and two are single. They help with the household costs. Her husband helps in the business and studies; next year he will graduate as an agronomic engineer. He hopes to be able to earn more money for the family in this profession. Their house is made of cement. They hope that with the investment they will improve their family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Lupe tiene una experiencia de 25 años con el negocio. Trabajo para unas personas chilenas que trajeron esta actividad al país. Realizando ampliaciones de fotos con pinturas de óleo. Ellos captan al cliente y otra persona se encarga de realizar la ampliación. Ha logrado tener una cartera buena de clientes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Su esposo viaja en la semana ha otras provincias en busca de captar más clientes. Además en su domicilio esta iniciando con la venta de pollo por libra.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en realizar los pedidos que tiene pendientes. Su demanda ha crecido gracias al servicio que ella brinda a sus clientes. Otra parte lo invertirá en compra de pollos para su negocio en domicilio.

Información Personal

Lupe es casada. Tiene 45 años y 4 hijos. De los cuales dos ya trabajan y son solteros. Le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Su esposo ha mas de ayudar en el negocio estudia. Esta próximo ha graduarse de ingeniero agrónomo. Espera poder ejercer la profesión y de esta manera generar otro ingreso al hogar. Su casa es de cemento. Esperando con la inversión realizada mejorar su vida familiar.

loans.use: To buy materials to meet her clients' demands/Comprar materiales para elaborar los pedidos pendientes

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
J. is 33 years old, and has been running a pharmacy for the past seven years. He is married with one kid. He buys his stock in Kariokoo, Dar Es Salaam’s biggest trading area. His stock consists of medicine for malaria, coughs, all sorts of pains and other related problems. He buys his medicine directly from the wholesalers/suppliers of the medicine and he sells as a retailer. He always stocks once a week, but sometimes he is forced to stock daily for medicine that is in high demand.

J. employs two people at his pharmacy and one relative always help him monitor critical issues for the business. J. is facing stiff competition, as the area has so many other pharmacies due to the presence of a hospital near his area of business. It’s his hope, therefore, that if he secures a bigger loan, as big as USD1000, it will help him boost up his working capital and auspiciously compete with other people doing the same business. With the loan, he hopes to buy more stock.

loans.use: EXPAND PHARMACY

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina has a small grocery stand where she sells non-perishable foods at a busy market in Mukachevo, Ukraine. In business for two years, she makes about $200 a month in profit – an important source of income for her and husband and their two children. Katerina’s business is a good example of the opportunities available for Ukrainian entrepreneurs who are willing to work hard and take a risk to start a market business.

Katerina has requested a loan of $800 to help purchase a new supply of grocery items to sell at her stand. One of Katerina’s desires for the future is to have another child. We hope that her business continues to do well and provides the necessary income to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman supports his wife and two year old daughter with his small market business selling house shoes and flip-flops. He started his business five years ago and has done well. His products are easy to market and are in demand year round. In Ukraine, it is customary to leave your outdoor shoes at the door when entering a home. Many people wear house shoes, or slippers, when they are indoors and often have extra pairs handy to offer guests.

Roman has requested a loan to make a major investment and improvement in his business by building a new vending kiosk. He’d like to be able to increase his retail space so that he can expand his inventory. Roman’s goal is to continue to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Build new vending kiosk

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael is an entrepreneur with a strong desire to get ahead. He’s 43 years old and lives with his common-law wife. Three years ago, he began selling groceries to support his family and 15 months ago, with financial help from his godfather, he started this business which, through hard work and dedication, he has made bigger and bigger.

Ismael wants to keep on growing his business and to increase the variety of products that he offers. For this, he’s asking for a loan of $475 that he will use to buy merchandise. You play an important part in the development of this business. Ismael is counting on you and thanks you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ismael es un hombre emprendedor con muchos deseos de superación, tiene 43 años de edad y vive en unión libre, para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia desde hace trece años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con ayuda financiera de su padrino de bautizo desde hace un año y tres meses pudo iniciar este negocio que ha hecho crecer con base en trabajo y dedicación.

Ahora Ismael lo que desea es continuar creciendo con su negocio e incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Ismael cuenta contigo y agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin lives in the home of his mother-in-law with his wife and their children. It is located on "K" Street in the zone of "Alto Llojeta" in the city of La Paz. He is 29 years old and since he was very young he has been dedicated to fixing automobiles with varnish, veneer, paint, etc. He does this in a room of their house which faces the street. His wife put a little grocery shop in the same room, and there is mixing of paints and gasolines with the grocery products. For this reason they are requesting a loan to construct another space on the side, and in this way separate the grocery store and the garage.

This is is his first loan. Their flow of funds shows a sufficient income to cover the costs and repay the loan. The construction of this new space is very important because it will make both businesses more professional. Their desire to improve qualifies them for an opportunity to receive a micro credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Martin vive en casa de su suegra con su esposa y sus hijos, en la calle k de la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 29 años de edad desde muy joven se dedica al arreglo de automóviles, como ser chapeado, barnizado, pintado, etc. en una habitación de la casa que da a la calle; la esposa puso una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la misma habitación y esta mezclando pinturas, gasolina y otros con el producto de la tienda, por lo cual ellos solicitaron el crédito para construir un ambiente al lado y así separar lo que es tienda y lo que es el taller.

Este es su primer crédito; el flujo de fondos muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir costos y pago de crédito. La construcción de este nuevo ambiente es muy importante pues así el aspecto de ambos negocios será más profesional. Este deseo de superación los califica para darles una oportunidad de acceso al micro crédito.

loans.use: Construction that will separate Martin's auto business from his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is originally from Veracruz but she moved with her husband and children to the city of Reynosa in Tamaulipas to look for better opportunities. Graciela is a very hard-working woman and her drive to stand out and get ahead with her family led her to start her business when she got to Reynosa. Before that, she used to just sell cheese and chorizo (a Spanish sausage), but with her savings, she managed to open a grocery store a year ago that is doing very well.

Now, Graciela is asking for a $475 loan that she will use to buy a broader range of merchandise for her customers. Be part of Graciela’s success and help her grow her business. She is very grateful for the opportunities that you can give her with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es originaria de Veracruz, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades se mudó junto con su esposo e hijos a la ciudad de Reynosa en Tamaulipas. Graciela es una mujer muy trabajadora, los deseos de sobresalir y salir adelante con su familia la motivaron a iniciar su negocio desde que llegaron a Reynosa, anteriormente vendía sólo quesos y chorizo, pero gracias a sus ahorros, desde hace un año logró abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde ha obtenido muy buenos resultados.

En estos momentos, Graciela solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener una mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Forma parte de los logros de Graciela y apóyala en el crecimiento de su negocio, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Exequiel

texts.es:
Exequiel lives in the home of his parents with his wife and their four children. Their home is on the street "Cuarto Centenario" of the zone "Villa Nuevo Potosí" in the city of La Paz. He works as a taxi driver to provide for his family. He bought his taxi by means of a loan, but the gear box now has a problem that doesn't allow him to work. The loan that he is requesting is to change the gear box of the car and be able to continue working since it is his only means of providing for his family.

He is a new client. He does not have any prior credit, but if we do not help Exequiel very soon, he and his family will be in a very difficult situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Exequiel vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en la calle Cuarto Centenario de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de la Paz. Trabaja como chofer para poder mantener a su familia; compro un taxi a crédito pero la caja de velocidades ahora tiene un desperfecto que no le permite trabajar. El crédito que solicita es para cambiar la caja del auto y poder seguir trabajando ya que es el único medio de subsistencia que tiene su familia.

Es cliente nuevo, no tiene antecedentes crediticios pero si no ayudamos a Ezequiel muy pronto el y su familia estarán en una situación muy comprometida.

loans.use: Repair his taxi

loans.name: Mariana Aracelly

texts.es:
Mariana is 29 years old and is from Mérida, Yucatán. She is single and has 2 sons who are 6 and 8 years old. Five years ago, due to unemployment and the need to support her kids, she started her own business selling food. She started offering her products to friends and neighbors, but soon she had a lot of clients. It has not been easy to bring up her kids alone, but the well-being of her family comforts her.

In order for her business to continue growing, Mariana now needs a loan of $275 which she will use to buy ingredients to make her products. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 4 months. Mariana thanks you for the support and trust you have put in her. Know that your support will do great things for her business and her family. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariana tiene 29 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de obtener la manutención de sus hijos, desde hace cinco años inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, comenzó ofreciendo sus productos a vecinos y conocidos pero pronto logró hacerse de un buen número de clientes. No ha sido fácil para Mariana tener que sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, pero el bienestar de su familia la reconforta.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ahora Mariana necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Mariana agradece mucho el apoyo y la confianza que depositas en ella y sabe que con tu ayuda podrá hacer grandes cosas para su negocio y su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Suemi Carely

texts.es:
Suemi is a very hard-working and responsible woman. Six years ago she started selling jewellery because her husband was very ill and therefore could not work and they could not pay off their debts. Unfortunately her husband died a short while ago, and in order to give her kids what they need Suemi continued with her business, and this is how her family has kept going.

With her experience in this business, Suemi knows that now is a good time to sell, and in order to meet her clients’ demands she needs a loan of $375 which she will repay over a period of 4 months. Suemi thanks you for the opportunity that you can give her to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Suemi es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de alhajas, inició su negocio porque su esposo enfermaba constantemente, le dificultaba trabajar y no se podían solventar las deudas familiares, lamentablemente su esposo falleció al poco tiempo y para poder brindarle a sus tres hijos todo lo necesario Suemi continuó con su negocio, esta es la manera como ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Con la experiencia que tiene en este negocio Suemi sabe que está por iniciar una buena temporada de ventas y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes está solicitando un crédito por $375 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. Suemi agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Señora Marcela lives in her own home with her husband and their children on the street "Huallparrimachi" in the zone of "Tembladerani" in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a bricklayer receiving a daily income. She sells food on the corner of Avenue 20, which provides food for their family, and with the income from her husband they are renovating their home.

The loan that they are requesting is for purchasing materials like stucco, cement, bricks, etc, and continue the renovation for a better life. Their previous history with IMPRO qualifies them as a good client and they can receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Marcela vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la calle Huallparrimachi de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja como albañil percibiendo un ingreso por jornal, ella vende comida en la esquina de la av. 20 de octubre, con lo cual cubre la alimentación de su familia, pero con los ingresos del esposo están refaccionando su vivienda.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material, como ser estuco, cemento, ladrillos, etc. y continuar con la refacción para poder vivir mejor. Su antecedente histórico con Impro la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Renovate their home

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es:
Idalia is from Escobedo in Nuevo León. She is married and has 2 kids who are married and so no longer live with her. Idalia and her husband are 55 years old and it is very hard for them to find jobs with the income that they need. Two years ago, due to this necessity, they decided to start their own business selling basic foods from a room in their house. Bit by bit their business grew and the quality of service that they offer improved too.

In order to meet their clients’ needs, Idalia is asking for a loan of $375 which she will use to buy merchandise in order to offer a wider range of products to her clients. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help the people who need it most. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Idalia es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos que no viven con ella porque están casados. Idalia y su esposo tienen 55 años de edad y es muy difícil para ellos conseguir un empleo que les proporcione los ingresos que necesitan, ante esta necesidad decidieron comenzar su propio negocio hace dos años con la venta de abarrotes instalándose en una habitación de su hogar, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor su negocio y mejorando la calidad del servicio que ofrecen.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, ahora Idalia está solicitando un préstamo de $375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a quien más lo necesita, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Two years ago Lorena started making and selling foods. She started this business in order to feed her 2 young kids and pay for their education. She is divorced and receives a very low amount of money from her ex-husband, which made it difficult to provide for her kids. She started offering few foods, but thanks to a growing demand for her food, she was able to increase the quantity of her products, and now offers sauces too.

In order for her business to continue to grow, Lorena is now asking for a loan of $200 which she will use to buy ingredients. With this she will also increase the amount of food she makes and will be able to cover her clients’ demands. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Lorena and her children thank you for any sort of help you can offer them, they are counting on you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace dos años Lorena se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, este negocio lo inició para poder darle sustento y educación a sus dos pequeños hijos, ella es divorciada y recibe una pensión muy baja de su ex esposo lo que le dificultaba solventar todas las necesidades de sus hijos. Empezó ofreciendo poca variedad de comidas, pero gracias a la creciente demanda que logró conseguir fue incrementando la cantidad de alimentos que elabora y ahora también ofrece empalmes y salsas.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ahora Lorena está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, con lo que incrementará su producción y logrará cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Lorena y sus hijos agradecen mucho cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarles, ellos cuentan contigo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Diana Alicia

texts.es:
Diana is a very hard-working woman. She is married with 2 children who are 5 and 9 years old. Her husband is a salesman and does not get paid very much, and they therefore live with his mother. In order to save up to buy their own house, a year ago Diana started her own business making and selling refried beans, as they are very popular in Mexico. This fact allowed her business to grow, and now she also sells “totopos”.

Thanks to the good service that Diana offers her clients, the demand for her products has grown, and she now needs to increase her production rate. In order to do this she is asking for a loan of $200 to buy ingredients. She will repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Diana thanks you for the opportunity that she has, with your help, to have a family home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene dos hijos, de 5 y 9 años de edad. Su esposo es vendedor y recibe un sueldo muy bajo, él y su familia viven en casa de su madre, para poder ahorrar y adquirir su propia vivienda desde hace un año Diana emprendió su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de frijoles embasados, éste es un producto muy consumido en México lo que la ha ayudado a crecer rápidamente, ahora también va a incorporar la venta de totopos.

Gracias al buen servicio que Diana ofrece a sus clientes, la demanda por sus productos es mayor y para poder cubrirla necesita incrementar su producción por lo que ahora está solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos, y se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Diana agradece la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda de mejorar y obtener un patrimonio para su familia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has 3 daughters and one son of 21, 18, 9 and 4 years of age. Her husband is a salesman but his salary cannot cover all of the family’s basic needs. For this reason Marina decided to start her own business selling clothes, belts and some basic foods. Bit by bit her business picked up and thanks to the good service that she offers her clients, it has grown.

Right now, Marina needs a loan of $200 to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider range of products to her clients so that they will continue to buy from her. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Contribute to the growth of this business. Marina and her family thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, está casada y tiene tres hijas y un hijo, de 21, 18, 9 y 4 años de edad. Su esposo labora como vendedor pero su salario no alcanaza a cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, es por esta razón que desde hace dos años Marina decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, cintos y algunos articulos de abarrotes, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece sus clientes se han incrementado mucho.

En estos momentos Marina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos y continuar con su preferencia, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Marina y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To buy buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Eduardo Daniel

texts.es:
Eduardo is a young businessman with big dreams. He is married with a tree year old daughter. Five years ago, while still studying, Eduardo started his own business renting out inflatable games for children’s parties so that he could pay for his studies and to save up to get married. He started with loaned games which meant that he had to share 50% of his earnings, but thanks to his savings he was soon able to get together enough money to buy his own.

In order for his business to continue to grow, Eduardo would like a loan of $475 which he will use to buy more games so that he can offer a greater variety to his clients and so they will always choose him. He promises to repay this loan over a period of 4 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and in the well-being of this family. They sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Eduardo es un joven emprendedor con grandes deseos de superación, está casado y tiene una pequeña hija de tres años de edad. Hace cinco años Eduardo inició su propio negocio con la renta de juegos inflables para fiestas infantiles, en aquel momento él era estudiante y empezó su negocio para cubrir los gastos de su escuela y para ahorrar para casarse. Comenzó con juegos que le prestaban y tenía que compartir el 50 % de las ganancias pero gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular pronto logró conseguir sus propios juegos.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, Eduardo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de más juegos inflables para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, así como en el bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy inflatable games/Compra de inflables

loans.name: Fabiola Verónica

texts.es:
Fabiola is a very quick-thinking and active woman. She is married and has two daughters who are 9 and 7 years old, and a young son who is only 8 months old. Two years ago Fabiola started her own business selling snow cones and, in winter, selling fried snacks and nachos in order to earn some extra income to improve her family’s quality of life. Thanks to an increase in profits, she now has a snow cone maker and a refrigerator, and, little by little, her business is growing.

To take advantage of the hot season, Fabiola wants to increase her production and cover her clients’ demands. For this reason she would like a loan of $250 which she will use to buy ingredients. She will repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Be a part of Fabiola’s achievements and help her to improve her business. Fabiola and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Fabiola es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, ella es casada y tiene dos hijas de 9 y 7 años de edad y un pequeño de sólo ocho meses de nacido. Para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, desde hace dos años Fabiola inició su propio negocio vendiendo raspados y en tiempo de frío incorporó la venta de frituras y nachos con lo que incrementó sus ventas. Ahora cuanta con una máquina para elaborar los raspados y un enfriador, poco a poco ha estado haciendo crecer su negocio.

Por aprovechar la temporada de calor, Fabiola quiere incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, para lo que está solicitando un crédito de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Fabiola y ayúdala a mejorar su negocio, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Description of Business

Griselda sells a brand of perfumes well recognized in her country. She also sells clothes to her neighbors who live nearby. She started her business with the support of her husband, her loaned her money to invest.

Use of Loan

Griselda will use the loan to buy merchandise, as well as an aluminum and glass display table. She also has in mind to invest in small household appliances which her customers have asked for.

Personal Information

Griselda is 39 years old, married, and has 6 children who go to school. Their house is made of cane, and her main objective is to improve the quality of their lives and construct a house made of cement.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Griselda se dedica a la venta de perfumes de una merca reconocida en el pais y ademas vende tambien ropa a los vecinos de su sector. Ella empezo su negocio con apoyo de su esposo quien le presto capital para que invierta

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el credito para comprar la mercaderia y ademas un mostrador de alumnio y vidrio. Tambien tiene pensado invertir en pequeños electrodomesticos que tambien le han solicitado sus clientes.

Información Personal

Griselda tiene 39 años de edad y esta casada tiene 6 hijos que estudian su casa es de caña y su principal objetivo es de mejorar su calidad de vida y construir su vivienda de cemento

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a display table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Elina

texts.es:
Elina makes, buys, and sells clothing. She decided to begin her business because of the skills she has. She sells her merchandise to people from her town and surrounding areas and sales vary according to the time of year. Her business is located in the Agua Blanca district, in the department of San Martín, Perú. Her husband and her children all help her with sales. She receives loans from the Manuela Ramos Movement, through its Margaritas Communal Bank. She invests them in buying merchandise that is requested by her customers, so as to be sure to recoup the entire amount of each loan. She has received loans starting at S./300 ($94.00) and growing to S/.2,000 ($625). She is 52 years old and has four children. Her goal is to expand her business until she has a large store in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elina, se dedica a la confección y compra/venta de prendas de vestir, decidió iniciar su negocio gracias a las habilidades que posee. La mercadería es vendida a los pobladores de la localidad y alrededores, y se varía según la época del año. Ella desarrolla su actividad en el distrito de Agua Blanca, departamento de San Martín – Perú. Tanto su esposo como sus hijos colaboran con la atención al público. Ella recibe créditos del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal las Margaritas, los mismos que se invierten en compra de mercadería según los pedidos que hagan la clientela, para asegurar la recuperación total de dicho préstamo. Ella ha recibido créditos de S/. 300 (US$94) y ha ido aumento llegando a S/.2,000 (US$625). Ella tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta tener una tienda muy grande en su propia casa.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Business Description

Esmilda has a business selling articles for the home. She sells these door to door and on credit. She started the business with $250, and the help of her husband, who proposed the idea. Two of her nieces help her with the business.

Use of Loan

She needs the loan because she wants to be able to buy the merchandise at wholesale prices, and then be able to have better prices and products for her clients. In addition, she has set up a place in her house to showcase the products.

Personal Information

Esmilda is 32 years old and has two children who both go to school. The house is constructed of various materials and she has a stable family. Her main aspiration is to be able to grow her business to secure the education of her children, and finish the construction her home.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Esmilda tiene un negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar a que vende de forma ambulante y a crédito. Este negocio lo comenzó con la ayuda de su esposo quien le propuso la idea. Con $250 dólares, le ayuda en el negocio dos sobrinos

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar la mercadería a precio de mayorista y así poder tener mejores precios y buenos productos para sus clientes. Además ya ha adecuado un local en su domicilio para también tener en exposición los productos que expende en la calle y una bodega

Información Personal

Ella tiene 32 años y dos hijos de los cuales dos estudian su casa es de construcción mixta y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos y terminar de construir su casa

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To be able to buy her merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mercaderia a mejores precios

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Description of the Business

Ms. Gladys has a business where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner in a premise she set up in her own home. She started this business with $80 dollars on savings she had from another small store she had in her house. Her two young sons help her out in the business.

Use of the Loan

She needs this loan because she wants to buy tables and chairs, she would also like to purchase a new industrial kitchen because the one she had is big not enough for all the cooking she has to do. The other part of the loan will be used to buy more merchandise for the store.

Personal Information

Ms. Gladys is 41 years old, she has four sons, one is a student. Her home is made of cement and she lives in a functional family. Her main goal is to get her business in progress and ensure a job for her sons, since they already know the business. She also wants to provide for their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Gladys tiene un negocio de venta de desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas en un local que acondiciono en su propia casa. Este negocio lo comenzó con los ahorros que le genero una tienda que tiene en otro local de su misma casa. Con $80 dólares, le ayuda en el negocio sus dos hijos que son jóvenes

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar mas mesas y silla que le hacen falta además tiene que adquirir otra cocina industrial por que la tiene no le abastece para axial atender mejor a sus clientes. Otra parte del crédito piensa en comprar mas mercadería para la tienda

Información Personal

Ella tiene 41 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales una estudia su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurarles un trabajo a sus hijos que ya conocen del negocio y la educación de su hijos

loans.use: Comprar mas mesas y sillas

loans.name: Bolívar

texts.es:
Description of the Business

Mr. Bolivar sells clothing in a mobile- informal way, he gives credit facilities to the people in the nearby towns from where he lives. This business started with his $150 dollars of his savings, from a store he had in his house. His sons help him out in the business and his wife sells typical dishes on the weekends.

Use of the Loan

He needs this loan because he wants to buy more products at bulk price and therefore have better prices for his clients. He also wants a store in his house so he can also show the products that he sells on the streets.

Personal Information

He is 57 years old, he has two children who go to school and he lives in a cement house, he lives in a stable family home. He main goal is that his business will provide for his children’s education and that he will have a peaceful old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Bolívar tiene un negocio de venta de ropa que vende de forma ambulante y a crédito en los pueblos cercanos a la cuidad donde el vive. Este negocio lo comenzó con la ayuda de sus ahorros productos de la tienda que puso en su casa. Con $150 dólares, además sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio y su esposa también trabaja vendiendo platos típicos los fines de semana

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito porque tiene el afán en comprar la mercadería a precio de mayorista y así tener mejores precios y buenos productos para sus clientes. Además ya ha adecuado un local en su domicilio para también tener en exposición los productos que expende en la calle

Información Personal

El tiene 57 años y dos hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos y tener una vejez tranquila

loans.use: Comprar mercaderia al por mayor

loans.name: Mery Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Mery,  se dedica a la venta de cebiche y otros paltos a base de pescados y mariscos decidió iniciar su negocio para solucionar las necesidades familiares, y además para sacar a relucir las habilidades que posee en la cocina. Ella esta ubicada en San José de Sisa, en el departamento de San Martín – Perú.
El cebiche y otros platos  son preparados según los pedidos de los clientes que son propios de la comunidad y los visitantes que llegan de otras ciudades 

El préstamo lo recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal Doradinas en Acción, invirtiendo en  el arreglo de su propio local, implementación con mobiliario adecuado para una mejor atención a los clientes, compra de insumos para la producción del cebiche y platos diversos y así cumplir con los pedidos diarios. Los prestamos que ha recibido han ido creciendo desde S/300 ($94) llegando a S/700 ($219)

Ella tiene 38 años y 2 hijas, paralelo a la atención de su negocio y  con el apoyo de su familia,  estudia actualmente en un instituto tecnológico  para superarse cada día más,  porque su meta es comprar tierras y dedicarse a la producción y venta de productos agrícolas.

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a glass case to show off his baked goods

loans.name: Sefora

texts.es:
Description of the Business

Ms. Sefora gains from selling cosmetics and clothing. She sells these products to people around the sector, her friends and neighbors. She started this business with her son’s help, who sent her money from abroad.

Use of the loan

With this loan she will buy more products at a bulk price and she will re-invest with the profit she gains.

Personal Information

She is 39 years old, married and two sons who go to school. Her house is made of cement and her main goal is to save for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Sefora se dicha a la venta de cosméticos y de ropa. Estos productos los expenden a las personas que circundan en el sector, amigos y vecinos. Ella empezó este negocio con la ayuda de su hijo quien le envió dinero del exterior

Uso del Préstamo

Con el préstamo ella aspira comprar mas mercadería a precio de mayorista y con las ganancias seguirá realizando inversiones para el negocio

Información Personal

Ella tiene 39 años de edad esta casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento. Su principal meta es de ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at bulk prices

loans.name: Mery Angelica

texts.es:
Mery works selling ceviche and other foods made with fish and seafood. She began her business to meet her family’s needs and also to let her excellent abilities in the kitchen shine. She is located in San José de Sisa, in the department of San Martín, Perú. The ceviche and other foods are prepared according to the requests of the customers, who are from the community and also visitors that come from other cities.
