The loan that she that she will receive is from the Moviemento Manuela Ramos, through its Doradinas en Acción Communal Bank. She will invest it in fixing up her own restaurant with adequate furniture to provide better service to her customers and will also buy ingredients for making ceviche and a diversity of other foods so that she can fulfill the daily orders. The loans she has received have grown from S/300 ($94) to S/700 ($219).

She is 38 years old and has two daughters. In addition to tending to her business and taking care of her family, she is also studying at a technological institute in order to better prepare herself because her goal is to buy land and produce and sell agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mery, se dedica a la venta de cebiche y otros paltos a base de pescados y mariscos, decidió iniciar su negocio para solucionar las necesidades familiares, y además para sacar a relucir las habilidades que posee en la cocina. Ella esta ubicada en San José de Sisa, en el departamento de San Martín – Perú. El cebiche y otros platos son preparados según los pedidos de los clientes que son propios de la comunidad y los visitantes que llegan de otras ciudades El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal Doradinas en Acción, será invertido en el arreglo de su propio local, implementación con mobiliario adecuado para una mejor atención a los clientes, compra de insumos para la producción del cebiche y platos diversos y así cumplir con los pedidos diarios. Los prestamos que ha recibido han ido creciendo desde S/300 ($94) llegando a S/700 ($219) Ella tiene 38 años y 2 hijas, paralelo a la atención de su negocio y con el apoyo de su familia, estudia actualmente en un instituto tecnológico para superarse cada día más, porque su meta es comprar tierras y dedicarse a la producción y venta de productos agrícolas.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her restaurant and to buy food ingredients

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita sells groceries, vegetables, plastic items, clothes, beauty prodcuts, and snacks. She decided to begin her business in an effort to take control of her own finances and to be somebody important in life. She developed her business in San José de Sisa, departamento de San Martín – Perú. Lita's business has grown considerably, and she is now able to cover the cost of her family's necessities.

Lita uses the loans that she receives from Movimiento Manuela Ramos through her Banco Comunal Doradinas to purchase new products, to purchase greater quantities of goods to sell, and to more or less satisfy the needs of her clients who live in her community and those who live around the outskirts of her community. With her last loan she received $625 USD.

Lita is 39 years old and has two kids, the older of which helps with her business. Lita's goal is to open her own market that sells textiles, so that she can employ the women in her community through her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Lita se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, plásticos, ropa, pasamanería y golosinas. Decidió iniciar su negocio para manejar sus propios ingresos y ser alguien importante en la vida. Desarrollando su actividad en San José de Sisa, departamento de San Martín – Perú. El negocio ha crecido considerablemente ya que ella cubre las necesidades de su familia.

Los prestamos que ha recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal Doradinas en Acción, las invierte en la compra de productos variados y en mayores cantidades y poder así vender al por mayor y menor para llegar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que viven en la misma comunidad, como los que vienen de los distritos aledaños. Ella en su último crédito ha recibido el monto de S/2,000 ($625).

Tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, de los cuales el mayor la ayuda en el negocio, su meta es llegar a abrir una tienda de mercería y tejidos y dar trabajo como tejedoras a las mujeres de la comunidad.

loans.use: To buy various products to sell

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 55 years old and has 5 children. She makes cookies and other kinds of snacks for the small grocery stores in her town and other nearby districts where there is good demand for her products. She also works as a seamstress and makes clothing. She decided to start her business when confronted with her husband’s lack of interest in providing for the family. She began with a capital of S/.500.00: S/.200.00 was her own money and S/.300.00 was a loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was made through its Las Samaritanas Communal Bank. She has obtained a loan of S./1,800.00 ($562.00).

She will invest the loan in buying ingredients for making cookies and also in buying fabrics for the clothing she makes. Her business is located in Shatoja, in the department of San Martín, Perú.

Her goal is to build a larger oven, to improve her business, to be able to take all the orders from her customers, and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana tiene 55 años, y 5 hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración y distribución de rosquitas, suspiros y otros bocaditos en las bodegas de su localidad y distritos cercanos en las que sus preparados tienen una buena demanda. Alternadamente se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir; Decidió iniciar su negocio ante el desinterés de su esposo por cubrir las necesidades del hogar, con un capital de S/.500.00 soles: S/. 200.00 propio y S/. 300.00 que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le prestó a través de su Banco Comunal Las Samaritanas. Actualmente ella ha obtenido un préstamo de S/.1,800 ($562). El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de rosquitas y también en compra de telas para la confección de prendas que es su actividad alternativa. Desarrolla su actividad en el distrito de Shatoja, departamento de San Martín – Perú. Su meta es construir un horno más grande, mejorar su negocio y poder atender los pedidos de su clientela y ampliar la cobertura de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cookies and snacks and fabric for making clothing

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary Davert is 23 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Her husband makes a living by selling recyclables at $5 USD a day.

Mrs. Sary, herself, stays at home to look after their young child. She would now like to earn some extra money by raising pigs from her home. She will use this $500 loan to purchase pigs and pig feed. In the future, she would like to expand this business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Sunso

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunso A. is 38 years old and lives with her family in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer and earns $2 a day. Both she and her husband also buy and sell recyclable products.

They would like to purchase this loan in order to buy seeds to grow their own food, and also to buy more recyclable products for their business. In the future, they hope to expand this business and send their children to University.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and recyclable products

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sunso At has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: In

texts.en: Mrs. In T. is 35 years old and married, with four school-aged children. She works very hard on her rice paddy growing rice crops, vegetables, and raising animals. Her husband also supports the family by working as a motor-taxi driver. Together, they earn approximately $3 USD each day. This loan will be used to purchase pigs and fertilizer for her farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and fertilizer for her farm supplies.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin T. is a married woman of 57 years. Her two children are both enrolled school. She and her husband work as farmers growing rice crops and raising livestock. Together, they can typically earn $ 2 USD each day. This couple hopes to use the loan to increase their livestock with more ducks and chickens. The eggs will contribute to their additional profits.

loans.use: To increase her livestock with additional ducks.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin N. is 31 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with her husband (shown in the photo) and three children. She works for a company that weighs both cars and trucks. She would now like to open a grocery store. However, she needs additional funding to help with the start-up costs. Thus, Mrs. Hin N. is applying for a loan in order to launch her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to run a business

loans.name: Henriqueta Sebastião

texts.pt:
Henriqueta Sebastião M. tem 42 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 3 filhos. Reside no bairro Albasine arredores da cidade de Maputo.Tem um pequeno aviário em casa no qual cria e vende frangos.Entrou para o programa como membro do grupo Komakwatsi em finais de 2005, com um empréstimo inicial de 1.800 MT. Vai para o 5º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 4.000MT pagáveis em 5 meses com vista a reforçar o negócio uma vez que este se encontra um pouco enfraquecido devido a uma pausa provocada pela morte de um filho.

Translated from Portuguese by Daniel Foster, Kiva Volunteer.

Henriqueta Sebastião M., 42, is a single mother of 3 children and lives in the Albasine neighborhood on the outskirts of Maputo. She has a small aviary in her house where she raises and sells chickens. She joined [her MFI’s] program as member of the Komakwatsi group at the end of 2005 with an initial loan of $80USD. She is now going for her 5th loan and intends to borrow $175USD over 5 months in order to strengthen her business since it has been a weakened somewhat due to a lull caused by the death of her son.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: S. Sanoat is an active client of Microinvest. She is the mother of three children. She has been trading in the market during the past four years. Her business is to sel men’s clothes and business is located in Panjshanbe market, in Khudjand. She has rented a small area for sale outside of a larger shop. She brings her goods from Istaravshan every week. Today she has many constant clients and she always tries to meet their needs. In September, she would like to be able to purchase warm men’s clothes. In order to accomplish this, S. would like a loan of $400.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Carlota Aleixo

texts.pt:
Carlota Aleixo D. is 21 years old. She is single and lives in the neighborhood of Matola B, in the province of Maputo. She operates a beauty salon in her garage. She joined the program in August 2006. Her first loan was of 6.000MT. Now, she is on stage 2 of the program and plans on borrowing 6.000, to be repaid in 6 months. She plans on building a Beauty Salon in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlota Aleixo D. tem 21 anos de idade,é solteira e não tem filhos.Vive no bairro Matola "B" na província de Maputo.Tem um salão de beleza numa garagem em sua residência. Entrou para o Programa em Agosto de 2006 tendo tomado um empréstimo inicial de 6.000 MT. Vai agora para o 2º ciclo e pretende tomar um empréstimo de 6.000 MT para pagar em 6 meses com o qual pretende investir na obra de construção de um salão na mesma casa.

loans.use: Building business venue

loans.name: Holniso

texts.en: S. Holniso has been trading for six years. She is currently married and has three children. She trades candies and cakes. She became a client of Microinvest in 2003 and her first loan was $100. Gradually, she increased her loan amount to $1000. Her turnover is fast, and she has many consistent and constant clients. These two summer months were very profitable for Holniso, because it is usually wedding time in Tadjikistan. Presently she plans to purchase the next batch of candies and cakes for the autumn months. She is requesting a loan of $500 for this.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong Y. is 41 years old and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. One of her children is a student, another is a garment worker and the third is still too young to go to school. She earns her money by selling vegetables, but she would now like to expand her inventory. She hopes to use this proposed loan in order to purchase additional vegetable products.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to expand inventory.

loans.name: Ehtiram

texts.en: Ehtiram M. owns a clothing store in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Ehtiram was born and raised in Khachmaz, and now he and his wife are raising two children. Ehtiram has been running his business for a few years and is now looking for funding so that he can invest in increasing his inventory of men and women’s clothing.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib E. owns a clothing stand in the bazaar of the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Sahib has been running his business for several years with the help of his wife, and is now looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of winter clothing. The seasons will be changing soon, and he needs to be prepared for this shift within the market. Sahib has already paid back two prior loans, but amounting to $525, and has proven himself as a worthy customer.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing for inventory.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en: Latofat is currently a teacher and worked in a school until 1999. Her current living condition compels her to start a business to support her family. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough. Latofat’s business is located in Panjshanbe market in Khujand. She sells women’s and men’s clothing. She also buys her goods from wholesale markets in Atushbazaar. In her turnover she currently has $400. She has always repaid her loans on time. Additionally, her daughter currently sews children’s clothes at home and Latofat sells them in her trade place. In the future, Latofat would like to purchase sewing machines for her daughter. For this purpose, she wants to increase her turnover and be able to sell warm school uniforms in September. For this, she would like a loan of $400.

loans.use: Purchgasing of school uniform.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim K. is a taxi driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Rasim has been driving a taxi for a few years now and is married, with one child. This will be Rasim’s first loan with Normicro. He has been approved for a loan of $575.00 with which he plans to purchase new tires for this taxi as well as some minor repairs for his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase tires and to make other minor repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Semed

texts.en: Semed T. and his family own and operate a women’s clothing stand in the bazaar of the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Semed and his wife have three children and are long time customers of Normicro. Together they have already paid back four prior loans. They are looking for funding so that they can increase their inventory of winter clothing so that they will be prepared for the winter season.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing inventory.

loans.name: Helena Alberto

texts.pt:
Helena Alberto M. is 32 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Malhazine, in Maputo. She has 2 stands in the Market Benfica. One of the stands sells meat and the other used clothes.

She joined the program in April of 2006. Her first loan was of 5.000MT. She is now on the 4th stage of the program and plans on borrowing 6.000MT to be repaid in 6 months. Helena has experienced an increase in income since she invested the funds from the program. With the money she has bought some things for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Helena Alberto M. tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos. Vive no bairro de Malhazine em Maputo. Tem duas bancas no mercado de Benfica,numa vende carne e noutra vende roupa usada.

Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2006 com um empéstimo inicial de 5.000 MT. vai agora para o quarto ciclo e vai tomar um empréstimo dfe 6.000 para pagar em 4 meses. Tem verificado algumas melhorias no seu negócio e com os lucros tem comprado alguns bens para a sua casa.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: When Elnur received his first loan from Normicro he operated a fruit and vegetable stand at the local bazaar in the town of Khachmaz. He has since moved up the supply chain to become a supplier of fruits and vegetables to the Bazaars in the northeastern region. Elnur is now looking for funding so that the can increase the amount of produce he purchases from the local farmers to distribute to the bazaars.

loans.use: To increase produce purchased for distribution.

loans.name: Rute Francisco

texts.pt:
Rute Francisco Muchabjetem is 49 years old. She is a widow, mother of 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Mahotas, in Maputo. She operates a small chicken coop in her home, where she raises and sells chickens. She also sells clothes.

Rute joined the program in October 2006, her first loan was of 5.000MT. She completed re-paying that first loan on time. She is now in the 3rd stage of the program when she plans on borrowing 15.000 MT to be repaid in 6 months. She plans on using the fund to increase her stock for both businesses. Rute has seen positive changes in both businesses since she joined the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Rute Francisco Muchabjetem 49 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Mahotas na cidade de Maputo.Tem um pequeno aviário em sua casa onde cria e vende frangos a grosso e também vende roupa nova, a qual faz entrega ao domicílio.

Entrou para o programa em Outubro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000MT. Tem pago pontualmente os empréstimos e também tem depositado as poupanças.Vai para o terceiro ciclo de empéstimo e pretende uim empréstimo de 15.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para reforçar o negócio. Tem verificado crescimento gradual do negócio uma vez que todo o valor dos empréstimos tem aplicado nos seus dois negócios.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en: Zinaida O. operates a small footwear stand in the bazaar of the northeastern Aerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Zaida is married and has raised four children in Khachmaz. Zaida is looking for funding so that she can increase and diversity her inventory for the coming change of the seasons. Zaida has already successfully repaid three prior loans, and has proven herself a worthy customer.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Ilda Simão

texts.pt:
Ilda Simao L. is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children in the neighborhood of Canico, in Maputo. She owns a small grocery shop in her home, where she sells food and drinks.

Ilda joined the Development Fund of Women Program in February 2006 and her first loan was of 5.000MT. She is on the 4th stage of the program. Ilda plans on borrowing 15.000MT to invest on her business. She plans on re-paying the loan in a 6 months period. Ilda's business has experienced memorable growth after she joined the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilda Simão L. tem 40 anos de Idade,vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro polna Caniço em Maputo. Uma pequena mercearia em casa onde vende diversos produtos alimentares e bebidas.

Entrou para o aprograma em Fevereiro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000 MT. Vai para o quarto ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 15.000 Mt para pagar em 6 meses, o qual vai investir no negócio. Tem teve um crescimento assinalável do negócio depois que começou a tomar os empréstimos uma vez que todos os montantes são aplicados no mesmo.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Zobia

texts.en:
"My husband is very ambitious. He has his own band by the name of “Jeeway Pakistan”. He has been playing with a musical group at various shows and events for the past 8 years but until last year, he always had to hire a drum kit. Therefore, last year we got a loan with which he got himself a drum kit. We successfully paid that back and now we are seeking another loan so that he can buy a sound system (speakers, microphone, amplifier, etc.) which he can rent out for musical shows, marriages, etc. In high season, he could earn up to $410 per month, which would ensure that like our eldest son, the younger two would be able to go to school also, when they are of age. I want all of them to be educated, responsible citizens."

Zobia B., Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy Sound System (speakers, microphone, amplifier, etc.)

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
"I am Sarwar B. and I live in Lahore. I have five children, three boys and two girls. I am 55 years old, all my children are married, and they live and work independently. I live alone, which is tough for women to do in Pakistan. I have to make my own living and travel to Peshawar about 7 hours from Lahore, my hometown. Peshawar is a conservative town where many women are not visible on the road but I like adventure. I purchase cloth and blankets in bulk at a lower rate and sell them door to door in my neighborhood at a higher rate. With the loan, I can purchase more items from Peshawar, sell in Lahore, and generate more profits."


Sarwar B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, blankets, etc., in bulk from Peshawar, a city in Pakistan known for its cheap prices.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
"I am Tahira N. and I live in Lahore, a metropolis of Pakistan. I have two daughters and two sons. My sons play different musical instruments at parties and my daughters stay home with me. I want to educate them but because of my small income, I am unable to do so. My husband is a Rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) driver, which we purchased on installments. The Rickshaw is becoming old now and requires some repairing. The loan we will get for the Rickshaw will enable us to repair the Rickshaw and we would be able to run it for more days in a month."

Tahira N., Pakistan

loans.use: For the maintenance of Rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose was born twenty seven years ago; she is married, and has three children who are in school. She is a member of Kahumbu Kwirera women Group. She is very dedicated to her group and contributes to all group activities. She is a farmer at Kahumbu and grows food crops, coffee and rears dairy cows. She has benefited so much from her farming and wants to diversify by introducing pigs in the farm. She needs a loan of Usd 750 to buy pigs. She is willing to repay her loan within a span of one year.

loans.use: Rose would like to buy 5 young pigs and undertaking other farming activities.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
"I have four children and none of them is able to obtain an education because of our financial problems. Some years back my husband and son started their own furniture business in a rented shop, which has not proven to be a sufficient mode of income. We think that by buying a shop and investing in the raw materials for our business we can be successful. For this, we need $295 so that we can invest in and expand our business."

Bushra A., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a shop and raw materials for our Furniture Business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia was born thirty five years ago; she is married with three children. She is an active member of Kahumbu Kwirera Women Group. Cecilia is a farmer who specializes in cereal selling, growing food crops and dairy farming. Out of her milk production she is able to sell 5 liters per day to the Kenya Creameries Cooperative and from the crops she grows, she is able to provide domestically and left with little to sell. She is making an application of Usd 750 to boost her cereal businesses. She intends to buy beans, maize, cowpeas, black peas and green grams, which in turn will increase her customer turn out and profits. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly installments.

loans.use: Cecilia would like to buy varieties of cereals for her cereal shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. She is very determined in life and she believes for the best. She is the chairlady of Our lady of unity women group. She also holds other leading positions at community work. Two of her children are in college. Her main source of income is farming where she keeps poultry, rears dairy cows, and grows horticultural crops. Grace has actually diversified in agricultural practices and she always has a room to try out a new idea in agriculture world. She sells milk, vegetables, and eggs on weekly basis. From the income she generates, she can only afford to pay school fees in a bit which is not convenient to her children studies. She is applying a loan to pay the college fees in lump sum and left repaying her loan with the monthly income she generates.

loans.use: Grace wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
"I am from Lahore, the second biggest city of Pakistan. I am a housewife and have four children who could not obtain an education because of our financial problems. My husband has been operating a small shop, selling cigarettes and candies, adjacent to our house for the last 5 years and. In his absence, I manage the shop. It is very difficult for us to make ends meet especially when the cost of living is very high. Our shop is in a busy neighborhood and we think that a loan can help purchase more products for our shop. We plan to expand by buying in bulk, reducing our cost, and making more profit."


Samina B., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase stock for our shop like cigarettes, candies, etc.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
"I work as a domestic and my husband binds books on order. We want to develop his business by buying him a binding machine so that he will not have to pay to use someone else’s. This will reduce the costs of our business and we will own the asset.  We require $250 to buy the machine. This way we will be financially capable of sending our two children to school when they are old enough."

Gulshan J., Pakistan

loans.use: To buy a binding machine

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is married with two children. She is a religious person who practices good morals in the community. She is very hardworking and has benefited a lot from our lady of unity women group. She has a small retail shop which is the only source of income. She started her business with the help of a small group loan. She is applying a loan to buy goods in order to meet her customer’s needs. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Naomi would like to buy house hold goods for her retail shop.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a young mother of 23 years with 3 children. She is an active member of Ensonkoyo women group. She is very dedicated to group activities and all that pertains to group. She is applying for the loan to buy young steers to rear them for six months and sell them at 100% profit. She is targeting to sell her steers to a meat commission where the prices are good for the farmers. This business is the only income generating activity she has and it has enabled her to cater for her family basic needs. She will make all her repayments on monthly basis.

loans.use: Ann would like to buy 4 young steers for rearing

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru:
Ibodat R. is 51, is married and has 3 children. She has a high-school education. For the past few years her husband has been working in Russia to earn some money for the family. Her children are all grown up and have families of their own. She has been selling men's clothing for the past 14 years. Her startup capital was $60. Back then she sold men's underwear. Gradually she was able to increase the selection of goods she sold. When she became a client of MicroInvest, back in 2003, her assets amounted to $200. She borrowed $70. Borrowing allowed her to increase her turnover by $500. She was able to add men's sports wear to her selection. She is planing to open another sales point.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer.

Рахматова Ибодат – 51лет. Замужем, имеет 3детей. Образование среднее специальное. Муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках, дети взрослые и каждый имеет свою отдельную семью. Она занимается реализацией мужской одежды, уже 14лет. Начала свою деятельность с 60$, тогда она продавала мужское нижнее бельё. Постепенно она увеличила товар. Когда стала клиентом «Микроинвест» в 2003 году её активы составляли 200$, она получила займ в размере 70$. После получения неоднократного займа она увеличила товарооборот на 500$, добавила в свой ассортимент мужские спортивные одежды. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another shop

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Manzura is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has a secondary school education and her husband has been working in Russia for several years. Her children go to school and after school help their mother in her trading.

Manzura sells women’s clothing. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. Back then her inventory was worth $150 and her product line included only ethnic dresses. After receiving a loan and using it fully she started not only selling European women’s clothing, but she also started traveling for products to neighboring countries on her own. Right now she has assets of $600. In the future she plans to add women’s shoes to her product offering.

P.S. Her son is in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хусейнова Манзура – 40лет. Замужем, трое детей. Образование среднее. Муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках. Дети учатся в школе, а после школы помогают своей матери в торговле. Она занимается реализацией женской одежды. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» является с 2003года. В то время её товарооборот составляли на сумму 150$, и в её ассортименте имелось только национальное платье. После получения займа и целевого использования она не только стала торговать европейской женской одеждой, но и стала ездить за товаром в соседние страны сама. Сейчас её активы возросли до 600$. В будущем планирует добавить в ассортимент и женскую обувь. P.S. На фото её сын.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Nosirboy

texts.ru:
Nosirboy is 52 years old. He is married and has three young children. Nosirboy buys and sells agricultural produce. From early morning until lunch, he visits markets in the neighboring villages and sells potatoes, onions and carrots. He purchases produce at wholesale markets on the border with Uzbekistan and then sells it in villages. His wife stays at home looking after their children and helps him in the market. The turnover of Nosirboy’s business is not very big, but it allows him to provide for his family. Nosirboy is planning to spend new loan for buying onions and potatoes wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Носирбою 52 года, он женат и имеет 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Он занимается куплей продажей сельскохозяйственной продукции. С раннего утра до обеда он посещает все базары по окрестным кишлакам и продает там картошку, лук и морковь. За товаром ездит по оптовым рынкам и еще привозит с границы Узбекистана. Его жена нигде не работает и иногда выходит на базар помочь мужу. Оборот его бизнеса небольшой, но позволяет прокормить семью. Носирбой планирует потратить новый займ для закупки лука и картошки.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and onions wholesale

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
Kodjovi G. was born in Atchantidomé on December 31, 1962. Married and the father of two, he has a total of 5 dependents that he supports. With a middle school education, he ceased working very early on, because of an insufficient salary. Well-known for his welcoming and sympathetic personality, he currently manages his little pharmacy, which he hopes to bolster. Given the level of demand from his customer base, which continues to grow, he hopes to weave relationships with laboratories and thus to resupply his shop with medicines. This is why he is requesting a loan of $1200. The income generated from these sales will serve to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur G. Kodjovi est né à Atchantidomé le 31 Décembre 1962. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, il a à sa charge un total de cinq (5) personnes qu’il supporte. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a cessé très tôt son travail pour insuffisance de salaire au profit du commerce. Très reconnu pour son accueil et sa sympathie, Monsieur G. Kodjo gère actuellement sa petite pharmacie qu’il compte renforcer. Vu le niveau des demandes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il espère tisser des relations avec les laboratoires pour des ravitaillements. C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 pour acheter les médicaments pour sa petite pharmacie. Le revenu issu de la vente servira à Monsieur G. de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in medicines

loans.name: Bizulaiho

texts.ru:
Bizulaiho S. is 34 years old. She is married and is a mother of four. She has a secondary education. Her husband is a constructor worker and her children are going to school. Bizulaiho has been selling children’s shoes for 8 years. Before she received her first loan from MLF “MicroInvest” Bizulaiho did not have a permanent stall. She sold her goods on the street and different parts of the market. After receiving a loan of $150 she slowly increased turnover, Bizulaiho started traveling to nearby markets to buy her stock as well as purchased a permanent stall in one of the biggest markets in the city. She also was able to add children’s clothing to her assortment. Currently her assets are up to $600. In the future, she is planning to open another point of sale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Султонова Бизулайхо – 34 лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей. Образование среднее. Муж работает строителем, дети ходят в школу. Она торгует детской обувью, уже 8лет. До получения кредита в МЗФ «Микроинвест» торговала на улице в разных точках рынка, без определенного место деятельности. После получения займа в размере 150$ постепенно расширила товарооборот, стала ездить за товаром и кроме этого приобрела постоянную точку торговли в одном из больших рынков города. Сейчас в её ассортименте товаров добавлено детская одежда. В данный момент её активы возросли до 600$. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open another point of sale

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi K. was born on May 5, 1968, in Agbodrafo. Married and the mother of four, she resides in Séwatsicopé and also takes care of her parents and two younger brothers. A hairdresser by training, she had to abandon her trade to sell groceries in order to help cover the household expenses weighing on her husband's shoulders. Until now, she made use of micro-loans from money-lenders. She would earn more if she actually were to find much more substantial working capital, which would allow her to grasp other business opportunities and to provide a fresh start for her family. She is requesting a loan of $800.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Afi est née le 05 Mai 1968 à Agbodrafo. Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle réside à Séwatsicopé et a aussi à sa charge ses parents et deux de ses petits frères. Coiffeuse de formation, elle dû abandonner ce métier pour se lancer dans le commerce de produits alimentaires pour se lancer dans le commerce de produits alimentaires pour pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage qui pesaient sur son mari. Jusqu’alors elle bénéficie de micro crédits chez les usuriers. Elle gagnerait plus si elle trouvait un véritable fonds de commerce beaucoup plus consistant qui lui permettra de saisir d’autres opportunités de son activité et donner un nouveau souffle à sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement de $800.

loans.use: Commerce in food items

loans.name: Mawuli Ferdinand

texts.fr:
Mawuli Ferdinand D. was born on May 28, 1965 in Aného. He is married and has six dependents, including three children from his deceased brother. A merchant by profession, he has a few fueling depots in the prefecture. Facing an ever-growing demand, he would like to increase the number of these retail outlets in order to meet his customer expectations. This is why he is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow him to attain a higher profit margin and to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Mawuli Ferdinand est né le 28 mai 1965 à Aného. Il est marié et a à sa charge six (6) enfants dont trois enfants de son frère décédé. Commerçant de profession, il dispose de quelques dépôts de carburant dans la préfecture. Face à une demande de plus en plus croissante il désire multiplier ses points de vente pour satisfaire ses clients. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’atteindre une marge bénéficiaire plus élevée et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Developing more outlets for selling fuel for vehicles

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Kafui L., age 25, is married and the mother of two. She is a beautician by training. But without the means to open her own shop, she started selling beauty products. Despite insufficient revenues, she is making sure that her sister goes to school and that her mother's needs are met. Conscious of this responsibility, she works incessantly to meet the expectations of her customers. Today, facing the demand for new products, she realized that it would be profitable to include her skills with her business. To do so, she would like to buy some new products to sell and also certain supplies. And so she is requesting a loan of $1000 that will allow her to buy the necessary items. This would increase her income in order to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 25 ans Madame L. Kafui est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle est esthéticienne de formation. N’ayant pas les moyens pour ouvrir son propre atelier, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de beauté. Malgré l’insuffisance de son revenu, elle assure la scolarité de sa petite sœur et la charge de sa mère. Conscient de cette responsabilité, elle travail sans relâche pour satisfaire ses clients. Aujourd’hui face à la demande de nouveaux produits, Madame Kafui s’est rendue compte qu’il serait rentable d’associer son métier à sa marchandise. A cet effet, elle désir acheter certains matériels de travail et de nouveaux produits pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter le matériel nécessaire. Cela augmenterait son revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire supplies to open a hairdressing and beauty salon

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla A. was born on October 5, 1976, in Lomé. She is married and the mother of three, and she bears nearly all household expenses because her husband earns a meager, irregular salary. A very enterprising woman, she sees to the survival of her family through her business of selling rice and beans. To maximize her profit and to ensure the best future for her children, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy basic foodstuffs in bulk, so that customer demand can be met with confidence.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Abla est née le 05 Octobre 1976 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle assure la quasi-totalité des charges du ménage car le mari avec son maigre salaire qui tombe irrégulièrement n’arrive pas à courir les besoins du ménage. Madame A. Abla très entreprenante assure la survie de sa famille par son activité qui reste la vente de riz et d’haricot. Pour maximiser son profit et assurer un meilleur avenir à ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des produits vivriers en gros pour assurer la demande de ses clients.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr:
Comlan K. was born on February 5, 1974 in Agbanakin (Lacs prefecture). He is a teacher, and he is married and the father of a child. In addition, he is the guardian of four orphans. As a member of an Advance Technology Program non-governmental organization fighting against child trafficking, Mr. K. is leading a fierce struggle to ensure that the basic needs of all his dependents are met. He has a shop where he sells groceries, dry goods, and services such as word processing and photocopying. His wife helps him manage the shop. In face of an ever-pressing demand, especially for new items, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to supply his shop and to improve his business performance.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Comlan est né le 05 Février 1974 à Agbanakin (P/Lacs). Marié et père d’un enfant, il a à sa charge quatre (4) autres enfants orphelins de père et de mère. Membre d’un ONG ATP combattant la lutte contre le trafic des enfants, Monsieur K. Comlan mène une lutte acharnée pour assurer le minimum de ces enfants à sa charge. Enseignant, il dispose d’une boutique d’alimentation générale, de mercerie et des travaux de traitement de texte, photocopieur qu’il gère avec l’aide de sa femme. Face à une demande de plus en plus pressante surtout en nouveaux produits. Monsieur K. Comlan sollicite un montant de $1000 pour l’approvisionnement de la boutique et l’amélioration de ses prestations.

loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Akoélé K. was born in Yovovi-Kondji. She is 35, the mother of three and head of her household since her husband has taken a second wife and no longer cares for her or her children. She supports herself and her children by making manioc flour, an activity she has pursued for 10 years. Her production and income, however, are limited by insufficient capital. At this time she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy manioc in bulk allowing her to increase her family's standard of living.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame K. Akoélé est née à Yovovi-Kondji. A 35 ans, elle est devenu ce qu’il est convenu d’appeler « chef de famille » de par sa bravoure à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Son mari ayant épousé une seconde femme, ne s’occupe plus d’elle et de ses enfants. L’avenir de ces derniers tient beaucoup à cœur à Madame K. Akoélé qui s’est adonnée totalement à la transformation de manioc en gari ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans. Mais le manque de moyen financier limite sa production et donc ses revenus. Aujourd’hui elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin d’acheter en grande quantité le manioc. Ceci l’emmènera à satisfaire tous les clients et à dégager beaucoup de revenus susceptibles de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat de manioc pour sa transformation en farine

loans.name: Tinavi

texts.fr:
Tinavi Amedjodti-Gododja is married with four children. She also cares for the two children of her husband's other wife who passed away. Her husband is a cabinetmaker but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. In order to make ends meet, Tinavi sells red palm oil. Being undercapitalized, Tinavi doesn't see the benefits of her skills. She is asking for a loan of $700 to buy palm kernels and put away a stock of oil to sell in periods of greater demand and higher prices. This loan will help her increase her income to meet the basic needs of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madame AMEDJODTI-GODODJA Tinavi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge deux (2) enfants de sa coépouse décédée. Son mari menuisier n’arrive pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille car son revenu ne le permet pas. Alors, Madame A. Tinavi est obligée de contribuer à partir des revenus de son commerce d’huile rouge de palme. Maîtrisant bien son activité, elle arrive à bien s’en sortir mais son fonds de commerce est très insuffisant pour développer et accroître ses activités. Pour cela, elle sollicite aujourd’hui un financement de $700 pour l’achat des noix de palme et faire un stock important pour être revendu en période de soudure. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’accroître sa production et augmenter ses revenus pour assurer les besoins élémentaires de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy palm kernels for making oil.

loans.name: Sodahoin

texts.fr:
Sodahoin G. is 55. She sells peppers and other vegetables. Her husband left her after she lost her hearing to a long illness. To support herself Sodahoin began buying vegetables from farmers on credit to resell. She barely makes enough to survive and she and her four children live in extreme poverty. Sodahoin is friendly and hardworking. At this time she is asking for a loan of $750 to help her increase her revenues and better care for her children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 55 ans, Madame G. Sodahoin est revendeuse de légumes et piments. Devenue sourde à la suite d’une longue maladie, elle a été abandonnée par son mari à cause de ce handicap. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle est obligée d’aller acheter les légumes et piments à crédit chez les jardiniers et de les revendre. Le peu de bénéfice suffit à peine à nourrir une bouche. Aussi Madame G. et ses quatre (4) enfants vivent-ils dans une extrême pauvreté. Dynamique et populaire, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour accroître ses revenus et sortir ses enfants de cette situation.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Gbédézouhoin

texts.fr:
Gbédézouhoin K. is 44 years old and the mother of six. In addition, she cares for her aged parents. Her husband, a farmer, does not carry his share of the household responsibilites so, as the family breadwinner, Gbédézouhoin goes to market each day to sell her wares. She frequently has to turn to loan sharks to restock, a costly practice. In order to care for her family she is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase manioc with which to make the flour she sells in markets around the capital Lomé. She hopes in assuming this credit to free herself from the reach of loansharks so she can see the fruit of her labors.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame K. Gbédézouhoin est mère de six (6) enfants et à charge ses parents devenus inactifs. Son mari cultivateur n’assume presque pas ses responsabilités vis-à-vis de sa famille. Devenue « chef » de cette famille, elle se débat chaque jour, allant de marché en marché afin d’écouler ses produits. Le peu de bénéfices dégagés rentre directement dans les dépenses du foyer l’obligeant à recourir souvent aux usuriers avant de s’approvisionner de nouveau. Ruinée par cette pratique et soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 destiner à acheter des manioc et les transformer en gari destiné à la vente dans les marchés environnants et à Lomé la capital. Le financement dudit projet va sauver Madame K. Gbédézouhoin de la gueule des usuriers et lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy manioc to make flour.

loans.name: Bébé

texts.fr:
Bébé A. was born in 1977 in Yohono. She is very hard-working and has ten years of experience selling farm implements such as hoes, machetes and shears which her husband makes. Demand for these tools now outstrips her husband's production so Bébé has started buying from other craftsmen as well to maintain her stocks. This year she is asking for a loan of $800 to restock her business and increase her sales.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Bébé est née en 1977 à Yohono u. Très dévouée, elle s’est donnée au commerce des outils agricole (houe, coupe-coupe, couteaux) et autres fabriqués par son mari. C’est un commerce qu’elle exerce il y a maintenant 10 ans, ce qui lui confère une grande expérience en la matière. La production de son mari étant très insuffisante pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante, elle est obligée d’acheter auprès d’autres fabricants. Elle fait généralement des stocks de ces outils avant de les revendre. Cette année, elle demande un crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir redynamiser son commerce et améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To buy farm inplements for resale.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo Y. was born in 1975 in Agomé-Glozou. He is married and has three children. After leaving secondary school he decided to pursue photography and used his meager means to procure several cameras. He works hard to support himself and his family, specializing in video editing and still photography. At this time, he is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a video camera so he can earn more money.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1975 à Agomé-Glozou (P/Lacs), Monsieur Y. Kodjo est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Abandonnant ses études au niveau secondaire, il a choisi de se spécialiser dans la photographie. Aujourd’hui, il est spécialiste en production vidéo et photo. Le peu de moyens dont il dispose lui a permis de se procurer quelques appareils photo avec lesquels il se débrouille pour son pain quotidien. Il veut se procurer également d’un appareil caméra pour associer la production vidéo, ce qui lui rapporterait beaucoup d’argent. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200.

loans.use: To buy a video camera

loans.name: Agbissi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agbissi A. is a 35 year-old woman who lives in a village called Adidomé. She is a married mother of six (6) children, and is involved in the trade of coconut oil. Her business consists of buying oil in bulk quantities and reselling it for a small profit. The income which she earns makes it possible for her to participate in taking care of her family's needs. In order to re-stock her storage of oil for re-sale, she is asking for financial support of $1200. That will enable her to improve her income and the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agbissi est une dame de 35 ans qui réside dans le village d’Adidomé. Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, elle se dévoue avec le commerce de l’huile de coco. Cette activité consiste à acheter de l’huile en quantité et de revendre afin d’en tirer quelques profits. Le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité lui permet de participer en grande partie à la gestion du foyer. Pour redynamiser son activité, elle a besoin d’un appui financier de $1200 qui lui permettra de faire un stockage d’huile à revendre. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et des conditions de vie de sa famille.FAFALI

loans.use: Buying and reselling coconut oil

loans.name: Mitroayebou

texts.fr:
Mr. Mitroayébou S. is a well-known farmer in the village of Tannou. Born in 1947, he started working in the fields at a very young age. He is married and a father of twenty five (25) children whom he supports thanks to the earnings from his agricultural activites. Nowadays, his cultivated fields are becoming exhausted and do not produce as much as they used to. This is worrying, especially since the land is his only source of income. He is asking for a loan of $1200 in order to buy fertilizer in order to revive the yield of his fields. This will enable him to provide sufficient income for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Mitroayébou est un agriculteur très reconnu dans le village de tannou. Né en 1947, il a débuté ses travaux de culture de la terre dès le bas âge. Il est aujourd’hui marié et père de vingt cinq (25) enfants qu’il supporte grâce aux revenus tirés de son agriculture. De nos jours, les terres cultivées sont épuisées et n’arrivent plus à produire comme cela se doit. C’est un fait inquiétant quand on sait que c’est sa seule source de revenu. Il sollicite ainsi un crédit de $1200 pour acheter du fertilisant afin de raviver la capacité de production des terres qu’il cultive. Cela lui permettra de subvenir valablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer for land

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi K. is 55 years old and mother of five (5) children. A widow for 5 years, she alone supports her entire family thanks to her business of manufacturing and selling coconut oil, which she has been running for the last 20 years. The quality of her oil has made her famous and she is well-known in her area. Mrs. Ablavi K. likes her business very much and would now like to give it another dimension in order to increase sales and provide for the needs for her children. She therefore requests a credit of $600 which she will use to buy coconuts and transform them into the coconut oil well appreciated in her village.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 55 ans, Madame K. Ablavi est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Veuve depuis 5 ans, elle supporte seule les charges de sa famille grâce à son activité de fabrication et de vente d’huile de noix de coco qu’elle exerce il y a une vingtaine d’années. La qualité de son huile l’a rendue célèbre et est courtisée dans la localité. Très amoureuse de son activité, Madame K. Ablavi voudrait donner une autre dimension à son travail afin d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et subvenir normalement aux besoins de ses enfants. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 qui lui servira à acheter des noix de coco et à les transformer en huile de coco très appréciée dans le milieu.

loans.use: Buying coconuts for oil production

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Born in 1973 in the village of Tannou, Mr. Kokou S. is an honest farmer. Married and father of five (5) children, he produces corn and manioc on his land. The corn is sold while the manioc is transformed into gari and tapioca before being sold. This business has helped him to provide for the needs of his family. However, the lands now need to be refertilized. Mr. S. therefore requests a credit of $1200 in order to buy fertilizer for his land in order to increase its yield and production capacity.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1973 dans le village de Tannou, Monsieur S. Kokou est un brave agriculteur. Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il fait la production du maïs et du manioc. Le premier est vendu tandis que le second est transformé en gari et tapioca avant d’être commercialisé. C’est une activité qui lui permet grâce aux revenus tirés de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais les terres ont besoins d’être redynamisées. Ainsi, Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter du fertilisant pour ses terres afin d’accroître leur capacité de production.KO

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Holotodé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Holotodé E. is a 22 year-old mother of three (3) children whose father is a young motorbike taxi driver. His motor bike often breaks down because it is vey old. Also, this small family lives in poverty and can only afford one meal per day. Although Mrs. Holotodé E. has a business activity of buying corn on credit and reselling it, this is hardly enough to feed the children. Having enough customers and very dynamic, she requests a credit of $600 in order to stock up with a larger amount of corn and beans in the harvest period, thus lowering the cost, and resell it at a higher price when the appropriate time comes. The financing of his project will make it possible for Mrs. E. to avoid buying on credit and will help her escape the misery in which she and her family currently live in.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 22 ans, Madame E. Holotodé est mère de trois (3) enfants dont le père est d’un jeune conducteur de taxi moto. La moto de ce dernier tombe souvent en panne parce que très vieille. Aussi cette famille vit-elle dans la misère accrue et condamnée à un repas par jour. L’activité de Madame E. Holotodé qui consiste à acheter le maïs à crédit et de le revendre, suffit à peine à nourrir les enfants. Disposant d’assez de clients et très dynamique, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 afin de faire un stockage consistant du maïs et du haricot en cette période de récolte et donc moindre coût et de les revendre très cher au moment venu. Ce projet financé permettra à Madame E. de dégager d’énorme bénéfice servant de fonds de roulement et lui permettant d’éviter d’acheter à crédit et surtout la misère dans laquelle elle et sa famille végètent actuellement.

loans.use: Buying and storing cereals

loans.name: Sossou

texts.fr:
Mr. Sossou D. was born in 1980 in Ahonlogoe in the Vo Prefecture. He currently resides in the same village with his family. Married and father of four (4) children, he is a honest farmer who produces different crops. His speciality is truck farming; which he practices with great enthusiasm. The income drawn from this activity enables him to provide for the needs for his family and to ensure the schooling of his children. To secure his business and to be able to cultivate his crops regardless of season, he would like to dig a well in his garden so that the problem of water shortage is mitigated. For this purpose, he requests a credit of $1200.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Sossou est né en 1980 à Ahonlogoe dans la Préfecture de Vo. Il réside actuellement dans le même village avec sa famille. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il est un brave agriculteur qui développe des cultures variées. Sa spécialité est surtout le maraîchage ; ce qu’il pratique avec enthousiasme. Le revenu tiré de cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour sécuriser cette activité et faire des cultures contre saisons, il a un projet de creusage de puit dans son jardin afin que soit pallié le problème de pénurie d’eau. Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and digging of a well

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
Mr. Alphonse D. is 35 years old and lives in the village of Avégloédjigan in the prefecture of Vo. With two people to support, he draws his income essentially from providing a service. What he does is go from village to village grating cassava for the local growers. But the mill does not belong to him and he has to make a tally at the end of each day and make do with what is left over. With his experience in this matter, it has become clear that this could be a very profitable activity if the machine belonged to him. He therefore aspires to buying a mill for grating cassava, with which he will improve his income and his quality of life. To do this, he is asking for a loan of $1,200.

Monsieur D. Alphonse est âgé de 35 ans et vit dans le village d’Avégloédjigan dans la préfecture de Vo. Ayant deux (2) personnes en charge, il tire ses revenus essentiellement de ses prestations de services. En effet, il circule de village en village pour râper le manioc aux populations productrices. Mais le moulin ne l’appartient pas et il doit faire le compte à chaque fin de journée et se contente du surplus. Avec son expérience en la matière, il s’est rendu à l’évidence que c’est une activité très rentable si la machine lui appartenait. Ainsi, il aspire à l’achat d’un moulin râpeuse de manioc avec lequel il aura à améliorer son revenu et sa qualité de vie. Pour ce faire, il demande un crédit de $1200.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a mill for grating cassava

loans.name: Sokahoin

texts.fr:
Aged 40, Mrs. Sokahoin F. currently lives in Avégloédjigan where she was born. Married and the mother of six children, she is a fine woman who works hard for a living. A professional hairdresser, she has an associated business of selling hair accessories such as pomades, extensions, straightener and shampoo. She has come to realize that this business is very profitable and the income is of enormous support to her. To have a steady and regular income, she wants to set up a sales outlet where she can sell these products, especially hair extensions of all types. She is asking for a credit of $800. Realizing this project will enable her to be financially independent.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame F. Sokahoin réside actuellement à Avégloédjigan où elle est née. Mariée et mère e six (6) enfants, elle est une brave dame qui se bat pour son pain quotidien. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits accessoires de coiffure comme des pommades, des mèches, du défrisant et du champoing. Elle s’est rendue compte que la rentabilité de ce commerce n’est pas négligeable et ce revenu la soutient énormément. Pour stabiliser et régulariser son revenu, elle veut installer un point de vente de ces produits surtout les mèches de toutes sortes. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir une indépendance financière.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy and sell hair accessories

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houndjénouko A. is a young woman of 20 years. Born in Avéglidjigan in the prefecture of Vo, she is married and has one (1) young son. Very dynamic and interested in business from a young age, she owns a small store in which she sells a little bit of everything, which includes basic need goods. This business, which she runs with joy, provides her with a small income which allows her to take care of her small family, since her husband has been unemployed for a little while.

However, her financial difficulties often lead to stock shortages, which makes her lose many clients, because we are currently in an age of competition where there are sellers everywhere. To remedy this situation and obtain a higher income to better take care of her family, Mrs. Houndjénouko A. is asking for a loan of $600. This sum will allow her to supply her shop just as well as the large retail stores.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Houndjénouko est une jeune femme de 20 ans. Née à Avéglidjigan dans la préfecture de Vo, elle est mariée et est mère d’un (1) petit garçon. Très dynamique et aimant le commerce depuis son jeune âge, elle à une petite boutique dans laquelle elle vend un peu de tout c'est-à-dire des produits de première nécessité. Cette activité qu’elle exerce avec joie, lui procure un peu de revenu qui lui permet de s’occuper de sa petite famille car son mari depuis un certain temps est en chômage.

Mais son incapacité financière fait qu’elle a souvent des ruptures de stock ; ce qui la fait perdre beaucoup de clients car nous sommes aujourd’hui dans un monde de concurrence où il y a des vendeurs un peu partout. Pour remédier à cette situation et procurer un revenu un peu plus élevé pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille, Madame A. Houndjénouko sollicite un prêt de $600. Cette somme lui permettra également de s’approvisionner dans les grands magasins de vente en gros.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Akouessoudé

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of four children, Mrs. Akouessoudé K. was born in 1967 in the prefecture of Vo. She currently lives in the village of Avéglodjigan where she runs a straw mat business. She buys the mats on credit from mat weavers and sells them from market to market. Once sold, she pays for them and makes do with anything left over. She admits that it would be a profitable business, especially if she had sufficient funds to pay for the mats in cash. To realize this plan, she is asking for a loan of $700 to invest in the business. This will enable her to improve her quality of life while giving her financial independence.

Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, Madame K. Akouessoudé est née en 1967 dans la Préfecture de Vo. Elle réside actuellement dans le village d’Avéglodjigan où elle exerce le commerce de nattes. Elle prend des nattes à crédit auprès des tresseuses et elle les met en vente de marché en marché. Après la vente, elle paye et se contente du surplus s’il y en a. Elle avoue que c’est un commerce rentable surtout si elle dispose d’un fond de commerce propre avec lequel elle achète au comptant les nattes. Pour réaliser ce dessein. Elle demande un apport financier de $700 pour investir dans ce commerce. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer sa qualité de vie en ayant une indépendance financière.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy and sell straw mats

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born in Tannou in 1978, Mr Komi A. is a very dynamic man. Married and the father of three children, he takes care of three others (two cousins and his mother). He is able to support them thanks to the income from his farm work. Educated only to primary level, he had to stop his studies early because of the death of his father. Having understood very quickly that work makes the man, he gathered his courage and put it into working hard at ploughing. Today Mr. A. wants to take advantage of this opportunity and is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy fertilizer in order to improve the quality of his soil. He will thus be able to increase his harvest and succeed in better meeting the needs of his family.

Né à Tannou en 1978, Monsieur A. Komi est un homme très dynamique. Marié et père de trois (3) enfants, il a à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes (2 cousins et sa mère). Il arrive à supporter ces charges grâce au revenu de son travail agricole. Instruit de niveau primaire, il cessa précocement les études après le décès de son père. Ayant compris très vite que le travail fait l’homme, il prit son courage et le place au profit du labour. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur A. Komi veut saisir cette opportunité et sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter de l’engrais afin d’enrichir ses sols agricoles. Ainsi, il pourra augmenter sa récolte et réussir à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Adando

texts.fr:
Mr Adando T. is a very active young man of 40. He was born in Yohonou, in the Vo prefecture, and is the father of four children. As a manufacturer of hoes and other farming tools, he is popular with local farmers because of the impeccable quality of his products. The small income he makes from this activity enables him to meet the needs of his family, particularly the education of his children. As he himself is illiterate, he wants to see his children become managers. Ambitious and entrepreneurial, he wants to link his craft with selling hoes, machetes and knives. But to achieve this requires financial input. Faced with this situation, he is asking for a loan of $600. The income from the business will contribute to the blossoming of his entire family, especially his children, whom he loves so much.

Monsieur T. Adando est un jeune homme très actif à 40 ans. Il est né à Yohonou dans la préfecture de Vo et est père de quatre (4) enfants. Fabricant de houes et autres outils de champ, il est apprécié par les cultivateurs de sa localité à cause de la qualité irréprochable de ses produits. Le petit revenu que lui procure son activité lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de la famille surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants ; car étant analphabète, il veut voir ses enfants devenir des cadres. Aussi ambitieux et ayant l’esprit d’entreprenariat il veut associer à son métier, le commerce de houes, de dabas, de coupe-coupe et couteaux. Mais cette réalisation nécessite des moyens financiers. Face à cette situation, il vient solliciter un prêt de $600. Le revenu de ce commerce contribuera à l’épanouissement de toute sa famille surtout ses enfants qu’il aime tant.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Business selling hoes, machettes and knives

loans.name: A. Philomène

texts.fr:
Aged 32, Mrs. Philomene G. is married and the mother of two children. Her everyday business is selling crockery. She buys her merchandise in Lomé and sells it in all the local markets. Her smile and welcome makes her distinctive. Mrs. G. is now hoping to increase the size of her market stall in order to be able to satisfy the demand of her clientele. For this reason she would like to take advantage of this new opportunity to have a loan of $800 to buy merchandise in bulk. The profit she makes from this business will help her to take better care of her children’s health, schooling and food.

Agée de 32 ans, Madame G. A. Philomène est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. La vente des assiettes est son activité de tous les jours. Elle achète ses marchandises à Lomé et les écoule sur tous les marchés locaux. Son sourire et son accueil fait d’elle une particularité. Aujourd’hui, Madame G. A. Philomène espère agrandir son étalage afin d’être en mesure de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, elle veut saisir cette nouvelle opportunité pour avec un crédit de $800 afin d’acheter en gros ses marchandises. Les bénéfices de ce commerce lui serviront à mieux s’occuper de ses enfants en matière de santé, de scolarité et de nourriture.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To increase the size of her market stall

loans.name: K. Rodolphe

texts.fr:
Born in Bénin in 1976, Mr. Rodolphe K. L. currently lives in Afomonou with his wife and children. In addition to his family, he has three others to support, making a total of six people. His main business is growing pineapples. Educated to 10th grade, he has taken the small savings he made from sharecropping and invested them in agriculture in general and pineapple production in particular. Today he knows many companies that make pineapple juice, so he has to increase his production. To do so, he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to benefit from a loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizer and introduce a new type of pineapple that is more profitable. This way, Mr. Rodolphe L. will be able to improve the living conditions of everyone in his care.

Né au Bénin en 1976, Monsieur L. K. Rodolphe vit actuellement à Afomonou avec sa femme et ses enfants. Outre ses derniers, il compte à sa charge trois (3) personnes soit au total six (6) personnes. La production des ananas est son principal travail. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a investi sa petite économie issue du métayage dans l’agriculture en général et la production des ananas en particulier. Aujourd’hui, il a fait la connaissance de nombreuses sociétés productrice de jus d’ananas, ce qui l’oblige à augmenter sa production. Pour cela, il veut saisir cette opportunité pour bénéficier d’un crédit de $1200 afin d’acheter de l’engrais et introduire une nouvelle espèce d’ananas plus rentable. Ainsi, Monsieur L. Rodolphe pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de toutes les personnes à sa charge.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi K. is a 33-year-old married father of seven children. With only a secondary-school education, he left school very early to work in agriculture. Recognized as the principal producer of pineapples in his village, he has enough revenue to cover household expenses. His wife assists him in his work. Over the last few years, Mr. K. has been able to acquire new clients. Demand has grown greatly, and he is seeking a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer to increase the fertility of his soil. The revenue from the sale of his products will allow him to improve his family’s living conditions from a nutritional, educational and health standpoint.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur K. Yaovi est aujourd’hui marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il cessa très tôt les études pour le travail agricole. Reconnu comme le principal producteur d’ananas dans son village, il arrive à subvenir aux charges du ménage à partir de ce revenu. Sa femme l’aide dans ses travaux. Au cours de ces dernières années, Monsieur K. Yaovi a réussi à découvrir d’autres clients. La demande étant devenue très élevée, il sollicite ce crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter de l’engrais afin de rendre ses sols plus fertiles. Après la vente, les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille sur les plans alimentaire, éducatif et sanitaire.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Born in 1966 in Afagnan, Ms. Yawa K. is a married mother of five and also cares for her elder sister’s two children. She is involved in the sale of foodstuffs (cooked beans) to cover her family’s expenses. Faced with increasing demand and a rise in the price of beans, her primary production material, Ms. K. is seeking a loan of $500 to increase the size of her business and her sales. This project is worthy of support, as it will allow her to better care for her children.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966 à Afagnan, Madame K. Yawa est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants et à sa charge deux (2) enfants de la sœur aînée. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de denrée alimentaire (haricot préparé) pour assumer les charges de sa famille. Face à la demande croissante et la hausse du niveau du prix de l’haricot qui constitue sa matière première de production, Madame K. Yawa sollicite un crédit de $500 pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et accroître son chiffre d’affaire. Ce projet mérite d’être soutenu car sa réalisation va lui permettre de bien prendre soins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Bean storage

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Born in 1962, Mr. Yaovi B. is a married father of nine children. His primary activity is agriculture. It is from this work that he provides for the needs of his family. With only a primary school education, he possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and good management abilities. After 30 years in the agriculture business, Mr. B. knows all the ins and outs of the trade. In order to combat the low yield of his lands, he is seeking financial support in the amount of $1000 to acquire fertilizers in hopes of achieving greater agricultural productivity. The sale of his products will allow him to improve his family’s living conditions. He will also augment his savings capacity.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962, Monsieur B. Yaovi est marié et père de neuf (9) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture. C’est de ce travail qu’il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Instruit de niveau primaire, il possède un bon esprit d’entreprise et une bonne capacité de gestion. Près de 30 ans d’activités agricoles, Monsieur B. Yaovi connaît tous les rouages de l’agriculture. Voulant lutter contre la pauvreté de ses terres, il sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour s’approvisionner en fertilisants afin d’espérer à une meilleure production agricole. La vente des produits lui servira à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Aussi pourra t-il renforcer sa capacité d’épargne.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase fish stock

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou Yovoh is a young man, 29 years of age, from the village of Tannou. He is a committed young man who, in addition to agriculture, is involved in animal breeding, an activity he is passionate about. His breeding business, although traditional, has been more successful than expected and he would like to make more out of it. He plans to build an enclosure for the animals and introduce selected species. He is seeking financial support in the amount of $800. The project will allow him to improve his revenue in the medium term and build a stable home.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur YOVOH Kokou est un jeune homme de 29 ans dans le village de Tannou. C’est un jeune très dévoué qui, en dehors de l’agriculture, s’essaye en élevage, activité pour laquelle il a un amour. Son élevage, quoique traditionnel, lui réussit plus qu’attendu et il veut en faire plus. Il a un projet de construction d’enclos pour les bêtes et l’introduction d’espèces sélectionnées. Il sollicite un appui financier de $800. C’est un projet qui lui permettra à moyen terme d’améliorer son revenu et pouvoir fonder un foyer équilibré.

loans.use: Construction of an enclosure and introduction of selected species of animals

loans.name: Mawugné Christine

texts.fr:
Born in 1978 in Aného, Ms. Mawugné Christine A. is a married mother of three children. Her primary activity is the sale of plastic shoes and ladies’ handbags, which she buys in Lomé and resells in various markets in the vicinity of her town of Afagnan. She is a master of her trade and manages her business with meticulous care. For the purpose of meeting the ever-increasing demand in the markets, she is seeking a loan of $900 to purchase items in bulk and rent a space for a shop. This project will allow Ms. A. to improve her family's living conditions and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978 à Aného, Madame A. Mawugné Christine est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des chaussures en plastique et les sacs de sortie pour dame qu’elle achète à Lomé pour les revendre dans plusieurs marchés avoisinants de sa localité qui n’est outre que Afagnan. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de son activité qu’elle gère avec un soin minutieux. C’est dans l’optique de couvrir plus les marchés dont la demande ne cesse de croître qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $900 avec lequel elle compte acheter chez les grossistes et louer une pièce pour en faire une boutique. La réalisation de ce projet conduira Madame A. Mawugné Christine à une amélioration des conditions de vie de toute sa famille et une augmentation du niveau de son épargne.

loans.use: Renting a shop and buying merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Ayawovi Doris

texts.fr:
Born in Vogan on December 20, 1979, Ms. Ayawovi Doris K. currently lives in Afagnan. She is married and cares for her mother and younger sister. The sale of dinnerware and plastic buckets is her daily activity. In business for over 15 years now, she has become a master of her trade. Since her arrival in Afagnan, she has successfully increased her clientele, which now requires her to increase her sales capacity. She buys merchandise from Lomé and sells it at her Afagnan location. She is now seeking a loan of $800 to buy merchandise in bulk in Lomé, in hopes of achieving higher sales. Increased sales would allow her to cover the costs of her sister's schooling and take care of her mother.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Vogan le 20 décembre 1979, Madame K. Ayawovi Doris vit actuellement à Afagnan. Mariée, elle a à sa charge sa mère et sa petite sœur. La vente des assiettes et des seaux en plastique reste son activité quotidienne. Plus de 15 ans déjà, elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce. Depuis son arrivée à Afagnan, elle a réussi à augmenter l’effectif de ses clients, ce qui l’oblige à agrandir sa capacité de vente.
