Elle achète ses marchandises de Lomé et revient les vendre sur place à Afagnan. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite ce financement de $800 pour acheter en gros à Lomé, afin d’espérer une bonne vente. A partir de ses nouveaux chiffres d’affaire, elle pourra mieux prendre en charge sa sœur en scolarité et sa mère.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of dinnerware

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Born in 1960, Mr. A. Messan is married and the father of eight children. Educated until secondary school, he left his studies to take up farming. Agriculture has become his beloved job, and is his principle source of income. Moreover, selling his crops is how he is able to support his children. In light of the current high demand, Mr. A. Messan would like to improve his land and production to meet the market. In order to do this, he is seeking a $1200 loan to buy fertilizer in the hopes of bettering his harvest. He would then be able to better take care of his children's schooling, health, and food.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1960, Monsieur A. Messan est marié et père de huit (8) enfants. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a fini par renouer avec le travail de houe. Devenu son métier adoré, l’agriculture fait son principal revenu. C’est d’ailleurs à partir de la vente des produits agricoles qu’il arrive à prendre en charge ses enfants. Vu le niveau actuel très élevé des demandes, Monsieur A. Messan pense enrichir son espace cultural pour pouvoir être à la hauteur des demandes. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 afin de s’acheter des fertilisants pour espérer une bonne prospérité de la récolte. Par ce moyen, il pourra mieux s’occuper de ses enfants sur les plans scolaire, sanitaire et alimentaire.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his onion business

loans.name: Sogbossi

texts.fr:
Thirty-three years old, Mrs. K. Sogbossi is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a taxi-moto driver and she can't expect much income from his job. For this reason, she joined her mother's business producing palm oil. Very early in the morning, basket on her head, she goes into the fields to buy palm kernels from villagers, which she stores until she has enough to process for trade. In the local market her palm oil is preferred by many customers. Today demand has risen and she is seeking a $600 loan to satisfy her clientele. With this loan, she will be better able to meet the many needs of her children including food, schooling and health in the hopes that they will grow and succeed.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 33 ans, Madame K. Sogbossi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. L’activité de son mari est la conduite de taxi mot. Elle n’attend pas de lui grande chose. Pour cela, elle a renouée avec la principale activité de sa mère : la production de l’huile de palme. Très tôt les matins, panier sur la tête, elle rentre dans les champs pour acheter les noix de palme auprès des paysans, qu’elle garde en quantité suffisante avant de commercer la transformation. Au marché local, son huile est bien appréciée par les consommateurs. Aujourd’hui, la demande devenue plus importante, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 afin de satisfaire ses clients. Par ceci, elle pourra mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de ses enfants en matière d’alimentation, de scolarité et de santé afin d’espérer à un complet épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: Stocking palm kernels to produce palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his business

loans.name: Zoumavo

texts.fr:
Born in Agomé-Glozou in 1951, Mrs. Y. Zoumavo is married and the mother of six children. In addition to her children, she also responsible for supporting six other people as well. Preparing grocery products is her daily activity. She's known by everyone for her warm welcome, her smile, and her open-mindedness. Over 20 years in business have made her an expert in her trade. In prosperous times she stocks beans in bags and buys oil that she stores in drums and wood in order to sell them later for a better price when they are in short supply on the market. Today she is seeking a $600 loan to finance this activity. The earnings from her sales will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Agomé-Glozou en 1951, Madame Y. Zoumavo est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Outre ces derniers, elle a à sa charge six (6) autres personnes. La préparation des denrées est son activité quotidienne. Connue de tous pour son accueil, son sourire et son ouverture. Plus de 20 ans d’activité déjà, lui confère une maîtrise parfaite de son activité. Pendant les périodes d’abondance, elle achète du haricot qu’elle stock en sacs, de l’huile qu’elle met en bidons et du bois afin de s’attendre à une bonne vente en temps de pénurie. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir faire tout cela. Les bénéfices de la vente lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Stocking of beans and oil

loans.name: Komlan Bertin

texts.fr:
Born in 1967, Mr. A. Komlan Bertin is married and the father of three children. He works as a farmer everyday. Educated until secondary school, he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to attend. Bestowed with a good work ethic, he has whole heartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. He is now seeking a $1000 loan to buy fertilizer for his crops in the hopes of producing a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better better meet the needs of his many family members and improve his work conditions.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1967, Monsieur A. Komlan Bertin est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. L’agriculture est son travail quotidien. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a dû cesser très tôt l’école pour défaut de support. Nanti d’un bon esprit de travail, il s’est investi dans l’agriculture. Aujourd’hui, grâce à ce travail, il est devenu un homme connu de tous pour son courage, il est la personne de référence qui est toujours donné en exemple. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite ce crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter des fertilisants à ses cultures afin d’espérer une bonne récolte en fin de saison agricole. Ainsi, il pourra mieux subvenir aux nombreuses charges de sa famille et améliorer ses conditions de travail.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Kékéli

texts.fr:
Madame P. Kékéli was born December 9th, 1981 in Aneho in the Lake Prefecture. She gave up studying at an early age because she couldn't afford it, and began selling used clothing. As a single woman she had two children when she was very young and must now care for them as well as her aging mother. Today Madame P. Kékéli sells only used sheets, which bring in a good profit. To improve her business and increase earnings, she would like to buy sheets in bulk to sell to retailers. This project will require substantial capital and she is thus seeking a $600 loan to accomplish it. This investment will help her properly provide for her household.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame P. Kékéli est née le 09 décembre 1981 à Aného dans la préfecture dans Lacs. Elle abandonna vite ses études par manque de moyens et s’adonna à la vente des produits de la friperie. Jeune fille célibataire, elle eu très tôt deux (02) enfants qui sont entièrement à sa charge aujourd’hui en plus de sa maman fatiguée par le poids de l’âge. A ce jour, Madame P. Kékéli vend exclusivement des draps de lit de friperie qu’elle trouve très rentable. Pour améliorer ce commerce et en tirer plus de bénéfice, elle souhaite acheter elle-même des balles de draps de friperie et le revendre aux détaillants. Ce projet nécessite des moyens financiers importants et sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir le réaliser. Cela pourra l’aider à assurer convenablement les charges de son ménage.

loans.use: Purchase of stock in bulk

loans.name: Agbaze

texts.fr:
A mature woman, Madame A. Agbazé was born in 1947 in Attitogon village but currently lives in Aklakou in the Lake Prefecture. She is very dedicated and has refused to become complacent despite her age and that of her four children. Her primary economic activity is hair braiding, which she has been doing since she was young. Her outdated tools however, don't allow her to be very productive. This is why she is seeking a $600 loan to obtain more modern equipment which will allow her to improve profits to meet her daily needs.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme de troisième âge, Madame A. Agbazé est née en 1947 dans le village d’Attitogon et vit actuellement à Aklakou dans la Préfecture des Lacs. Très dévouée, elle ne s’est pas résignée malgré son âge avancé et la maturité de ses quatre (4) enfants. Sa principale activité consiste à tresser des nattes, ce qu’elle exerce depuis son jeune âge. La vétusté de ses matériels ne lui permet plus d’obtenir un bon rendement. C’est alors qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour se procurer de quelques équipements modernes lui permettant d’améliorer son rendement et de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.

loans.use: Purchase of modern equipment

loans.name: Adjovi Paula

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi Paula A., 50 years old, is an energetic woman who works tirelessly to provide for the needs of her four (4) children. Her business is the sale of fabric, which she has already been practicing for 10 years. Today her household expenses have become heavier and the income she derives from her occupation is more and more insufficient.

She would like to expand her business but her financial means are very limited. This is why she is applying for a loan of $600 that will allow her to purchase fabric in bulk and then resale it for a larger profit. The execution of this project will bring relief to a whole family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

. Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Adjovi Paula est une femme dynamique qui travaille sans relâche pour assurer les besoins des quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Son activité est la vente des tissus qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans déjà. Aujourd’hui, les charges de son ménage sont devenues plus lourdes et le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité est de plus en plus insuffisant.

Elle désire alors agrandir son commerce mais ses moyens financiers sont très limités. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un crédit d’un montant de $600 qui lui permettra d’acquérir en gros les tissus et de les revendre pour plus de bénéfice. La réalisation de ce projet soulagera toute une famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric in bulk for resale

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Born on September 4, 1964, Mrs. Afi H. is a widow supporting four (4) children. She is very energetic and resourceful woman who had a successful frozen products business before her husband’s death. After his death difficulties started arising for the family. She has known very difficult times but her courage has allowed her to make it and to cover the household expenses. In the last 2 years she has started to sale colorful traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes) that she finds more profitable.

To fulfill all the needs of her growing children and to help them succeed in their education, Mrs. Afi H. would like to broaden her array of fabric (pagnes). She is applying for a loan of $1200 to stock up on new models of fabric (pagnes) and to attract a greater clientele.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 04 Septembre 1964, Madame H. Afi est aujourd’hui une femme veuve avec quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Très entreprenante et dynamique, elle faisait avec succès le commerce des produits congelés jusqu’à la mort de son mari où des difficultés ont commencé par naître dans la famille. Elle connu des moments assez difficiles mais son courage lui a permis de tenir le coup et d’assurer les charges du ménage. Depuis 2 ans, elle a entrepris la vente des pagnes qu’elle trouve plus rentable.

Afin de satisfaire tous les besoins de ses enfants devenus grands et les aider à réussir dans leurs études, Madame H. Afi à l’ambition d’élargir son étalage de pagnes. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1200 pour s’approvisionner en pagnes nouveaux modèles et séduire davantage sa clientèle.

loans.use: Broaden her array of traditional wraparound fabric (pagnes)

loans.name: Todétindé

texts.fr:
A senior citizen, Mrs. Todétindé T. is born in 1937 in the village of Attitogon and currently lives in Aklakou in the County of les Lacs. Very steadfast, she has not resigned herself in spite of her great age and the full growth of her four (4) children. Her main occupation is the production of cassava, a job she has been doing since an early age. The time worn condition of her tools does not allow her to get a good yield any longer. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $600 to acquire manioc and a few modern, less tiring, pieces of equipment that would enable her to increase her yield and to provide for her daily needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Femme de troisième âge, Madame T. Todétindé est née en 1937 dans le village d’Attitogon et vit actuellement à Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Très dévouée, elle ne s’est pas résignée malgré son âge avancé et la maturité de ses quatre (4) enfants. Sa principale activité consiste à produire du gari, ce qu’elle exerce depuis son jeune âge. La vétusté de ses matériels ne lui permet plus d’obtenir un bon rendement. C’est alors qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour se procurer de manioc et de quelques équipement modernes moins fatiguant lui permettant d’améliorer son rendement et de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.

loans.use: Purchase of modern equipment

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokouvi A. is born in 1964 in Attivémé in the County of Zio. He stopped his schooling in 7th grade (middle school) due to a lack of funds. He started to work in agriculture with his parents in order to survive. Today he is married and the father of three (3) children with two (2) additional persons to support. Mr. A. has become a big farmer, this activity allows him to cover his household expenses.

He would like to improve his farming and obtain greater yield to better guarantee the education of his children. Therefore he is requesting a loan of $1200 that will allow him to increase the size of his cultivable land and acquire more modern fertilizers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kokouvi est né en 1964 à Attivémé dans la préfecture du Zio. Il arrêta ses études au niveau 5ème (cours secondaire) par manque de moyens. Il commença alors à cultiver la terre avec ses parents pour pouvoir survivre. Aujourd’hui marié et père de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes à sa charge, Monsieur A. est devenu un grand cultivateur, activité qui lui permet de pouvoir supporter les charges du ménage.

Il désire améliorer cette agriculture et obtenir des rendements plus importants afin de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’élargir sa surface cultivable et d’acquérir des intrants plus modernes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to improve his crops' yield

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born on June 12, 1964 in Boulo Kpéta in the County of Zio, Madame A. Akossiwa Cécile is a seamstress. Because of her parents poverty, she abandoned her studies very early on (elementary level) to go in apprenticeship. She became a seamstress after 3 years of training but was not able to open a shop because of lack of funds.

Married and the mother of two (2) children, to be able to cope, she is compelled to supplement her sewing job by working in the fields. But the situation is becoming more and more difficult and she is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy two more sewing machines and other sewing materials. The financing of this activity will ensure an income allowing her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

. Née le 12 juin 1964 à Bolou Kpéta dans la préfecture du Zio, Madame A. Akossiwa Cécile est couturière de profession. A cause de la pauvreté de ses parents, elle abandonna très tôt les études (cours primaires) pour aller en apprentissage. Elle devient couturière après 3 ans de formation mais n’est pas parvenu à ouvrir un atelier par manque de moyen.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle est obligée de joindre à sa couture les travaux champêtres pour pouvoir s’en sortir. Mais la situation devenant de plus en plus difficile, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’acheter deux machines à coudre et autres matériels de couture. Le financement de cette activité lui assurera un revenu pouvant lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 sewing machines and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Dr. Sykes

texts.en:
Dr. A. A. Sykes is a 54-year-old medical doctor. She is divorced with three children, all in secondary school. Dr. Sykes runs a dispensary, Sykes Medical Dispensary, which can accommodate about twenty patients, located in Kariokoo, Dar es Salaam’s busiest trading area. Her dispensary accommodates cases like malaria, cough, and non-complicated sicknesses together, with first aid services. Complicated cases are referred to the main hospitals immediately.

Alongside the dispensary, she runs a pharmacy which is now two years old, where patients can always go and get medicine after prescription by the physicians. She buys stock from the main suppliers, most of them in the Kariakoo area. She is in need of USD 1200 to help her expand the stock to satisfy the increasing demand of the medicine, and because the number of patients has also increased.

loans.use: Buy stock for the Pharmacy

loans.name: Neyo

texts.fr:
Mrs D. is 43 years old, she is born in the village of d’Agbanakin in the County les Lacs. Very resourceful, she has never been discouraged in spite of the financial difficulties she faces. Her main activity is the purchase of fresh fish that she then smokes for resale. The rudimentary state of her equipment does not allow her to make a profit. This is why she is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a new wood stove and other equipment. This will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions. Her family consists of five (5) children, three (3) little sisters and her husband who is Ill.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

. Agée de 43 ans, Madame D. Néyo est née dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la Préfecture des Lacs. Très entreprenante, elle ne s’est jamais découragée malgré les difficultés financières qu’elle traverse. Sa principale activité consiste à se procurer de poissons frais et les fumer après pour revendre. L’état rudimentaire de ses matériels ne lui permet pas d’obtenir un bon profit. C’est alors qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour s’acheter un nouveau fourneau et du matériel de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de sa famille composée de cinq (5) enfants, de trois (3) petites sœurs en plus de son mari qui est malade.

loans.use: Purchase of a new wood stove and other equipment

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo D. was born in 1985 in Bolou Kpéta (Zio Prefecture). He abandoned his studies in high school because his parent no longer had the means to cover school costs. He therefore turned his attention to agriculture, which he still works in today. A young, single man without children, he knows how to do a good job. He would now like to expand his cultivated plots and thus to obtain better returns.

To do this, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to acquire agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers. Financing this project means supporting the efforts of a young man in a difficult situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Kodjo est né en 1985 à Bolou Kpéta (P/Zio). Il abandonna ses études au lycée parce que ses parents n’avaient plus les moyens d’assurer ses besoins scolaires. Il s’adonna alors à l’agriculture, ce qu’il fait jusqu’à ce jour. Jeune célibataire sans enfant, il a le sens du travail bien fait. Il souhaite aujourd’hui agrandir ses surfaces cultivées et obtenir ainsi de meilleurs rendements.

A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $1200 pour l’acquisition des intrants. Financer ce projet, c’est soutenir les efforts d’un jeune en situation difficile.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies including fertilizer

loans.name: Akoua Louise

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on March 15, 1972, Akoua Louise Y. is married and the mother of two. She could not go far in her studies for having dropped out of middle school. She then got training to become a cashier in a local supermarket that allowed her to help with household expenses. A courageous woman who loves a job done well, she would like to improve her income and to ensure the needs of her children are met.

She thus decided to open her own grocery shop. Her project requires a fair amount of money, and so she is requesting a loan of $800 as capital for grocery items. She has a great deal of experience in this domain.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Lomé le 15 mars 1972, Madame Y. Akoua Louise est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfant. Elle n’a pu aller loin dans les études car elle abandonna l’école au cours secondaire. Elle alla ensuite faire une formation et devient caissière dans un super marché de la place. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Courageuse et aimant le travail bien fait, elle désire améliorer son revenu et assurer efficacement les besoins de ses enfants. Elle décide à cet effet d’ouvrir pour son propre compte une boutique d’alimentation générale. Ce projet nécessite assez de moyens financiers et Madame Y. Akoua Louise sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle dispose d’une grande expérience dans le domaine.

loans.use: Opening a food shop

loans.name: Logossou

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Tsévié (Zio Prefecture), Logossou K. is a father of a family with six children from his two wives. Though lucky enough to have a valuable middle school diploma, he had to abandon his studies due to a lack of funds. He then focused on the business of raising sheep and goats, which he enjoyed doing when he was still in school. Given current problems, his family barely manages to eat two meals a day. In order to acquire new kinds of livestock and to extend the corral for them, he is requesting a loan of $900 to be devoted entirely to his business. The loan will allow him to ensure his family's well-being.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1969 à Tsévié (P/Zio), Monsieur K. Logossou est père d’une famille de six (6) enfants avec ses deux (2) femmes. Nanti d’un diplôme de BEPC, il a dû abandonner les bancs, faute de moyens financiers pour poursuivre les études. Il a alors intensifié l’activité d’élevage de moutons et de chèvres qu’il s’amusait à faire quand il était encore sur les bancs. Avec les difficultés du moment son ménage arrivait à peine à satisfaire 2 repas par jour. Afin de se procurer de nouvelles races et d’étendre son enclos, il sollicite un prêt de $900 pour se donner à fond à cette activité. Ceci lui permettra d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of animals and to extend the corral

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa Y. was born on August 18, 1974 in Lomé. She ended her primary school studies and opted to enter a hairdressing apprenticeship. After completing her training, she was able to open a salon, which she manages effectively. Today, she is married and the mother of one child, and she is faced with rough competition, since hairdressing salons have popped up all over her neighborhood. To overcome this situation, she would like to acquire new salon supplies and to sell jewelry there too, as well as pagnes (colorful traditional cloths typically used as wraps or sarongs).

To do so, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a hairdryer and to serve as capital for selling jewelry and pagnes.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Y. Akossiwa est née le 18 Août 1974 à Lomé. Elle arrêta ses études au cours primaire et opta pour l’apprentissage en coiffure. Après sa formation, elle parvient à ouvrir un salon qu’elle gère avec efficacité. Aujourd’hui mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle est confrontée à une rude concurrence car les salons de coiffure ont poussé partout dans son voisinage. Pour surmonter cette situation, elle désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail et vendre dans son salon des bijoux et des tissus pagnes.

Pour cela, elle sollicite un appui financier d’un montant de $800. Ce crédit va servir à acheter un séchoir puis de fonds de commerce pour la vente des bijoux et des tissus pagnes.

loans.use: To buy a hairdyer and to sell jewelry and traditional cloths

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Born in Tékponou (Vo Prefecture), Akoua A. is a widow and the mother of five. She has been learning how to raise ruminants (sheep and goats) since she was young. As the oldest daughter, she quickly dropped out of school following the death of her father to take care of his livestock pen while her mother took care of her brothers and sisters.

As an adult, she continues in the business of raising livestock which remains her source of income. Truly serious about her work, she would like the assistance of a veterinarian. This is why she is requesting a loan of $1000. She would then buy young caprins (a kind of goat) and pay for the services of a veterinarian, who will have to make periodic visits. The loan will allow her business to come into its own, thus allowing her to provide schooling to her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Tékponou dans la Préfecture de Vo, Madame A. Akoua est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a été initiée à l’activité de l’élevage des ruminants (moutons et chèvres) depuis son enfance. Etant la fille aînée, elle abandonna vite les bancs à la suite du décès de son père. Elle alla s’occuper de l’enclos de bétail de son père quand la maman prenait soin de ses frères et sœurs.

Devenue adulte, elle continua cette activité et est restée sa source de revenus. Pour vraiment donner une importance à la chose, elle souhaiterait l’assistance d’un vétérinaire. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir acheter de jeunes caprins et payer les services d’un vétérinaire qui aura à faire des visites périodique. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’épanouir dans cette activité et partant subvenir à la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy young goats and veterinary services

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A., age 45, is unmarried, has one child, and also has two other dependents. Due to the income from her business selling grocery items and beverages, she manages to meet household needs.

Today, her ambition is to bolster her business and to improve her income in order to cover household expenses appropriately. And so she is requesting financial support in the amount of $1200 as capital for selling food and beverages. She possesses a great deal of experience in her domain and will be able to manage her business successfully.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 45 ans, Madame A. Abra est une femme célibataire avec un enfant. Elle a à sa charge deux autres personnes. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits d'alimentation général et des boissons. C'est grâce au revenu tiré de cette activité qu'elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de son ménage.

Aujourd’hui, elle a pour ambition de renforcer son activité et d'améliorer son revenu afin de pouvoir surpporter convenablement les charges du ménage. Pour cela, elle sollicite un appui financier d'un montant de $1200. Ce crédit servira de fonds de commerce pour la vente des produits d'alimentation générale et de boissons. Elle dispose d'une grande expérience dans le domaine et pourra mener à bien son activité.

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Agbo

texts.fr:
Mr. D. Agbo was born in the Prefecture of Yoto. His parents eventually settled in Vo. It was there that the family activity of raising goats and sheep first started to grow. With the death of his parents, it was all that was left to him and he has an interest in preserving it. He is also responsible for his little family of six (6) members, as well as ten (10) other members from the extented family. To really succeed, he must look after his animals well so he can make enough profit. To do this, he requires a loan of $1,200 to construct an enclosure and purchase some new races. This loan will allow him to meet his responsiblities as head of the family and improve the living conditions of his household as well.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Agbo est originaire de la Préfecture de Yoto. Par mouvement des populations, ses parents sont venus s’installer dans le Vo. C’est là où l’activité d’élevage de chèvres et de moutons a pris son ampleur. Donc même avec la mort de ses parents, c’est tout ce qui a été laissé en héritage. Et il a intérêt à préserver. Il a en charge en plus sa petite famille de six (6) membres et dix (10) autres personnes de la famille à s’occuper d’elles. Pour vraiment venir à bout, il faudrait qu’il entretienne bien ses bêtes pour qu’il tire assez de bénéfice. Pour cela, il a besoin d’argent soit $1200 pour construire un enclos digne de ce nom et acheter de nouvelles races. Ce crédit lui permettra d’honorer ses devoirs de chef de famille et d’améliorer ainsi les conditions de vie de son foyer.

loans.use: Construction of an enclosure and purchase of new races

loans.name: Attovi

texts.fr:
Born in 1962 in Vogan, Mr. A. Attovi lost his parents at a young age. That caused him to abandon his studies and become a pig farmer. Married and father of five (5) children, he also lost his wife 8 years ago. On top of responsibility for his children, he also supports his three sisters and two brothers. The pork he produces supplies the protein to people in the surrounding villages. This work could bring in a lot, if he had more diversified breeds that would distinguish him from other pork producers. To do this, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy new breeds. This project will permit him to provide for the needs of his family. The financing would also permit him to change his quality of life.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962 à Vogan, Monsieur A. Attovi a très tôt perdu ses parents ; ce qui lui a coûté l’abandon de ses études pour devenir un vrai éleveur de porcs. Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il a perdu sa femme il y a 8 ans. En plus des charges de ses enfants, il supporte également ses trois sœur et deux frères. Il exerce le métier d’éleveur pour fournir de la protéine aux personnes à travers les villages environnants. Ce travail peut lui rapporter beaucoup s’il dispose d’une diversité de races qui le distinguera des autres éleveurs. Pour ce faire il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter de nouvelles races. Ce projet lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Le financement permettra également de changer sa qualité de vie.

loans.use: purchase of new breeds of pigs

loans.name: Yao Pascal

texts.fr:
Born in 1956 in Livé, in the Prefecture of Vo, Mr A. Yao Pascal began pork producing as a way to make ends meet. It evolved into subsistance farming, and he decided to start producing animal protein as a way to expand. The responsibilities of the family are high and the market for pork in the area is booming. It is for these reasons the he wants to work twice as hard to lighten the family load. This loan of $800 will go to buy animal feed to insure a better production.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1956 à Livé dans la préfecture de Vo, Monsieur A. Yao Pascal a initié l’élevage de porcs pour pouvoir joindre les deux bouts. Evoluant dans l’agriculture qui est devenue une agriculture de subsistance, il décida de gagner du terrain en produisant de la protéine animale. Les charges de la famille étant exorbitantes, l’activité de l’élevage de porcs devient florissante dans le milieu, c’est pourquoi, il s’efforce d’y mettre les bouchées doubles pour alléger les dépenses de la famille. Ce crédit de $800 servira à acheter essentiellement de la nourriture aux animaux pour assurer une production meilleure.

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
At the age of 41, Mrs A. Akouwa runs a business selling raw ingredients used in the preparation of sauce. Divorced from her husband, she is responsible for her five (5) children which she has trouble supporting. A lack of business capital has kept her from buying merchandise in bulk. Instead, she has had to buy on credit which costs more money. This is why she is asking for a loan to fabricate a shelving unit to better display her merchandise and attract more clients. This loan of $700 will allow her to provide for the family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, Madame A. Akouwa exerce comme activité la vente des produits de consommation destinés à préparer la sauce. Divorcée de son mari, elle a en charge ses cinq (5) enfants qu’elle arrive à supporter difficilement faute de fonds de commerce pouvant lui permettre d’acheter les marchandises en gros et éviter l’achat à crédit qui lui revient plus cher. C’est pourquoi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour fabriquer une étagère pour mieux exposer sa marchandise et attirer plus de clients. Ce crédit de $700 permettra à la famille de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer ainsi leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: fabrication of a shelving unit and purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
At 44 years of age, Mrs A. Abla works primarily selling tomatoes, small fish, okra, peppers, salt etc. In short, all that is needed to make a good sauce. Abandonned by her husband, who went off on an adventure in search of happiness, she works with her little business to support the needs of her five (5) children. She has the habit of buying the merchandise on credit, which costs more than cash. This is why she is asking for a loan of $700. It would serve as business capital, allowing her to buy her merchandise more inexpensively and make more profit from her sales. With that business capital her profit will increase and the living conditions of her family will improve.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame A. Abla a comme activité principale la vente de tomates, petits poissons, gombo, piments, sel etc. Bref, tout ce qui concoure à faire de la bonne sauce. Abandonnée par son mari, parti en aventure à la recherche du bien-être, elle se débrouille avec ce petit commerce pour subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq (5) enfants. Elle a l’habitude d’acheter la marchandise à crédit qui coûte plus chère qu’au comptant. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce prêt de $700 pouvant lui servir de fonds de commerce et aller acheter sa marchandise moins chère afin d’en tirer plus de profit de la vente. Avec cela son chiffre d’affaire sera accru et la condition de vie de sa famille sera améliorée.

loans.use: buying and selling of merchandise

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr:
Born in 1961 in the village of Vogan, Mr A. Paul lives with his six (6) children and his wife. A market gardener by profession, he works a piece of land willed to him. In principal it should be very profitable. However, without the means to purchase the seeds and fertilizer, he is not able to get much from his garden. Gifted in the management of his revenue, he is very confident and feels capable of properly using a loan of $1000. He is asking for the loan to allow him to stockpile fertilizer and buy seeds. This will allow him to improve his sales for the season.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1961 dans un village de Vogan, Monsieur A. Paul réside dans le milieu avec ses six (6) enfants et sa femme. Maraîcher de profession, il exploite un terrain laissé en héritage qui devrait a priori lui être très rentable. Cependant, n’ayant pas les moyens pour acheter au comptant les intrants et les semences, il ne tire pas profit de façon significative de son jardin. Doué dans la gestion de ses revenus, il est très confiant et se sent capable de pouvoir utiliser à bon escient un crédit de $1000 qu’il sollicite pour faire un stockage d’engrais et l’achat de semences. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire pour la saison.

loans.use: fertilizer storage and seed purchase

loans.name: Koumédjina E.

texts.fr:
Mr. Koumédjina E. A. was born in 1956 in Afagnan (Prefecture of Lacs). Very early on, he entered the business of transporting people. He obtained his driver's license in 1974 and helped his colleagues work before buying his own vehicle. This vehicle, acquired in 1986, is now very problematic because of its motor. He has in his care ten (10) people, whom he is unable to support due to his current difficulties. With difficulty, the members of his family eat twice a day. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to restore his vehicle, which is the source of his earnings. This way, his family will blossom.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koumédjina E. est né en 1956 à Afagnan (P/Lacs). Très tôt, il s’est lancé dans le transport en commun de personnes. Il a obtenu son permis de conduire en 1974 et aidait ses collègues à travailler au moment où il n’a pas encore acheté son propre véhicule. Ce véhicule acquis en 1986 lui pose maintenant d’énormes problèmes au niveau du moteur. Il a à sa charge dix (10) personnes qu’il n’arrive pas à supporter avec ses difficultés du moment. Difficilement, les membres de sa famille mangent 2 fois par jour. Il sollicite un prêt $1200 pour remettre en bon état son véhicule qui lui procure le gagne-pain. Ainsi sa famille sera épanouie.

loans.use: To replace his vehicle's motor

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi A. is the manager of a general food store. Currently 53 years old, he began this business with his wife on the roadside. 3 years ago, he set up a shop to increase the size of his business. His parents being sick, he is the only son of the family to take care of them. He also has six (6) children in his care, of whom two are in high school. With expenses becoming increasingly higher, he has trouble managing his business because he has had to draw on his capital base. This loan of $1000 will allow him to supply his store and thus to have a real business foundation. All of this will help to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yaovi est détenteur d’une boutique d’alimentation générale et de divers. Agé de 53 ans, il a commencé cette activité avec sa femme au bord de la route. Il y a 3 ans, il a installé cette boutique pour donner plus d’importance à son commerce. Ses parents malades, il est seul fils de la famille à s’occuper d’eux. Il a également ses six (6) enfants à charge dont 2 au Lycée. Les dépenses devenant de plus en plus croissantes, elle a dû mal gérer son activité puisqu’il a tendance à puiser dans son fonds de commerce. Le montant de $1000 sollicité lui permettra d’approvisionner sa boutique et d’avoir donc un véritable fonds de commerce. Tout ceci va concourir à l’amélioration les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To supply his general food store

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Delphine K. is a married woman with five (5) children. Her husband practices subsistence agriculture which barely suffices to feed the family. The household is confronted daily with all sorts of difficulties, especially hunger and illness. To contribute to the household needs, Mrs. Delphine K. has started a small business selling food products. Currently, she has acquired much experience, which allows her to define and run her business. Thanks to her heightened management sense, she has repaid all the loans she obtained.

She is asking for a loan of $1200 to increase her storage capacity in order to sell products in times of scarcity. This loan will serve as a foundation to buy, stock, and re-sell food products. The realization of this project will be very beneficial to her, especially in terms of savings. She will also succeed in better meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Delphine est une femme mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son mari pratique une agriculture de subsistance qui suffit à peine pour l’alimentation de la famille. Du coup, le ménage est confronté quotidiennement aux difficultés de tout genre notamment la faim et la maladie. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, Madame K. Delphine a entrepris le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers. Aujourd’hui, elle a acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de bien cerner les rouages de son activité. Grâce à son sens élevé de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous les crédits qu’elle avait obtenus.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pénurie. Ce crédit servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. La réalisation de ce projet lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’épargne. Aussi réussira-t-elle à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
“My husband drives a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) and my two boys work at a printing press where they bind books. Due to financial constraints, we were unable to send the boys to school and it seems like my two daughters will also be deprived of this right.

A loan will enable my husband to expand his transport business. With his business doing better, perhaps my children will be able to attend school and my boys could one day read the books they have been binding for so many years.”

Nazia B., Pakistan

loans.use: For the maintenance of a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Hanou

texts.fr:
At 38 years of age, Mrs. Hanou B. comes from the Prefecture of Kloto and lives in Vogan with her husband and four (4) children, where she runs her mat weaving business. Very enterprising, she is in charge of four (4) other people who are her apprentices. She weaves mats manually in the traditional way, which limits the rate of daily production while the demand grows increasingly high. To raise her income by increasing production, she would like to obtain much more modern equipment. With this idea in mind, she is asking for a loan of $800. The realization of this project will allow her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

A 38 ans, Madame B. Hanou est originaire de la Préfecture de Kloto et vit à Vogan avec son mari et ses quatre (4) enfants où elle exerce son activité de tressage de nattes. Très entreprenante, elle a en charge quatre (4) autres personnes qui sont ses apprenties. Elle fabrique les nattes de façon manuelle et traditionnelle, limitant le taux de production journalier alors que la demande est de plus en plus forte. Pour accroître son revenu à travers l’augmentation de la production, elle veut se procurer de matériel beaucoup plus modernes. Dans cet ordre d’idées, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy equipment to weave mats

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
“My husband makes furniture and earns about $82 per month. We have six children and the eldest of them is employed. We were not able to send him to school because of the high cost of living but we would like to give our other children this opportunity. Through this loan we will purchase wood needed for the expansion of our furniture business, which is our family business. We hope that expanding the business will double our monthly income and allow us to send our other children to school.”

Zaib B., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase raw material i.e wood for our furniture business

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Born in 1962, Mrs. Kayi E. lives in Aklakou in the Prefecture des Lacs with her six (6) children and her husband. A shopkeeper by profession, she has at her disposal a marketing channel for mats which should a priori be very profitable for her. However, not having enough liquid assets to buy in cash before re-selling, she does not gain a significant profit from her business. Gifted in the management of her income, she is very confident and is capable of productively using a loan of $700, which she is soliciting in order to stockpile mats for resale. This will allow her to increase her revenue and thereby change her quality of life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1962, Madame E. Kayi réside à Aklakou dans la Préfecture des Lacs avec ses six (6) enfants et son mari. Commerçante de profession, elle exploite un canal de commercialisation de nattes qui devrait a priori lui être très rentable. Cependant n’ayant pas l’argent liquide pour acheter au comptant avant de revendre, elle ne tire pas profit de façon significative de son commerce. Douée dans la gestion de ses revenus, elle est très confiante et se sent capable de pouvoir utiliser à bon escient un crédit de $700 qu’elle sollicite pour faire un stockage de nattes afin de revendre. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et changer ainsi sa qualité de vie.

loans.use: To stockpile woven mats for resale

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
“After my husband’s death, my three sons started working while I stayed at home to look after my three young daughters. My eldest son plays the keyboard with a group of musicians whenever they can get gigs or shows. The shows pay sufficiently well but since he does not have his own keyboard, my son has to part with half his earnings to pay for renting the instruments. With a loan, I could invest in a keyboard for my son and with the increased monthly income, he could help send his sisters to school.”

Uzma R., Pakistan

loans.use: To buy a keyboard for my son

loans.name: Ekoué Claude

texts.fr:
Mr. Ekoué Claude K. was born on 15 June 1969 in Aného. Married and father of four (4) children, he is a carpenter and has his own workshop. His income being insufficient for all the needs of his family, he took the initiative and started a second business in conjunction with carpentry. Kind, courageous, and a hard worker, he decided to marsh farm to increase his income. With the help of his wife, who brings him considerable support, this undertaking is rapidly growing. He has been able to repay his previous loans. Currently, Mr. Ekoué Claude K. hopes to enlarge his marsh farm and make it a significant source of income for his family.

He is thus asking for a loan of $950, which will allow him to buy a motor pump, pipes, and other equipment necessary for marshland agriculture.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Ekoué Claude est né le 15 Juin 1969 à Aného. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il est menuisier et détient son propre atelier. Son revenu étant insuffisant pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative d’entreprendre une activité parallèle à la menuiserie. Brave, courageux et bon travailleur, il décide de faire du maraîchage pour améliorer son revenu. Avec l’aide de sa femme qui lui apporte un soutien considérable dans cette activité qui de plus en plus prend une allure considérable. Il a pu rembourser les crédits antérieurs. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur K. Ekoué Claude souhaite agrandir son maraîchage et en faire une source de revenu importante pour la famille Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit d’un montant de $950 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une motopompe, de tuyaux et d’autres matériels nécessaires aux cultures maraîchères.

loans.use: To buy equipment and pipes for marsh farming

loans.name: Pomi

texts.en:
“My husband is a keyboard player and sound recording specialist. He works with a musical group “Sohney Darti” which plays at various private functions and parties. He earns $3 to $4 per day. I have one daughter who is 3 years old and I look after her. I want to educate her but with our current income it is not possible to pay for her education. My husband wants to buy his own sound system, which can help us increase our income by attracting more business for him.”

Pomi B., Pakistan

loans.use: To buy a sound system and other related musical instruments for my husband for his musical group  “Sohney Darti”

loans.name: Roohi

texts.en:
“In my neighborhood, I am everybody’s seamstress. My own business is not large enough for me to take a loan for myself but I would like to help my children. Both my children are married—my daughter has shifted into her husband’s place while my son lives with us. He helps his father with his business of providing sound services for shows and events. I am seeking $328 to help my son buy his own equipment so that he can expand his business.

Roohi B., Pakistan

loans.use: To buy musical instruments for my son

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
“I have six children, five of whom are still young and under our charge. My husband and I work hard to provide for them but the high cost of living has deprived our children of their right to education. Every 2 months my husband and I go up north to the city of Peshawar, about 7 hours drive from where we live in Lahore. We purchase clothes wholesale in Peshawar, where prices are considerably cheaper than in Lahore.

Upon our return, we deliver the goods to shopkeepers who give us their orders beforehand. Since the commission earned on these orders is not enough to sustain us, we also bring some goods to sell in the neighborhood. We would like to expand our business and thus increase our income so that we may send our children to school; it is never too late to get an education."

Nasreen A., Pakistan

loans.use: To expand our business tp purchase more  goods (blankets, cloth etc) from Peshawar and sell them for profit in our hometown, Lahore.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
“I stay at home to take care of my younger children. My husband and eldest son are tailors and work in a rented shop. Unlike his younger brothers, my eldest son did not get to go to school. However, he is happy to help his father in the shop so that his siblings can continue their education. A year back, they expanded their business when they invested in a couple of new sewing machines. A loan will help significantly in adding to the funds they need to purchase the shop. This will remove the burden of paying the rent every month and will increase our asset base”


Riffat S., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a shop for my husband and son for their tailoring business

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
“Five of my six children are married and the youngest lives with me. I make a living by stitching clothes. My son works as a sound technician at marriages and other events. I would like to help him improve his financial situation so that he can ensure a decent future for himself and his family. A loan will help him invest in a sound system and related equipment (microphone, speakers, amplifier etc.) which he will then be able to rent out for shows in addition to providing his services. This will help him to diversify his business and increase his income”


Rani B., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a sound system and related equipment (microphone, speakers, amplifier etc.) for my son

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
“A couple of years ago I helped my son buy a musical instrument. He plays at different events with a group of musicians. However, the income generated by these jobs is not enough and I would like to help him start a side business. I need a loan to help him buy a sound system (microphone, speakers, amplifier, mixer etc.) so that he can be hired for big shows where he may even offer the services of his band. This will help in diversifying his business and allow him to double his income especially during the wedding season”


Majeedan B., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a sound system and related accessories (microphone, speakers, amplifier, mixer etc.) for my son

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
“I am Zeenat B.. I have three children. I have to stay at home to take care of my children because they are very young. My husband runs a furniture showroom to meet our household expenses. He earns well from his current business but wishes to expand the business to increase his income. I also want to educate my children. Therefore, for the expansion of my husband’s business and for the education of my children, I need a loan of loan which can increase my husband income and with this increased income, enable my children to get an education”

Zeenat B., Pakistan

loans.use: For the expansion of my husband's furniture business

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
“With my husband’s rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle), we are fortunate enough to be able to send our four children to school. My husband bought the rickshaw and now we require a loan for its maintenance. A well-maintained rickshaw will help bring in more business and allow him to operate for long hours. We hope to keep his business going so that our children can continue with their education”


Chanda B., Pakistan

loans.use: For the maintenance of a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
“My husband works two jobs. He has been driving a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) for the past 15 years and brings in about $10 daily. However, this income is insufficient to support our family of six, let alone send our four children to school. My husband is a talented drummer and he often receives offers to play at shows, which pay up to $33 each. We need a loan to buy drums for my husband so that we can improve our financial situation and send our children to school”

Tahira A., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase drums for my husband

loans.name: Polad

texts.en: Polad B. is a 46-year-old married man who lives with his two children in Khoshchobanli village in southern Azerbaijan. Polad went into business in the year 2000, when he bought his first cow and buffalo. Polad carefully raised both animals, and today the cow produces generous amounts of milk. Now he has decided to expand his business and better provide for his family by buying one grown milk cow, one calf  and enough fodder to feed the calf while it is growing up. Polad estimates that the cost of the cow is $700, the calf $300 and the fodder $200.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for $700, one calf for $300 and fodder for $200

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
“I am Zarina B. and live in Lahore. I have a daughter and a son, both of whom are married. I live with my husband. My husband worked as a gardener while I take care of the chores at home. I would like to help my husband expand his business. He used to grow fruits but the salary he brought home from this activity was not enough. Recently, we leased a piece of land but do not have enough money to purchase seed and fertilizer for different seasonal fruits. If you can help us with a loan, we can purchase the necessary materials and hopefully improve our standard of living and provide for ourselves in our old age.” 


Zarina B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for different seasonal fruits for my husband's farm

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
“I am Fakhra B. and live in Lahore. I have two small children so I have to stay at home to take care of them. Once they are of age, I hope to send them to school. My husband is a tailor, working in a small tailoring shop sewing mainly children’s clothes. He has been working in this business for many years. He now wants to start his own tailoring business. Hence, he wishes to buy a sewing machine and cloth. Therefore, we are seeking a loan of $328 to purchase machine and cloth to start his personal business”

Fakhra B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase materials for my husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
“I am Farzana B. and live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have five children, four boys and a girl. I want to educate my children but face severe financial constraints. My husband is a tailor. With our current income, we are unable to manage the high cost of living in Lahore. Now my husband wants to start his own business, he wants to purchase a sophisticated sewing machine. We currently rent the machine, but if we can buy it, it would eventually reduce our cost of doing business. Therefore, I need a loan and I hope that our increased income will enable us to educate our children”

Farzana B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for my husband

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid A. is a 36-year-old married man with two children who runs a small auto repair shop in Imishli town in southern Azerbaijan. He has ten years experience in his business. Demand for services like his has been high since the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1992, because many people still drive Russian cars from that period. Vahid works on more than 5-6 cars a day. The spare parts he has are old and need to be replaced with new ones from Moscow. This will cost about $2,000 but Vahid will pay for part of the purchase with savings. He has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to cover the balance of the cost.

loans.use: To buy new spare parts to use in repairing cars

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram I. is a 33-year-old father with two children who raises farm animals in his home village of Khoshchobanli in southern Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2003, when he came to Aqorinvest for money to buy one baby calf. Since that time, he has repaid his loan and generated enough income from the cow to buy another calf. Now Bayram would like to further expand his business by purchasing two baby calves for $200 each and one adult milk cow for $800.

loans.use: Going to purchase two baby calves for 200 USD and one milky cow for 800

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian A. Castillo, married and a mother of two sons, is the group manager of the Golondrinas de Juan Pablo II association. She is dedicated to the sale of all types of products, such as office supplies, parasols and others, but her largest sale transactions occur at the end of the year through sales of toys.

She had her own spot in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto, long before her admission into Pro Mujer, but she did not have as much success as she does today, and her revenues were less.

Lilian needs capital in order to take advantage of the season and to stock up on toys, in order to prepare herself for a busy season at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilian A. Castillo, casada y madre de dos hijos, es jefa de grupo de la asociación Golondrinas de Juan Pablo II, se dedica principalmente al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería, como ser material de escritorio, sombrillas y otros, pero su mayor venta se produce en las fiestas de fin de año donde comercia con juguetes. Posee un puesto propio en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, instalado mucho antes de su ingreso a Pro Mujer, pero que no tenía éxito como ahora, y tampoco le generaba los ingresos que en la actualidad tiene. Lilian necesita de capital para poder aprovechar la temporada y abastecerse de juguetes, con el fin de preparar su puesto de venta para las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Stock up on toys to prepare for a busy season at the end of the year

loans.name: Zenayde

texts.es:
Zenayde C., divorced and mother of two little children, is one of the newest members of Pro Mujer. She is dedicated to the sales of American and domestic footware, in a very modest stand located right outside her home. Recently she got in touch with people from the city of Santa Cruz, who are buying her merchandise, which results in a greater income for her. Zenayde needs money to buy more merchandise, especially in preparation for the end of the year holidays, when demand -and consequently sales profits- go up. She presently lives in a rented room, with her 2 year old son and 8 months old baby.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenayde C., divorciada y madre de dos niños muy pequeños, es una de las socias más nuevas en Pro Mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados americanos y nacionales, en un puesto muy precario instalado en la puerta de su domicilio. Recientemente se contactó con personas que compran sus productos en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, lo que le representa mayor ingreso. Zenayde necesita dinero para poder comprar más mercadería, principalmente para preparase para las fiestas de fin de año, temporada en que la demanda crece y se generan mejores ingresos. Actualmente vive en una pieza, por la cual paga alquiler, en compañía de su hijo de 2 años y su bebé de apenas 8 meses.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise (in preparation for the end of the year holidays sales)

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal A. is a 42-year-old married man with four children. Jalal lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in Otuziki village, where he has sold meat for the last eight years. This product is in high demand in Azerbaijan, where people enjoy meat dishes when eating at home and in cafes, but there is much competition. Jalal has done well in this competitive market because he works very hard and does all he can to expand his business. He has come to us for a loan to buy four more calves at a cost of $200-400 each.

loans.use: To purchase  four calves for $300 each.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía C. de Huaranca, mother of six children, is dedicated, along with her husband, to the craft of blacksmithing; she tries to earn a living for her family by fabricating metal doors, rails and banisters. She has been involved in this activity for more than 15 years and has belonged to Pro Mujer for 3 years. She is in need of money to buy material (iron) to fabricate her products and sell them at a stand installed at their home, located at the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto. Sofía needs the loan to increase her production, as its current level is only enough to bring in food to her home, but not to provide for other basic needs of her six children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía C. de Huaranca, madre de 6 hijos, junto a su esposo se dedica a la metalurgia; mediante la elaboración de puertas, barandas, rejas y otros, trata de llevar el sustento a su hogar. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad, y con una antigüedad en Pro Mujer de 3 años, precisa de dinero para poder comprar material (fierro) para poder elaborar sus productos y venderlos en un puesto que tiene instalado en su domicilio, que queda en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Sofía precisa de capital para poder incrementar sus productos, ya que los trabajos realizados por el momento solo le alcanzan para poder llevar la comida a casa, y no para sustentar otras necesidades básicas de sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: purchase of material (iron) to increase production.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia A. Orihuela, divorced and mother of three children, makes wedding gowns and gala dresses to earn a living for her family. She is the owner of a boutique located in the 16 de Julio area of El Alto, where she exposes and sells her creations, according to the occasion. During the last national holidays, for instance, she made school uniforms, parade costumes and gowns for local schools promotion celebrations. Silvia is presently in need of money to invest in the acquisition of equipment, like an overlock machine that would allow her to start working with lycra fabrics, satisfying thus the demands of her clients and generating a better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia A. Orihuela, divorciada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la confección de vestidos de novia y de gala, para la subsistencia de su familia. Es dueña de una boutique en la zona 16 de Julio de El Alto, en la que vende y expone sus trabajos, los que vende según la temporada. Por ejemplo, en estas últimas fiestas patrias, realizó la confección de uniformes escolares, trajes de desfile y trajes para promociones de colegios de la zona. Actualmente Silvia precisa de dinero para poder invertir en la compra de maquinaria para confección, como por ejemplo una máquina Overlock, para poder comenzar el trabajo en telas licradas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, con el objetivo de generar mejores ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: purchase of production equipment (such as an overlock machine)

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina P. de Ortuño, married and mother of ten children, used to sell baby and bedding products. For this activity, Ms. Paulina needed to travel often to the city of Santa Cruz, where the majority of her clients were located. Sadly, right before the departure at 4 am for one of her many trips, in the Ceja de El Alto, she was the victim of a robbery: she and her niece were taken by surprise and beaten up and their merchandise was stolen. Her youngest daughter suffered serious injuries and Ms. Paulina was hospitalized. Since that episode, Ms. Paulina can't travel or exert herself, which has forced her to switch activities and she is now dedicated to the sales of soft drinks and sandwiches. For that reason, she needs money to set up a restaurant, in order to serve lunches and generate her own income without risking her life.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina P. de Ortuño, es madre de 10 hijos, casada, y su principal actividad era el comercio de artículos de bebés y ropa de cama. Para esta actividad, la señora Paulina debía realizar constantes viajes a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, donde tenía la mayor cantidad de clientes que compraban su mercadería. Lastimosamente en uno de sus tantos viajes, antes de embarcarse a las 4 de la mañana, en la Ceja de El Alto, fue víctima de un asalto: ella y su sobrina fueron sorprendidas, golpeadas y despojadas de su mercadería, quedando la hija menor con serias heridas, y la señora Paulina internada en el hospital. Desde ese entonces la señora Paulina ya no puede viajar ni hacer esfuerzos grandes, lo que le obligó a cambiar de rubro y dedicarse a la venta de refrescos y sándwiches. Por tal motivo, ella precisa de dinero para poder establecer un restaurante para la atención de almuerzos, y generar sus propios ingresos sin la necesidad de arriesgar su vida.

loans.use: setting up a restaurant

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim B. is a 44-year-old married farmer who has two milk cows. He started his business in 2001, when he borrowed money from friends to buy his first cow and began selling sell milk and yogurt to people in his community. This is a good business to be in in Azerbijahn, where dairy products are in high demand because people use them as beverages and in cooking.  In less than a year, Rasim repaid his debts and purchased one more cow. His two cows now provide him with a good income, and he has come to us to further expand his business by purchasing another cow and two calves. The estimated cost of the cow is $700-1000, and of the calves $200-400.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow for about $700 and two calves for about $250 each

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Mr. G. is a young worker who, with great effort, has set up a business that produces bricks and blocks, frequently used for construction in Nicaragua. He is married and the father of two school-age children. He is requesting the loan to invest in the maintenance and repair of the machinery that allows him to produce high quality bricks and blocks. He bought the machines second hand and they now have more than a decade of use. For that reason, they break down often during production and he needs to repair them in order to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. G. es un joven trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha formado una empresa en la cual se fabrican ladrillos y bloques que son muy usados en las construcciones en Nicaragua. Es casado y padre de dos niños en edad escolar. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en el mantenimiento y reparación de la maquinaria que le permite elaborar bloques y ladrillos de buena calidad. El compró dichas máquinas de segunda mano y tienen más de una década de uso, por lo cual le están fallando a la hora de la producción y necesita repararlas para incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of machinery.

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Gomez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Odilio

texts.es:
Mr. Odilio is married and the father of a 4-year-old boy who is about to start school. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of sand, cement, crushed rock, colouring and other materials for the production of blocks, decorative bricks, cobbles and other construction supplies he offers at his business. He hopes the loan will allow him to increase sales and improve the financial situation of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Odilio es casado y padre de un niño de 4 años que está a punto de entrar a la escuela. El está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de arena, cemento, piedrín, colorantes y otros materiales que le permiten elaborar bloques, ladrillos decorativos, adoquines y otros materiales de construcción que ofrece en su negocio. Espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus ventas y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for the production of construction supplies.

payments.comment: During last week's audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Gonzalez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and hope you continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
“I am Bushra B. and live in Lahore. I have two boys and two girls, who are all married. I live with my husband and in order to supplement our income, I decided to work. I go to Peshawar every month, about 7 hours drive from my hometown, and purchase clothes and electric items at cheaper prices to sell them in my neighborhood or to shops back in Lahore.

I want to expand my business because our current income is not sufficient to meet our cost of living. I feel that my business has good expansion potential but requires some working capital. If you can lend it to me, I would be able to increase my household income and save some money for comfort in my old age” Bushra B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and electric items in bulk to sell them at profit in my hometown

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is originally from a place called Sabinas, in the state of Nuevo Leon. He is married and has 9 children, but the only one still dependent on Armando financially is the youngest one who is still in school. For many years now, Armando has sold ice cream, fruit, and a type of corn snack known as "elotes", from his bicycle cart. He started this business after he lost his job. His children were young still and he needed to earn money to take care of them. His previous boss had taught him how to make ice cream, and loaned him his first bicycle cart so he would be able to sell his ice cream in the street.

Armando has been growing his business thanks to the experience he has gained. He is asking for a loan of $275 which he will use to buy more merchandise to sell, and continue to increase his sales and grow his business further. Now is the time to help those most in need, so please help Armando if you can. Thank you very much.

Armando es originario de la localidad de Sabinas en Nuevo León, está casado y tiene nueve hijos, sólo el más pequeño, que estudia la primaria, depende económicamente de él. Desde hace ya muchos años Armando se dedica a la venta de helados, frutas y elotes en un triciclo, inició este negocio después de que lo perdió su empleo, sus hijos estaban pequeños y necesitaba obtener los recursos para su manutención, su anterior jefe le enseñó a elaborar helado y para poder vender en la calle le prestó su primer triciclo.

Ahora Armando ha estado creciendo con su negocio gracias a la amplia experiencia que ha obtenido, y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas y continuar creciendo con su negocio. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Armando, muchas gracias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old has a photo shop in Kirkuk. He is appling to get $1000 to purchase a new photo processing machine. He has a big family and he is the only one responsible for supporting them. He wants to develop his shop and increas his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: purchase new photo machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old has a photo shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new photo machine. He lives with his mother and father, both of them are not working. Also he wants to get married in the next couple of months and he wants to establish his own household. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income and enhance his life.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new photo machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is a 29-year-old single mother who does sewing work in her home to earn money for her family. She has two children and her husband died two years ago, since which time she has worked to support her family. She is applying to get $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine to do more work and earn more money.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 25 years old and does sewing work in her home. She works to help her father cover house and family expenses. She is applying to get $1100 to purchase a new sewing machine and other goods for her business. She wants to increase her income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old has a mini-market in Kirkuk. He is applying to get $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop. He has two children, both of them in school. He wants to increase his income and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Zergelan

texts.en: Zergelan A. is 49-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in Otuziki village in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imihsli town. Zergelan has 6 years of experience in animal breeding; she has two calves and one buffalo. She buys baby calves, feeds them and raises them for meat.  Meat is in very high demand and people use it for their meals almost every day. Zergelan now wants to expand her business and would like to start selling milk and yogurt. She is therefore requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase one milky cow for 800 USD, a calf for 250 USD and cattle fodder for the autumn season.  The estimated cost for a cow in Azerbaijan is 600-800 USD depending on how many liters of milk it can produce; and a calf is 200-400 USD, depending on how many kilograms it weighs.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for 800 USD, one calf for 250 USD and fodder for the remaining 150 USD

loans.name: Agakerim

texts.en:
Agakerim J. is 63-year-old farmer, who runs his small business consisting of two cows from which he sells milk. Agakerim lives in Saatli region, in Alisoltanli village, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1993, when he purchased his first cow. Together with his wife he started to sell milk and yogurt; this business helped them to improve their life conditions. 

Soon after, when they had saved some money, Agakerim purchased another cow. The milk and yogurt is in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Life in the village is become harder and harder every day, because there is much competition in this field. So he had applied for 1200 USD to purchase an additional cow for milk and two calves for meat production. The estimated cost for a cow in Azerbaijan 600-800 USD and for a calf is 200-400 USD.

loans.use: To purchase two calves each for 250 USD and one cow for 700 USD

loans.name: Ferahim

texts.en:
Ferahim M. is 50-year-old married man who has two grown up children. He lives in Otuziki village in Imishli town, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan.
