Ferahim has been working in his own farm for 12 years. He started his business in 1995 when he purchased two calves, raised them and sold them for meat. Then he started to farm cows for milk and sell products such as milk and yogurt. These products are in high demand and during the day Ferahim sells 3-4 liters of milk and 5 liters of yogurt.  

Ferahim has decided to go back to where he started his business since life in the village is a lot harder and would like to purchase four calves and start selling meat again. In addition he would like to purchase another cow for milk. He is requesting a loan for 1,200 USD. The estimated costs for a calf is 200 USD and for cows are 700-800 USD. Ferahim has saved some money which he will also use to make this purchase.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves each for 200 USD for meat productiona and one cow for 800 USD

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en: Ibadet A. is a young 22-year-old businessman who lives in Yalavach village, in Imishli town, in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He started his toy business in 2005 and since then his income has considerably increased. He is planning on expanding his business and has ordered a consignment of toys from Moscow (Russia); these include mechanical and educational toys. He has saved some money but is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to make the payment for the first consignment. His entire consignment costs no more than $4,000.

loans.use: Going to purchase new goods for his toy shop

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra N. is 51-year-old married woman who has two grown up children. She lives in Khoshchobanli village in Imihsli town, in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Zohra has been running her farm since 2003, when she first purchased a cow. Zohra works very hard; she wakes up at 6 a.m. every day to milk a cow because her first clients come to buy some milk at 7 a.m. 
She also spends a lot of taking care of her cattle. From the first cow, Zohra sold milk and it brought her good income.  

Soon after Zohra purchased another cow and a calf.  Zohra has now decided to expand her business and purchase two calves for meat production and one cow for milk. Dairy products and meat are in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Also, autumn is wedding season in Azerbaijan and dairy and meat products are in very high demand during this time.  Zohra is requesting a loan for 1200 USD; the estimated rate for a cow is 700 USD and for a calf is 200-400 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for 700 USD and two calves each for 250 USD

loans.name: Adigozel

texts.en: Adigozel Z. is a 44-year-old married farmer who lives with his wife and three children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in Otuziki village, Imishli town. Adigozel has a farm and has seven years of experience in the farming business. He farms calves for meat production and cows for milk and yogurt. The calves that he currently owns will be used for meat production since autumn is the season for weddings in Imishli and meat is in high demand. Adigozel needs $1200 USD to expand his farm before autumn comes and to sell as much as he can during the wedding season to save some money for winter. The estimated cost for a cow in Azerbaijan is $600-800 USD, and a calf is estimated at $200-400 USD.  He is requesting a loan to purchase one cow and two calves.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow for 700 USD and two calves for 250 USD

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: T. Rafiq is a 54-year-old successful farmer who sells meat to the local people.  Rafiq is married and has five children. He was dislocated from the Jabrail region and fled to the Saatli region during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in 1993.  He has thirteen years of experience in this field and sells calves for meat production. He has a very hard day since taking care of animals is not easy.  He sells milk, yogurt and meat to the local people.  Beginning Autumn is wedding season and he would like to purchase four calves each for 250 USD because the meat is in high demand all across Azerbaijan. With the remaining 200 USD he will purchase cattle fodder to feed calves.

loans.use: To purchase four calves each for 250 USD and cattle fodder for 200 USD

loans.name: Khasay

texts.en: Khasay S. is a 42-year-old farmer who lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in Bilasuvar region.  Khasay was internally displaced person from the Jabrail region during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. Khasay started his business in 1998, when he was first loaned monies from Aqroinvest and purchased one calf which brought him good income.  He has repaid previous loans in time and in full. His cow is old and does not give enough milk now. With the loan he plans to purchase a new cow and two calves. The estimated cost for the cow is 700-800 USD and for the calves is 200-400 USD and he is therefore requesting a loan of 1,200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for 700 USD and two calves each for 250 USD

loans.name: Teyyar

texts.en: Teyyar Q. is a 51-year-old married man who has two grown up children. Teyyar runs a petrol station in a southern Azerbaijani town, Imishli. He opened his petrol station in 1998. Teyyar works from wee hours in the morning until late at night, because he has a lot of clients (more than 60 people an hour). Teyyar does not want to lose his clientele to delays and therefore would like to purchase an additional petrol station.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase another petrol station

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshem N. is 42-year-old man who lives with his two children in the southern part of Azerbaijan Imshli region. He has been running his business since 2003. He has one cow, which brings him income from milk and yogurt. The milk products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan and Rovshem is planning on expanding his business and purchase two additional cows. The estimated cost for one cow is 700-800 USD. Therefore, he is applying for a loan of 1200 USD and has saved 200 USD from his income to pay for these.

loans.use: To purchase two cows in order to  expand his business

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
"I would like to invest in my business for there are many items I do not have and this has caused sales to go down significantly. My customers are requesting many things I do not have. I request US$1,000.00 to invest in my business".

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

“Me gustaría invertir en mi negocio ya que hay muchas cosas que me faltan y debido a eso mis ventas han bajado mucho, mis clientes me piden muchas cosas que no tengo. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. is 41 years old and a mother of 2 school-aged children and lives in Phnom Pehn, Cambodia. She works for a private company, while her husband (pictured here) works selling ice and driving a motor-taxi. Together, this couple can earn approximately $12/day. This loan will be use to invest in her business by adding ice to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To invest in her business by adding ice to make more profits.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mr. Lim R. is 62 years old and the father of three school-aged children. He and his wife work selling a variety of grocery products to the people in their community, where they can earn on average about $8/day in revenue. This couple hopes to use this loan to increase their inventory by adding some kinds of products to meet their clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun S. is a married 38-year-old with four children, who works selling rice and food to the people in her area, where she can earn $5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works in construction, and his wage is a potential help for the household. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory and the rest attend school. This loan will be used to purchase more equipment and utensils for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more equipments and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min P. is 35 years old and the mother of two school-aged children. To make her standard of living, she runs a store selling Vietnamese noodles and porridge to the people in her community, while her husband works as a carpenter. Together, this couple can typically earn up to $14 each day. This loan will be used to purchase food supplies to invest in her store and the remainder of the loan is to buy wood for her husband’s carpentry.

loans.use: Mrs. Phouen would like to buy food supplies for her store and wood for her husband’s carpentry business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. is a married 32-year-old with one school-aged child and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She opened a shop at home selling pork and chicken-rice and soft drinks to the people in her area. With this business activity, she generally makes around $5 in revenue, while her husband earns about $4/day from weaving handbags and selling them to the wholesalers. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more equipment and utensils.

loans.use: Mrs. Sokheng would like to purchase more equipment and utensils.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Mrs. Duch P. is 47 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband and three of their six children. Of these three children, one is a student and two help with their father's work. The remaining three are married and live elsewhere with their spouses. Duch P. earns $1 a day herself as a farmer. Her husband earns additional income for the family through his work as a carpenter. Duch P. will use this $500 loan to increase her family’s joint income by investing in some tools for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.use: Mrs. Phally would like to purchase carpentry tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru:
Abror has a small phone center in the village Kuchkak, in the Kanibadam region. His center provides services for the main providers of mobile phone communications in Tajikistan as well as a place for people to settle their accounts. He also provides long-distant phone service. For a reasonable price, villagers can call their relatives in any part of the world.

Abror is 33 years old, he is married and has three children. The idea about opening a service center came to Abror because of the growing numbers of cellular telephone providers that increased the demand for services. To expand his business would mean financial investment and Abror applied and received his first loan from “MicroInvest”. He purchased phone cards for express phone payment and SIM cards for mobile phones. Currently Abror is planning to receive another loan for further expansion of his business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Аброр имеет маленький дилерский пункт в кишлаке Кучкак Канибадамского района. У него в центре можно подключиться к услугам основных операторов сотовой связи Таджикистана и пополнить счет. Также он предоставляет услуги телефонных переговоров. Жители кишлака могут обратиться сюда и за приемлемую плату поговорить со своими родственниками по всему миру.

Аброру 33 года, он женат и имеет 3 детей. Раньше Аброр занимался торговлей. Постепенно он пришел к мысли открытия дилерского центра, так как развитие операторов сотовой связи по Таджикистану предполагало спрос на такие услуги. Развитие бизнеса предполагает вложения больших денег и Аброр получил в Микроинвест займ на расширение бизнеса. Тогда он приобрел карточки экспресс оплаты и сим-карты. Сейчас он планирует получить новый займ на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mr. Cheng S. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. He currently earns $3 a day buying cardboard boxes from his community and selling them back to wholesalers and recycling plants. He would like this loan so that he can increaS. the amount of cardboard boxes he buys from his community and therefore increaS. his earnings.

loans.use: Mr. Se would like to buy more cardboard boxes from his community to resell to recycling plants.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Cheng Se has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you make it possible for entrepreneurs around the world to access loans to invest into their small businesses and families. 

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim C. is a 47 year old widow who lives with two of her three children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Her third child is married and lives with her husband whilst the other two are garment workers. Sim C. intends to use this loan to repair her house so that she and her children can live more comfortably now, rather than waiting a year until she has saved enough money. These repairs to her house should improve the health and quality of life of her and her children.

loans.use: Mrs. Chanthorn would like to repair her house.

loans.name: Khuy

texts.en: Mrs. Khuy K. is 40 years old and lives with her husband who is 47 in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Khuy K. currently earns $2.40 a day as a street vendor, whilst her husband earns $4 a day as a carpenter. Khuy K. has applied for this loan to improve her husband's business in two main ways. First, she would like to purchase a motorcycle so that he can keep up with current consumer demand more easily and also expand the area that he is able to work in. A motorcycle would also cut the family's expenditure on moto-taxis. She would also like to purchase more wood for the business so that he can expand and meet growing demand from his clients. An improvement in his business would mean additional income for the whole family.

loans.use: Mrs. Khim would like to purchase wood and a motorcycle for her husband's job.

loans.name: Yous

texts.en: Mr. Yous H. is 44 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with his wife and three children (all of whom are students). Yous H. owns a grinding mill. Between them, the couple also own a horse and cart which earns them $3.60 a day. They would now like to expand this business by purchasing a second horse and cart so that Mr. H. can also drive one and increase the family's earnings.

loans.use: Mr. Hauo would like to purchase a hourse and cart for his family's business.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina R. R. is 36 and has seven children between the ages of 6 and 18. She's taking out her third loan with Friendship Bridge after two previous successful repayments. This time she will invest in a calf to raise for milk production and in a number of chicks. Last time around she invested in four sheep and now has a flock of nine. Her plan is to buy another calf with the proceeds from the sale of the sheep and thus make another step forward for the family. Catarina also has a little tiny store that serves her rural neighborhood.

Catarina is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a calf to raise for milk production and chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa L. B. is 29 and has five kids. She raises pigs and will use this loan to purchase a cow to raise for milk production and to finance feed and care for the pigs. This is her first loan with Friendship Bridge, and like most of the women doing their first credit, it's a bit scary. It's stressful to think of those loan payments, but she decided to go ahead with the loan anyway. Her dream is to buy a few more calves and raise them. The remote village where she lives has lots and lots of pastureland, and the people make good use of it, raising lots of sheep, goats, and cattle. Teresa's picture doesn't show her animals because she pastures them more than an hour's walk away, and it was not practical to visit them.

Like many people in her area, money has been hard to come by. There have been times when there just wasn't enough and Teresa has had to borrow from her neighbors. She has successfully paid them back, though.

Teresa is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a calf and care for pigs

loans.name: Teresa Justina

texts.en:
Teresa Justina L. B. is just 17 years old and already is taking out her third loan with Friendship Bridge. Her businesses include traditional weaving of the beautiful Mayan women's tops called huipiles and also raising chickens. Teresa is married and has one child, and she and her husband will work together to repay this loan, which will be used to buy a horse.

Teresa and her husband dream of continuing to build their businesses and eventually building a newer and better house. Since she's started with Friendship Bridge the family was able to buy a motorcycle, which significantly increases transportation options in this village where a bus passes by only once per day in each direction.

Teresa is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a horse

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa C. V. is 20 years old and is married with two young children. She and her husband raise sheep to sell. With this loan she will buy 5 to 10 more sheep depending on the cost. They will be grazed in the highlands around her home where the rainy season turns the entire area into wonderful pastureland.

This is Teresa's first credit cycle with Friendship Bridge, and it's a little scary thinking about having to come up with the payments. She joined the program with the hopes to build toward having enough to provide for her family: to buy enough food, a house which does not leak in the rain, and to send her children to school when the time comes. At this time her health and her family's health are good and they have no problems. Her hope is that the lambs will grow and not get sick and she'll be successful with the loan.

Teresa is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase and raise 5 lambs

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina V. C. is 48 years old, single, and has 6 children ranging from 8 to 18. She raises lambs to sell. She has bought a little bit of land to graze the sheep and to build a little shelter for them. She'll use this loan to buy another lamb to raise for later sale. This is her first loan with Friendship Bridge (and the first formal loan of any kind ever) and is thus a big step. Her dream is that her herd will grow and help support her family.

Catarina is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in Ixil.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a lamb to raise

loans.name: Heng Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Heng Kim L., 31, is married with four children, who are all students. All six of them live together in the Kandal Province of Cambodia. Heng Kim L. earns about $2 a day making and selling Khmer traditional cake. Her husband is a talented mechanic who repairs and re-sprays used motorbikes before selling them at a profit. He currently makes $8 a day from this activity, but he would like to increase this by expanding his business. Mrs. Heng Kim L. is applying for this loan in order to purchase more motorbikes for her husband to improve and sell. An increase in the businesses profits would translate into an increase in the family's earnings.

loans.use: Mrs. Leang would like to buy old motorcycles for her husband to repair, re-spray and sell.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina S. V. is 25, married, with three children. She'll buy a horse and a lamb to raise to sell. The people in this remote area of northern Guatemala take advantage of the rich green slopes to pasture many animals, but mostly sheep. Herds of sheep and the occasional goat pass by far more often than vehicles do. She wants to use this opportunity to work together with her husband to help support the family.

Catarina is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a horse and a lamb

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. C., 45, is expanding her business into livestock. She lives in a remote area of the northern mountains of Guatemala. With this loan she will buy sheep to raise and sell when fully grown and also a horse. Until now she has been weaving traditional Mayan women’s clothing. This is her third loan with Friendship Bridge and she is excited to be able to expand her business into new areas.

Elena is married and has seven children ranging in age from 5 to 17 years old. Two of the children are stricken with deafness and can't speak or communicate except with improvised hand signals. Her goal is to pay off the loan on time and to be able to grow her business to include cows and more horses.

Elena is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase lambs and a horse

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina L. C. is 25 years old and weaves the traditional Mayan top known as a huipil, and also raises lambs to sell. But with this loan she'll purchase a calf to raise and use for milk production. The rich green hills in her remote village are tremendously fertile and beautiful in this current rainy season, and the women take advantage of all the greenery by pasturing and raising sheep and other livestock.

Catarina has four children, from two to eight years old. She's a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a calf to raise for milk production

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana V. M. is 40 years old and she and her husband have a carpentry business, making furniture for people in a remote village of northern Guatemala where they live. Juana and her husband came to an agreement to use this loan to purchase three horses which will be used to carry and deliver the tables that they make in their business.

The family's dream is to build a better house than the simple adobe one they currently live in.

Juana is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase three horses to help in the carpentry shop

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin M. was married in 1993 and has 3 children. She started a rice farming business after finishing primary school in 1985. She is also raising a few cows at hoM.. Her husband is a government official who is currently working in the commune. By making her living with the rice farming business and raising cows, all of her children can continuing their studies in the local school.

She has had two loans from MAXIMA. She is currently asking for a loan for $800 to repair her house.

loans.use: Repairing the house

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sarin ME has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim C. has been buying and selling baby pigs for more than 30 years. He also raises cows in the village.

He was married in 1982 and has 3 children. His wife sells lotus flowers in the local market. Mr. and Mrs. C. never went to school, but Mr. C. served in the military.

He has borrowed loans from MAXIMA three times. Now he is asking for a loan from MAXIMA of $300 to purchase baby pigs from the villagers to sell in the market. He is able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing and selling baby pigs

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Chim Cheav sucess in his business of selling baby pigs and has enough money to pay back loan early.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sok-Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-lim N. was married in 1979 and has 5 children. She has had a rice farming business since 1981. She also sells soft drinks from her home. She is the sole support for all of her children. Her son has a transportation service in the village. He uses his van to transport villagers who work in the factory.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice. Now she is asking for a loan from of $300 to repair her son's van.

loans.use: Repairing the van

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Mr. Kak L. started his taxi service in 2003. He was married in 2002 and has 2 children. His wife works at the garment factory in Pon-nhea Leu.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now he is requesting a loan of $500 to repair his house.

loans.use: Repairing the house

payments.comment:
Dear lende,

Mr. Kak lath is pay off early for the Kiva loan and he is asking a new loan for creating his new  business.

Thank you so much.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy C. was married in 1986 and has 4 children. He started raising pigs in 2005. His wife is working at the garment factory in Phnom Penh. With the income from his pig raising business, he supports his children so they can attend school.

Mr C. is applying to MAXIMA for the first time. He is requesting a loan of $1,000. He will use this money to buy feed for the pigs and to construct the pig shed to expand his pig raising business. He wants to increase his business so that he can generate more income so his children can stay in school and receive higher educations.

loans.use: Purchasing feed for the pigs and constructing the pig shed to expand the business to generate more income

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda K. started selling flowers and fruit in 2003. She has contracts with local farmers to buy their produce and sell it in the market. With this business, she can support her children so they can go to school. Her husband is serving as a military policeman in the city of Phnom Penh. She was married in 1989 and has 3 children.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more flowers and fruit from the local farmers.

loans.use: Purchasing flowers and fruit from local farmers to sell in the market

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn K. has been growing and selling flowers since 2003. She also raises pigs at home. Her husband assists her in the farming business.

Mrs. K. was married in 1971, and has 8 children. Five of their children are married and live in different houses. Currently, only 3 of their children are living at home.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy more flowers from local farmers to sell in the market and to buy feed for raising pigs at home.

loans.use: Purchasing more flowers from local farmers to sell in the market and buying feed for raising pigs.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Soeurn Kuy has enough money to pay off her loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sophath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophath M. has had a business buying and selling flowers and bananas for more than 20 years. She is widowed with 6 children. Five of her children are married and live in different houses. Mrs. M.'s youngest daughter is single, lives at home, and assists her mother in the business every day.

Mrs. M. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy flowers and bananas from local farmers to sell in the market.

loans.use: Purchasing more flowers and bananas from local farmers to sell in the market.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sophath Mao has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract. Thank you.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
In 2002, Mrs. Vanny E.'s sister taught her how to weave silk. Since then, Mrs E. has been weaving silk. To generate more income, she also sells porridge (rice soup) at home in every morning. Her husband is a construction worker in local communities. She was married in 1991 and has 5 children.

This is Mrs. E.'s first request for a loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $300 to buy the raw silk material and sewing thread, and to pay the fees for selecting and preparing the thread on the loom. She uses her income to support her daughter, who is living at home.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread, and paying fees for selecting and preparing the thread on the loom for weaving.

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
In 2005, Mrs. Srey Aun P.'s sister taught her how to weave silk, and she has been weaving silk since then. She also spends time raising pigs at home. She was married in 2005 and has one son. Her husband is a construction worker and rice farmer.

This is the first time that Mrs. P. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $100 to buy silk material and sewing thread for weaving.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread for weaving.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar N. is 50 years old and has a secondary-level education. He is married and has 6 children. Munawar grew up in a poor family and always loved cars. He participated in a driving course and worked as a driver in an organization where he drove a truck. He has a lot of experience with driving. Nowadays he has his own truck and provides a transferring service. He transfers sand and crushed stone for building purposes. This kind of activity has a big demand among local habitants. The truck needs repair so Munawar needs money to buy a new engine. For the loan amount of $1000, Munawar is going to buy a new engine for his truck and provide his services for local habitants. He is going to pay off the loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his truck

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mrs. Meth H. has been married for more than 20 years and has 9 children -- 8 daughters and one son. Currently, only 3 daughters are married and living in separate houses. Six children are living with her and they are all attending school. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor many years ago, and she has trained her daughters to weave silk as well. She is currently not only producing silk products but also raising 13 pigs in her house.

Her husband is a construction supervisor and is currently making concrete pipes at home for selling, building and repairing houses, drainages, gates and fences in their village and other villages.

Mrs. H. has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is requesting $1,000 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, raise pigs, and purchase construction materials. The construction business will also provide 10 local people with jobs.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread, raising pigs, and purchasing construction materials

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Meth Hun has been pay off her loan early. Now, she ask for new loan to expand her business.

Thank yo so much,

loans.name: Muradjon

texts.en: Muradjon S.  is 50 years old. He has a high level of education. His specialization is teaching. He is married and has 7 children. Muradjon is working as a teacher of English in a local school. He always helped his parents to look after cattle. He has skills breeding stock.  In his farm he has a barn and a small piece of land where he grows corn and trefoil (clover) for cattle. This activity is an additional source of income. For the loan amount of $575, Muradjon is going to buy 2 bull–calves for fatting and selling. This loan helps increase the amount of cattle and gives local community members the opportunity to buy the fatted cattle at a low price. Muradjon is going to pay off the loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy bull-calves for fatting and selling

loans.name: Sea

texts.en: Mrs. Sea M. is 50 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their six children. She and her husband work as farmers, earning just enough to get by. They are supported mostly by their children who work at a local hotel. This loan will be used to repair their house so that it can be strong during the rainy season.

loans.use: Mrs. Mao would like to repair her house to protect her family from the rainy season.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sea Mao start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: Mastura K. is 31 years old. She has a secondary-level education.  She is married and has 4 children.  When she graduated from secondary school, her parents did not allow her to continue her education. So she got married. She was a housewife and looked after her children. For 10 years, her husband has gone to Russia to earn money. Mastura decided to start working and earning money by herself.   She started her business in a market seven years ago. She sells women's dresses, women's handkerchiefs, morning dresses, pajamas, towels, bedcovers and slippers. Her business brought her a good income, and she started to change the range of goods. With the purpose of selling goods fast, she sells them with a low price so goods do not lay long on a counter.  For the loan amount of $575 Mastura is going to buy school uniforms. This loan helps increase the range of school uniforms in the market before school starts and gives the opportunity to local habitants to obtain goods for low prices. Mastura is going to pay off the loan amount over 6 months.

loans.use: To increase the turnover through buying and selling new range of school uniforms

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak A. has sold Khmer noodles in the local market since 2000. Her husband is a farmer and plants rice and vegetables in the village. Her business selling noodles and her husband's farm provide money so that all of her children are continuing their studies in higher education. She was married in 1990 and has 4 children.

Mrs. A. has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is requesting a loA. of $200. She will use this money to buy a battery and electronic scraper for scraping coconuts for her Khmer noodle business.

loans.use: Purchasing a battery and electronic scraper to scrape coconuts for the noodle business.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Vannak An has been pay off her loan early before contract and requesting a new loan for continuing her business.

Thank you very much.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mrs. Mov Y. is 31 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Her husband earns $4 a day working as a construction worker, while Mov Y. herself earns $5 a day selling flowers at a market. Mov Y. intends to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle and cut her long-run costs by reducing her reliance on moto-taxis to take her to the market. In the future she aims to see her business grow.

loans.use: Mrs. Yorn would like to purchase a motorbike to help with her flower business.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Mov Yorn start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem S. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by making Khmer noodles and then selling them to the wholesalers at a market. This business activity enables her to earn around $2.50 each day, while her husband works very hard on a farm growing rice crops and vegetables. Two of her children are employed in a factory and the rest attend school. Mrs. S. hopes to use the loan to repair her house, so that she won't be concerned about the frequent leaking during a rainy season.

loans.use: Mrs. Sean would like to repair her house.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Hem Sean has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S. is 26 years old and married with two children. She earns $5 a day selling traditional Khmer cake. Her husband would like to set up a motor-taxi business to increase the overall income of the household, but does not have the money to cover the start-up costs. Mao S. is therefore going to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for him. They estimate that this will increase their household earnings by $5 a day.

loans.use: Mrs. Saem would like to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Mrs. Pat L., 28, and her husband live in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. They have 5 children, of whom are students and the other sells souvenir products. She earns $5 a day selling soft drinks to the many tourists at the Ta Prum Temple. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory so that she can meet growing customer demand. This is a picture of her husband because Pat L. is unavailble)

loans.use: to increase her inventory

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Pat Ly start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Chhourn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhourn H. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap Province, where they work together making and selling traditional musical instruments. They earn $5 a day from this activity. Of their 4 children, 2 sell souvenir products to the tourists, and 2 are students. They are applying for this loan so that they can build a fence around their house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Kreal

texts.en: Mr. Kreal N. is 48 years old and works as a carpenter earning $8 a day. His wife (pictured here) works at a hotel earning $1.50 a day, along with his only son. He has applied for this loan so that he can finance the repairing of his house, which is better done immediately rather than waiting until he can save up enough money.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeum S. is 48 years old and has 4 children. One is a constuction worker (pictured), earning $4 a day, another is a student, whilst the other two live with their husbands elsewhere in the country. She has applied for this loan so that the family can repair their house. Chhoeum would like to do this as quickly as possible rather than wait a year for the family to save enough money.

loans.use: To repair their house

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chhoeum Sin start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Py

texts.en: Py K. is a 21 year old widow who works at a hotel, with a daily income of $2. She has 3 children, all of whom are students. She would like to take out this loan so that she can purchase a motorbike so that she can get to work without having to pay for a moto-taxi. In the long run she believes this will save her money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to go to work

loans.name: Rafoatniso

texts.ru:
Rafoatniso K. is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. Rafoatniso has a post-secondary education. Her husband has been in Russia for the last couple of years – he went there to make money. Her children are currently going to school. After school, Rafoatniso’s eldest son helps her at the market. Rafoatniso started selling confectionery items such as cookies and candies in 2003. She purchases products from her vendors and then sells them. In 2005 when Rafoatniso became a customer of MLF “MicroInvest” her assets totaled $300. Rafoatniso used her previous loan to improve her stall which increased her sales turnover. Her current assets are $650. In the future Rafoatniso is planning to transport confectionery items herself and to sell them wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кабылшехова Рафоатнисо – 35лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Образование среднее специальное. Муж несколько лет в России уехал на заработки, дети учатся в школе, после школы старший сын помогает матери в торговле. С 2003 года она начала заниматься торговлей, т.е. продавать кондитерские изделия (конфеты, печенье и т.д.). Товар берет у поставщиков. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда ее активы составляли 300$. После получения неоднократного займа и целевого использования она улучшила место деятельности, увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы возросли до 650$. В будущем планирует привозить товар сама и перейти на оптовую продажу, .

loans.use: To sell confectionary items wholesale

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima J. is 56 years old. She is married with six children. Her husband is retired; three of her older children have their own families; and three younger children work. The youngest son is in school and helps with his mother's business after his studies. For the past fifteen years, Halima has been selling plastic bags. She began her business with only $20 when she did not have a permanent business location. Halima sold material bags that she sewed herself and plastic bags while holding them in her hands.

Halima has been a client of MicroInvest since 2002 when she borrowed $50. After receiving this loan, she purchased a permanent selling spot and increased her sales by $600. In the future, she wants to expand her business to wholesale and to acquire a better selling location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Чураева Халима – 56 лет. Замужем, мать шестерых детей. Муж пенсионер, трое старших детей имею свою отдельную семью, трое младших работают. Самый младший учится в школе, после школы помогает матери в торговле. Она занимается реализацией пластиковых пакетов, вот уже 15 лет. Начала свою деятельность с 20$ без определенного место деятельности. Она продавала держа в руках пластиковые пакеты и пакеты которые шила дома сама.

Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2002 году, тогда активы её составляли 50$. После получения займа она приобрела постоянное место деятельности, увеличила товарооборот на 600$. В будущем хочет перейти на оптовую продажу и улучшить место деятельности.

loans.use: To move to wholesale operations and acquire a better business location

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira I. is 39 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation and her children go to school. Mohira has a business grinding and selling meat.

She has been the client of MicroInvest since 2004 when she rented refrigerators. After receving her first $70 loan, Mohira bought meat wholesale, sold it, and began to make profit. Eventually, she was able to purchase her own refrigerator. Currently, her sales increased to $300. In the future, she hopes to increase her sales and purchase a personal meat grinder.

Translated from Russian to English by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Исмоилова Мохира – 39 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в РФ, дети учатся в школе. Вот уже 6 лет она занимается производством и продажей фарша.

Клиентом в МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала 2004году, тогда она брала в аренду холодильник, и её активы составляли 70$. После получения займа и целевого использования, она стала покупать оптом мясо, приобрела холодильник. Сейчас её активы возросли до 300$. В будущем хочет увеличить активы и приобрести мясорубку.

loans.use: Increase her sales and purchase a meat grinder

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo B. is 49 years old. She is married with four children. Her husband works as a security guard and her children hold jobs and have families. Marhabo's business is to make and sell ground meat. Her oldest son helps her by purchasing and preparing meat.

Marhabo has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 when her assets were $125. When she started receiving loans and investing in her business, her assets grew to $340. She purchased a new scale and her own refrigerator in order to store and sell meat. In the future, she plans to add beef and mutton meat to her meat selection.

Translated from Russian to English by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Бобочонова Мархабо –49лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей. Муж работает сторожем, дети работают и каждый имеет свою отдельную семью. Она занимается изготовлением и продажей фарша. Старший сын помогает матери в приобретении мясо для заготовки фарша.

Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда её активы составляли 120$. После получения неоднократного займа и целевого использования её активы постепенно возросли до 340$. Она приобрела новые весы, собственный холодильник хранения и продажи фарша. В будущем планирует добавить в свой ассортимент говяжье мясо и баранину.

loans.use: Increase Meat Assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and blow dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a weighing machine and stock for a general shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 2 cooking mekos (stoves) and bulk stock of flour, cooking oil and baking powder

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel K. is 37 years old, married and has one child. He lives in the town of Athi River in the outskirts of Nairobi. Daniel has been a photographer for five years. His decision to be a photographer was influenced by the remoteness of his community and the uniqueness of the business.

Daniel started taking photos using a small camera and would walk from place to place looking for clients. He would also target major events such as weddings, and it is from these small beginnings that he saved about Ksh 25,000 (USD 400) to open up his own studio in February 2006. With the savings, he was able to pay rent for a small room, and he also bought some of the basic requirements in a studio, including linen for providing background for the photos, picture frames and a bigger camera.

The quality of Daniel’s photos is outstanding and this is attested to by his increasing number of clients. Daniel now seeks to expand his business by purchasing more items to enhance his service, since he is receiving more clients day by day. Daniel has noted that since his operational capital is limited, he is forced to frequently travel to Nairobi to buy additional stock of the various items he needs to use often, as he is only able to buy these in small quantities.

Daniel is therefore requesting a loan of $750, which will be repaid over a 12-month period. This will enable him to purchase some of the items that he uses frequently. Some of the items he intends to buy include bigger picture frames, film, an extra camera and linens. The new additions will enable him to give much better service to his clients, since he will not waste so much time in traveling to the city. This will help to increase his income, firstly because he will be better able to meet the needs of his customers, and secondly, because the bulk purchases will help him by saving on the amount of money he uses to travel to the city to buy additional stock.

loans.use: To purchase picture frames, film, colored linen and a camera

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Herman is a dairy farmer and occasionally works administering medication to cattle in his community. These two activities generate the income to support his wife and four children, ages 9, 6, 3 and 1. He lives in the village of Tahari in Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase an additional dairy cow to increase milk production. He qualifies to receive this, his first loan with IMPRO/Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hernan es productor de leche y eventualmente trabaja como dosificador de ganados por toda su comunidad. Estos son sus ingresos principales con que mantiene a cuatro hijos de 9, 6, 3 y 1 año de edad y esposa. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito que solicita sera invertido en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a dairy and small crop farmer and also works dispensing medications to cattle in the rural areas around La Paz. These activities provide the income necessary to support his wife and two children, who also work the fields with him. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production and in that way increase his family's income. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregorio es pequeño agricultor, productor de leche y trabaja como dosificador de ganados en el área rural de La Paz, de esa forma genera sus ingresos para la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa mismos que ayudan con el trabajo del campo. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Damaso

texts.en:
Damaso and his wife are small milk producers and he also works as a bricklayer's apprentice in the city of La Paz. These two activities provide the main source of income he has to support his wife and small son. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production and in that way increase his family's income. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Dámaso y esposa son pequeños productores de leche, y él trabaja como ayudante de albañil en la Ciudad de La Paz. Estos son sus principales ingresos económicos con lo que mantiene su pequeño hijo y esposa. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is a small milk producer and potato and onion farmer; he also works as a musician, playing at parties in the rural areas of La Paz. These activities produce the income he uses to support himself, his wife and their grandson. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto

He will use this loan to purchase feed for his dairy cows, as his supplies are running low. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilario es productor de leche y pequeño agricultor de papa, cebolla y chuño y eventualmente trabajo como músico de las fiestas populares de las provincias del área rural de La Paz. Asi completa sus ingresos con los que se mantiene él, su esposa y su nieto. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito solicitado es para comprar alimento para las vacas lecheras, porque no cuenta con mucho forraje. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his dairy cows

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a small milk producer and also works as a bricklayer in his province. He lives with his wife. Their three children live in Argentina, where they work in a garment factory, manually sewing clothing items. He lives in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase feed for his dairy cows, as he's running out of supplies. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregorio es productor de leche y eventualmente trabajo de albañil en su provincia; vive con su esposa tiene tres hijos que trabajan en la Republica de Argentina como empleados de costura (en un taller donde elaboran manualmente prendas de viestir). Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito es requerido para comprar alimento para las vacas lecheras, porque no cuenta con mucho forraje. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his cattle

loans.name: Angelino

texts.en:
Angelino and his family are small dairy and subsistence farmers; he also works as a bricklayer to generate enough income to support his wife and four children. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase an additional dairy cow to increase milk production and in that way increase his family's income. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelino y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación y él también trabaja como albañil. Asi completan sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a la familia (4 hijos y esposa). Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano and his family are small dairy and subsistence farmers. On weekends, he travels to La Paz to work as a stevedore in the local markets, supplementing his income so that he'll be able to support his wife and eight children. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase an additional dairy cow to increase milk production and, as a result, increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Feliciano y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación; los fines de semana el va para la ciudad de La Paz a trabajar de cargador (esta profesion de cargador es similar a la de los estibadores en los puertos, donde cargan mercaderias para los clientes que compran productos) en la ferias populares. Asi puede tener un poco mas de ingresos con los que mantiene a la familia (8 hijos y esposa). Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah K. is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a pastor and is blessed with six children. She lives in Mlolongo town, situated along the Nairobi-Mombasa Highway. Peninah started selling secondhand clothes in 1996 in a town known as Rongai in Kajiado District, but then her husband moved to Mlolongo town so she also had to move. She then settled in Mlolongo town where she has been operating her business ever since.

Peninah started her business with an initial capital of Ksh 3,000 (USD 45), which was a loan from her husband. Fortunately, she was able to settle the loan in good time from the high sales she made from her business. Due to the growing population within this town, the demand for her clothes is at the peak during the cold-weather season, when people buy warm clothing.

Being a pastor’s wife, Peninah also cares about the less fortunate members of her Gospel Tabernacle church, and she assists them in paying their rent and also gives them the clothes that are left over after her sales. This act is of great significance to her. Peninah’s clothes are always in demand because they are very reasonably priced; hence even people who earn less than $3 per day can afford to buy from her.

Due to the increased demand, Peninah is requesting a loan of $725. Peninah plans to increase the stock in her stall by purchasing 6 bales of secondhand clothes. Peninah also intends to employ two more people to assist her in the business.

loans.use: To purchase 6 bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei has a small shoe sales business located at the Central market in Novaya Kohovka, Ukraine. In business for two years, he has built up about $2500 worth of inventory on hand and makes about $700 per month. Sergei is married. He and his wife have one daughter who is two years old. Sergei likes what he does for a living and hopes to continue supporting his family.

One of the challenges of Sergei’s business is his high rate of inventory turnover. He has requested a loan of $1100 to give him some extra working capital to use to purchase more shoes for his business. Additional inventory and a variety of selection will help keep Sergei’s sales brisk and his business successful.

loans.use: Purchase shoe inventory

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 27-year-old married lady with two children. She lives in Mlolongo, a small town located along the Mombasa-Nairobi highway.

Janet was previously employed at Sana Industries in Nairobi’s industrial area. While still under employment, she did a part-time business making shower caps and petticoats at home, and selling these to her fellow employees. During this time, Janet was saving money, and so in 1999 she left her employment and rented a stall in Mlolongo town to start her own business. She chose Mlolongo town because her brothers lived there, and she had also conducted her own research and found that there were few tailors, yet the population was still growing. For this reason, she also decided to settle there, a decision she has not regretted to date.

Janet’s initial capital was Ksh 20,000 (USD 300), which she had saved from her previous employment, which she used to buy a sewing machine and an assortment of fabrics. Together with her husband, who is also a tailor, Janet continues to make clothes for her ever-increasing number of customers. Janet needs to expand her tailoring business and is therefore requesting a loan of $750. Janet will use this loan to have an increased stock of cloth materials, and this will enable her to employ another assistant and hence create employment opportunity for one person in her community. She also believes that this loan will greatly increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of tailoring materials including cloth, lining, canvas, buttons and sewing thread

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is a dedicated entrepreneur who is sometimes accused of being a workaholic. He is pictured here outside our loan office in Nicopol. Two years ago he started a small business selling groceries. He picked a good location for his business, one that was convenient and filled a market niche, and he has poured his energy into making it successful. Vitaliy is a kind, attentive man who tries to take care of his customers.

Vitaliy has requested a loan to help open a new selling location and purchase more grocery items to sell. He’d like to continue expanding his business so that he can increase his income. He'd also like to hire other local people, providing a means of income for them as well. Another immediate goal he has is to earn enough income to purchase a self-contained heating unit for his home.

loans.use: Help open new sales location and purchase inventory

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio lives with his wife, as their children have emigrated to the city of La Paz seeking work. He and his wife are dairy farmers and also grow the grain they feed their milk cows. Part of his milk production is processed at PIL Andina (Milk Producing Plant) and the balance is processed as yogurt, as their community has its own dairy. They live in the Arasaya area of Achacachi, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will allow him to increase milk production. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eulogio vive junto a su esposa Isabel, pues sus hijos emigraron a la ciudad de La Paz a trabajar. Eulogio y su esposa se dedican a la producción de leche de vaca y al cultivo de forraje que les sirve como alimento a su ganado. Su producción la comercializa en parte a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) y la otra a la elaboración de yogurt, pues la comunidad cuenta con una procesadora leche. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi – sector Arasaya (A dos hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito sera invertido en la compra de una vaca productora de leche, de raza mejorada, para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita and her family are small dairy farmers and also grow the grain they feed their milk cows. Part of their milk production is processed at PIL Andina (Milk Producing Plant) and the balance is processed as yogurt, as their community has its own dairy. She has two sons, age 21 and 19, who help with the family business; her husband abandoned her several years ago. They live in the Arasaya area of Achacachi, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will allow her to increase milk production. This is her first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita vive junto a su familia y se dedican a la producción de leche de vaca y al cultivo de forraje que les da como alimento a las mismas vacas. Su producción de leche es comercializada en parte a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) y la otra a elaboración de yogurt, ya que la comunidad cuenta con una procesadora leche. Su familia consta de dos hijos uno de 21 y 19 años, los cuales le colaboran en el desarrollo de sus actividades, ya que su esposo la abandono hace varios años atrás. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi – sector Arasaya (A dos hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca productora, para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives alone in a house next door to her daughter's family home. She is a small dairy farmer and also grows the grain she feeds her milk cows. Part of her milk production is processed at PIL Andina (Milk Producing Plant) and the balance is processed as yogurt, as her community has its own dairy. She lives in the Arasaya area of Achacachi, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will allow her to increase milk production. This is her first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa vive sola, su propiedad colinda con la de su hija quien vive con su esposo e hijos. Rosa se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y al cultivo de forraje que le sirve como alimento a las mismas vacas. Su producción loacomercializa en parte a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) y la otra parte a elaboración de yogurt, pues la comunidad cuenta con una procesadora leche. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi – sector Arasaya (A dos hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca productora, de raza mejorada, para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina lives in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto and has three small children, ages 3 months, 2 and 9. She sells chuno (potato starch) and tunta (dried, dehydrated potato), which she buys from rural areas. Her husband works as a tailor in a small garment factory in La Paz.

She will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise for her business and in that way, increase her family's income.

This is her 2nd loan with IMPRO. She used the 1st loan to install running water in her home, which greatly improved her family's health and living conditions. That loan was repaid in its entirety.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina vive en la calle de Urus de la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de el Alto. Tiene tres hijos pequeños de 9, 2 años y uno de 3 meses, se dedica a la comercialización de chuño, tunta (patatas deshidratadas, que no se descomponen con el paso del tiempo, en ambiente seco) los cuales adquiere en el área rural del departamento. Su esposo trabaja como costurero en una pequeña fabrica de chamarras ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, El primero lo invirtió en la conexión de agua potable al interior de su domicilio y así pudo mejorar la salud de su familia. Actualmente este credito esta completamente pagado.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca Mwikali M. is a 41-year-old single woman with three children. She also takes care of her aged mother. She lives in Mlolongo town. Francisca entered this male dominated business after closing her salon business due to a directive from the Government of Kenya in 2005 to demolish buildings that had been built along the Nairobi Mombasa Highway. These demolitions greatly affected the many businesses that had flourished along the road. This directive also personally affected her very much, since she had invested a lot of money into her salon business, but she did not give up. Armed with Ksh 50,000 (USD 755), which she had as savings, Francisca decided to move into another business, and she started buying cement, timber and iron sheets. With part of her savings, she also was able to rent a yard where she is operating to date.

Francisca also has several plots of land that she had purchased earlier, but she had not yet developed them. As her business picked up, she decided to begin constructing residential rooms for rent on these plots. However, one thing that has been hindering her efforts is the lack of enough construction materials to enable her to complete her construction project. On the other hand, due to the increasing population in this growing town, the demand for rental houses continues to go up, and people like Francisca are finding it hard to meet the demand. For this reason, Francisca is kindly asking for loan of $850 so as to purchase construction materials like cement, iron sheets and building blocks, to enable her to complete the houses that she has started constructing.

With this kind of assistance, Francisca will be happy that she will have helped someone get a place to call home. She intends to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials including cement, iron sheets and building blocks

loans.name: Ann Muthoni

texts.en:
Anne Muthoni is a 38-year-old married woman and she is blessed with two children. She lives in Ruai town in the outskirts of Nairobi city. Anne started her business in the year 2005 after staying at home for a long time as a housewife. She detested this condition and she candidly explained how she would depend on her husband for entirely everything, including money to buy sanitary towels, which she hated.

One day in the year 2005 Anne borrowed Ksh 5000 (USD 75) from her husband to enable her to start selling cereals. Her husband was more than willing to give her the money, which she used to rent a stall in Ruai town. From the remainder, she bought stock of a variety of cereals, including beans, maize, green grams and rice. From here she started off her business, and it has been in operation ever since. Her business has continued to grow and has enabled Anne Muthoni to take her children to better schools. The income has enabled her to give her family a decent life. Her business also helped to restore her dignity, and she is therefore happy with herself.

Anne now intends to expand her business and is therefore making a request for a loan of $750. With the loan, Anne will purchase a weighing machine, sieving wire mesh, and a variety of cereals to stock her business. Some of the cereals she intends to purchase include a variety beans, maize, rice, flour, green peas, green grams and chicken feed. For Anne, this will translate into higher income, and she will be able to support her family, and particularly to meet her personal needs. She also hopes that soon she will employ a helper and in so doing, will create employment opportunity for at least one person in her community.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cereals including beans, maize, green grams and chicken feed

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario lives in her own home in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. She has two grown children and has been separated from her husband for more than 12 years. She's an artisan and makes flower arrangements using dried and artificial flowers. She sells her crafts in markets both in her city and in other locales like Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, etc. She needs this loan to purchase materials and supplies such as bamboo, which she uses in her flower arrangements.

Based on her credit history with IMPRO, Rosario qualifies for this loan. She has been an IMPRO client for over 3 years and has repaid all previous loans in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario vive en casa propia en la calle Chaco de la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, esta separada del esposo hace mas de 12 años, es artesana y elabora macetas de plástico con flores artificiales y flores secas ( que traducidas al ingles serian flower arrangements including the bases). La venta de su producto es realizada en cada feria ya sea dentro de la ciudad o viajando a los Departamentos de Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar bambú, que es parte de los arreglos florales. Por su antecedente historico , puede acceder a un nuevo credito. Rosario es cliente antigua de IMPRO desde hace mas de tres años y siempre ha cancelado sus prestamos dentro de los periodos de pago establecidos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Senora Julia lives with her husband and children in their own house on Francisco Suarez Street, in the city of La Paz. She was given a loan previously to help with her business selling clothing. Unfortunately, that business was not very good because she bought the merchandise on credit, and her clients didn't always pay on time and she had to work very hard to recover the money. For that reason, Julia decided to open a kind of pension with her son. Their pension is a restaurant which serves a regular lunch and dinner, and the customers pay once a month for their daily meals. This business is going very well. She is requesting this loan to buy more supplies of rice, flour, noodles, etc, in greater quantity, as well as a refrigerator to keep the perishable items fresh.

Julia has been a client of Impro, since 2005, and her previous history shows that she will comply with the terms of the new loan without any problem.

La señora Julia vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia en la calle francisco Suárez de la zona de bajo Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Anteriormente se le dio un crédito para aumento de capital ya que la señora vendía ropa; en este negocio no le fue muy bien porque daba la mercadería a crédito y los clientes no le pagaban puntualmente y tenia que pasar mucho trabajo para recuperar el total del dinero. Por esta razón Julia decidió abrir una pensión (es decir un restaurant donde sirve almuerzo y cena, y los clientes pagan una vez al mes por su almuerzo y cena diarios) con su hijo; el negocio esta funcionando bien, sin problemas. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos como ser arroz, fideo, sémola, etc, en cantidad y también para comprar una conservadora (refrigerador) para los productos perecederos, como la carne, se mantengan frescos y en buen estado. Es cliente antigua de Impro desde el año 2005 y su antecedente historico indica que ella puede acceder a un nuevo crédito sin problema alguno.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Money to invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rufina lives in a rental in the Puertas street in the area of Villa Nuevo Potosi in the city of La Paz. She is 68 year old, and uses one room as her grocery store and the other is where she lives. She also makes 'rellenos' (a common dish in La paz, similar to meatballs, but covered with ground potatoes) and sell these in El Alto, because the proceeds from her grocery story barely cover the cost of living.
