The loan she is asking for is in order to increase her capital and enable her to provide more products for sale in her store, as well as improve the hygenic conditions of her 'rellenos' store, purchase desk chairs, etc..

Through her history with IMPRO, she should have access to a new loan. She has been a client of ours since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rufina vive en alquiler en la calle Puertas de la zona de villa nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 68 años de edad, las habitaciones que ocupa una la usa como tienda de abarrotes y la otra para su vivienda; también elabora rellenos (un plato muy criollo de La Paz, muy parecida a las meatballs, pero recubiertas con papa molida) y los vende en la ciudad de El Alto, en vista de que lo que gana en la tienda apenas le alcanza para su subsistencia.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder ampliar mas su tienda, y surtir sus productos como también mejorar la higiene de su negocio de rellenos, comprándose mesas sillas etc.. Por su antecedente histórico con IMPRO, ella puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Increase capital and provide more products for sale, purchase desk chairs for the office..etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood and tools to improve the finish on the furniture he builds

loans.name: Surie

texts.en: Surie S. runs a business selling secondhand clothes in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  He is forty-eight years old and married with four children. Surie’s wife also manages her own business  selling African print fabrics in the same market.  Both are working together to earn income for their children’s education and other expenses.  Surie would like a loan of $275 to increase his stock of used clothing.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing for his business

loans.name: Alhaji Muhamed

texts.en: Alhaji Muhamed J. is thirty-three years old and is married with four children.  He runs a business of selling secondhand clothes while his wife sells palm oil.  Muhamed started his business when he was 15 years old but his business was destroyed by the rebels during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  After the war, he started all over again with a small amount of capital from family members.  With his previous loan form SMT he was able to expand and diversify his business.  He is requesting more loan funds to increase his stock of clothing and involve his wife in running the business.  Mohamed’s hope is to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to expand his used clothing business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Mr. Fernandez is the owner of a vulcanizing shop – a place to chemically treat (rubber) with sulfur and heat for greater elasticity and durability – where he repairs auto tires for all types of vehicles. He made the effort to buy tools and machines to keep his business active. Currently, he wishes to borrow a loan to improve the appearance of his shop since he practically attends to his customers in the street. He wants to paint the area and build a roof that would allow him to create a waiting room for the comfort of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. F. es propietario desde hace más de siete años de una vulcanizadora donde repara llantas para todo tipo de vehículos, inició con las herramientas básicas para brindar sus servicios y poco a poco, con mucho esfuerzo fue adquiriendo herramientas y máquinas que le han permitido mantener activo su negocio, en la actualidad quiere adquirir el préstamo para mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, ya que prácticamente atiende a sus clientes en la calle, quiere pintar el local y construir un techo que le permita crear como una sala de espera para dar más comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Maintenance and construction of store

payments.comment: In last week's audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Fernandez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: A thirty-five year old mother of four children, Kadiatu works hard to earn an income to meet her children’s expenses.   Kadiatu said that with such a big family, her husband is unable to meet each family members needs, so she needs to supplement what her husband can provide.  She runs a small business selling stable items in the market town of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  With some of her profits, she invests in goats and sheep and raises them with her parents.  After fattening the animals, she will sell them for profit. She is requesting the loan to increase her stock of foodstuffs and purchase two more sheep for fattening.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock and extra inventory to expand her business

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh L. is forty-years old and married with one child.  She sells clothes and with her previous loans she diversified her business so that she now sells onions, sauce pans, tomato paste, etc.  Saleh also opened a small shop in Kabala's market and employed her nephew to run it.  She is planning to expand her business and build a small family house.  Saleh said she would like to save some income to build a small house for her grandchildren.  She is requesting a loan of $275 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: increase her inventory

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu B. is thirty-three years and is married with children.  Her husband is a local contractor but his income is not steady.  To make ends meet, Umu runs a fish business in the market of Kabala, Sierra Leone.  With her previous loans from SMT, she expanded her business by purchasing fish from big suppliers – the fisheries - and selling them to smaller fishmongers at wholesale prices.  Umu is not able to meet the demand of her customers due to lack of capital.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $275.  Umu uses her income to assist her parents and provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to increase wholesale supplies for distribution

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu Lailah is eighteen years old and is married with a child.  She runs a business selling sandals, sauce pans and others small items in the market in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  Ramatu’s husband Jabari assists her in running the business.  Both are committed to prepare a secure future for their children.  Ramatu said that she used part of the profit generated from her previous loan to buy a cow so that the family can have milk for the family and to sell.  She plans to buy more cows in the future.  To enable her to do that, she is requesting a loan of $250 to expand her current business.

loans.use: to increase hermarket stall inventory

loans.name: Mayra Vanessa

texts.es:
Senora Namendi is originally from Masaya, a city very well known for its "Cosas de Horno", a typical Nicaraguen pastry. She is married with 4 children who go to school, and often help her in the preparation of her pastries. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest more in her business, primarily in the maintenance and repair of the oven in which she makes her products. The oven is more than 20 years old and very deteriorated. With the loan, Senora Namendi would like to increase her sales, lower her costs, and improve the living conditions of her family.

La Sra.

loans.use: Investment in pastry business

payments.comment: During last week's audit, we were unable to verify that Ms. Namendi was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and hope you continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu B. is thirty-six years old and started his business three years ago.  Although he has a place in the main market in Kabala, Sierra Leone, he often travels to the village during the village market days.  Amadu is married with a child and his plan is to provide the best education for his child.  He is requesting a loan of $250 to increase his stock and reduce his visits to Freetown to buy more goods.

loans.use: to Increase inventory for village market days

loans.name: Jamie

texts.en: Jamie B. is twenty-seven years old and has four children. Jamie started her business three years ago selling saucepans and palm oil in front of  her house.  She goes to the villages to purchase palm oil in bulk in “gerri cans” and distributes them to retailers in the neighborhood.   She would like a loan of $250 to purchase fourteen more “gerri cans” of palm oil.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to distribute wholesale to local retailers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms Rosa works hard to sell basic goods and general supplies. Her store is also very well situated in a prime location. Moreover, she sells bottles of water and gas for domestic use.

Use of the Loan

She will use the loan to buy more wholesale merchandise and gas cylinders to have large profits and moreover, be able to offer these products at the most competitive prices.

Personal Details

She is 37 years old and lives in a cement home. She has three children who are students. Her main goal is to make sure she and her family have stable, comfortable lives.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y víveres en general. Además su tienda esta muy bien ubicada en calle principal. Además ella vende botellones de agua y gas de uso domestico.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor y comprar mas cilindros de gas así tener mayores ganancias y además poder ofrecer los productos con precios mas económicos.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 37 años y su casa es de cemento, tiene tres hijos que estudian su principal meta asegurarse una vida estable junto a su familia

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale and gas cylinders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her store and buy more products

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
“My wife and I prepare food and go out to sell them in the streets in a Troca Van that we have, but it creates problems to transport the food and keep them warm enough to sell. We would like to purchase a mobile stall so we can sell them in one place and we can bring this stall around to other places to sell the food. I would like a loan of $1200 to buy a mobile stall.”

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo preparamos comida y salimos a venderla a la calle en una Troca Van que tenemos pero se nos dificulta mucho transportarla y que llegue caliente para venderla, nos gustaría comprar un puesto móvil para poder vender en un lugar y poder transportarnos a otros lugares a vender la comida”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la compra del puesto móvil.

loans.use: To buy a mobile stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her product offering

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Madam Kadiatu Bockarie is a petty trader in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She is thirty- five years old and is married with three children.  Her husband is a police officer but his monthly income in insufficient to cover all of the family's expenses.  Therefore, Kadiatus’ business income supplements the family income.  To expand her business, she is requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: to expand her trading business

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Rugiatu K. is engaged in petty trading in one of the small markets in Makeni in Sierra Leone.  A widow with four children, Rugiatu is responsible for raising her children.  Because of her outstanding character and ability to organize market women, she was made the leader of the traders in the market.  With her previous loan from SMT, she was able to increase her income and meet other household expenses, including school fees for her children.  She would like to expand her business so that she can generate more income to pay for her children's expenses.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: to expand her business inventory

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en: Unisa K. is a petty trader.  He owns a stall at the market in Makeni, Sierra Leone, where he sells imported clothes and shoes.  Aged forty-nine, K. is a father of six children and is the sole breadwinner for the family.  With his previous loan from SMT, K. managed to increase his income and pay for his children’s education and other family expenses.  He is determined to improve the standard of living for his family by expanding his business.  He is therefore requesting for a larger second loan of $200.

loans.use: Expansion of his clothing shop

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en: Jariatu J. is thirty-one years old.  She is married with three children.  Jariatu runs a small store selling food items and is assisted by her children.  Her husband is unemployed and cannot take care of the family's expenses.  The income generated from Jariatu’s business is therefore crucial.  With a larger second loan, she will be able to expand her business and save for the children’s future. Jariatu demonstrates a high sense of responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda C. migrated from the district of Port Loko to the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone for business purposes.  He is fifty years old and is married with five children.  As an experienced business man, he changes his business inventory according to his customers demand.  With his previous loan, Dauda diversified his business activities.  He is assisted by his wife who sells goods in Makeni town and surrounding villages.  The couple is able to provide their children with basic needs and Dauda is determined to educate three of their children at the university level.  For the future of the children, he opened a family savings account.  He is requesting a second loan of $200.

loans.use: to diversify his current business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products and a used oven

loans.name: Maria Israela

texts.es:
" I need to purchase merchandise for my business because our inventory is almost down to zero. Sales have fallen and I have not been able to replenish my stock. I request US$1,200.00 that will be invested in the business". “

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito compra mercancía para mi negocio ya que esta casi vacío, debido a que han bajado las ventas y no he podido volver a comprar más” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Venicio

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Venicio has a store where he sells basic goods as well as seafood at wholesale prices. He started his business 7 years ago with little merchandise, thanks to a loan given to him by a financier. His wife and his sister-in-law help him in his business and now, his business has grown and he has multiple sales.

Use of the Loan

He wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise for his store since the number of customers has increased nowadays.

Personal details

He is 40 years old and has three children. He lives in a cement home and he has good family stability. His goal is to grow his business and one day, to be able to better attend to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor Venicio tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad y también vende mariscos al por mayor, su negocio lo empezó desde hace 7 años con poca mercadería y con un capital gracias a un crédito otorgado por una financiera, en el negocio le ayudan su esposa y su cuñada, en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido y tiene varios pedidos.

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su crédito en comprar mas mercadería para su tienda ya que en los últimos días sus clientes aumentan.

Información Personal

El tiene 40 años y tres hijos, su vivienda es de cemento y su estabilidad familiar es buena, su meta es crecer con su tienda y un día poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy furniture for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy inventory to grow his business

loans.name: Petita

texts.es:
Business Description

Petita began her business five years ago. She provides lunches and snacks such as grilled chicken wings and kebabs. She takes good care of her clients and works from 9am until 9pm every day.

Use of Loan

Petita needs the loan to invest in tables and chairs for her clients, and a more industrial kitchen to better prepare the food.

Personal Information

Petita is 53 years old and has 5 children. 2 of her children still live with her, one young, and the other older, but with special needs. Her husband abandoned her three years ago. She runs her business outside of her house. She aspires to improve and grow, together with her business, and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Descripción del Negocio

Petita inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Ella vende: Almuerzos. Chuzos y Alas de pollo asadas. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Petita necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de mesas, sillas, una cocina industrial para una mejor preparación de los alimentos y la atención de sus clientes.

Información Personal

Petita tiene 53 años. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 viven junto a ella. 1 menor y la otra hija que es mayor pero es especial. Su esposo la abandono hace 3 años. Para su negocio utiliza las afueras de su casa. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy furniture and utensils for her business

loans.name: Luigui

texts.es:
Business Description

Luigui started his business a year ago, and he sells clothes such as pants, shirts and underwear. He does this everyday from 9am – 6pm.

Loan Use

Luigui needs a loan in order to buy more and newer clothes so that he can offer more variety to his clients.

Personal Information

Luigui is 20 years old and he is single. He lives with his parents and he sells his wares walking around the neighborhood where they live. He hopes to grow and improve along with his business so that he can offer more support to his family and their household.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Luigui inicio su negocio hace 1año. Los productos que vende son: Prendas de vestir como pantalones, blusas, conjuntos e interiores. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Luigui necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más y nuevos modelos de ropa. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Luigui tiene 20años. Es soltero. Vive con sus padres. Sus ventas la realiza de manera ambulante recorriendo varios sectores cerca de su hogar. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor ayuda a su hogar y a sus padres.

loans.use: To invest in new styles of clothes/Invertir en nuevos modelos de ropa

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Business Description

Margarita sells food such as rice, meat, pork chops and a wider variety of dishes too. She has been doing this for 10 years and she works from her home from 6pm – 11pm weekdays. Thanks to her own hard work she has been able to keep her business going.

Loan use

Margarita needs a loan in order to fit out her shop structurally and to buy chairs, tables and kitchen utensils. Due to the large number of clients that she has, Margarita would also like to increase the range of foods that she offers to keep her clients happy and coming to her.

Personal Information

Margarita is 43 years old and lives with her two kids who are 12 and 22 years old. They are both studying thanks to the hard work that she has done alone. Margarita’s dream is to see her business grow and to earn more money from it for the well-being of her kids and the family as a whole.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Margarita se dedica a la venta de comidas como: arroz con menestra y carne o con chuleta o también con longaniza, variedad de platos. Teniendo como experiencia 10 años, trabajando en este tipo de negocio, ya que el local lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio atendiendo desde las 6pm hasta las 11pm, todos los días de la semana, en la que gracias a su propio esfuerzo a podido mantenerse en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Margarita necesita el préstamo para adecuar el local, en lo que tiene que ver con la infraestructura y compra de más utensilios como sillas y mesas. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Margarita se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su local de comida, para de esa manera tener a sus clientes conformes y contentos.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Margarita tiene 43 años de edad, en donde vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 22 y 12 años de edad en la que uno de ellos estudia gracias al esfuerzo que realiza totalmente sola. Los anhelos de Margarita es salir con su negocio a delante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de sus hijos, en si de la familia.

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils/Comprar muebleria y utensilos

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Business Description

Segundo has 2 years experience and learnt his trade from a friend who gave him the tools he needed to start his business. He started repairing computers and now he also puts them together and sells them. He works weekdays from 3pm – 7pm. Each morning he teaches IT in a school near his home.

He will use the credit to buy computing material and he will also fit out his home as a shop in order to serve his clients better.

Personal Information

Segundo is single and he lives with his parents and 5 siblings. They are all single and the oldest work. Their house is made of a mixture of materials. Segundo was born with a defect in his hands which meant it was hard to work, but this is what pushed him to continue to work and help his family. His aim is to see his business grow and to have his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Segundo tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su actividad. Aprendió el oficio de parte de un amigo el cual le enseño. Le facilito herramientas de trabajo con las que inicio su negocio. Comenzó reparando computadoras. Actualmente a mas de repararlas también las armas y las vende. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 3 p.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Por las mañanas es profesor de computación en una escuela cerca de su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de artículos de computación. Además de adecuar su domicilio para poner un local donde pueda darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Segundo es soltero. Vive con sus padres y 5 hermanos. Todos son solteros y los mayores trabajan. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Segundo nació con una mal formación en sus manos lo cual no ha sido impedimento para realizar sus trabajos. Es lo que lo impulsa a seguir a trabajando y ayudar a su familia. Su deseo es poder ampliar su negocio y tener un local propio.

loans.use: To buy computing materials/Comprar articulos de computacion

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Business Description

Rosa has 4 years experience. While she was still young she started working in houses doing domestic chores. Bit by bit she saved up some money and started a small sewing factory in her house. Along with her daughter, she started making clothes and then selling them. She also sells household items on the weekend. She works at home from 8am – 3pm everyday, and in the afternoon and evening she dedicates herself to her business.

Loan Use

She will use the credit to buy material to make clothes. She will also buy a better sewing machine for a better finish. She would also like to invest in household articles to sell.

Personal Information

Rosa is a single mother and has 4 kids, 3 of whom are studying, while the eldest helps her in her business. Their house is made of sugar cane stalks and has a dirt floor. Their desire is to be able to build their house out of cement, improving the family’s way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Rosa tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su actividad. Desde joven se inicio trabajando en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. Poco a poco logro tener unos ahorros con los que monto un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio. Con su hija comenzó a elaborar prendas de vestir para luego venderlas. Además se dedica a la venta de artículos de hogar los fines de semana. Trabaja en casa todos los días de 8 a.m. hasta 3 p.m. Por las tardes se dedica a su negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de materia prima para elaborar sus prendas de vestir. Además de comprar una maquina de coser con el que pueda darle un mejor acabado sus prendas. Otra parte poder invertir en la compra de artículos de hogar para su venta.

Información Personal

Rosa es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos. Tres de ellos estudian y la mayor le ayuda con su taller de costura. Su casita es de caña y tiene piso de tierra. Su mayor deseo es poder tener ahorros con el que puede construir su casita de cemento. Mejorando de esta manera la vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and material/Comprar una maquina y materia prima

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Business Description

Daisy had 20 years experience. She started working in houses, doing domestic chores. The death of her son and brother was her main reason for starting her own business. She received help from her family. She now works weekdays selling household items and weekends she sells lunches from her front door. She gets help from her children too.

Loan Use

She will invest this money in buying merchandise for her business in order to attract more customers. She will also buy some chickens to sell them by the pound.

Personal Information

Daisy is married. She has two grown-up kids. Her husband is a fisherman and spends his time traveling and returns home every 2 weeks. This is how they cover the household costs. Their house is made of sugar cane stalks; in the future they hope to start building it of cement.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Daisy tiene una experiencia de 20 años con su actividad. Se inicio trabajando en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. La muerte de su hijo y un hermano la motivo a salir adelante con un negocio propio. Recibió la ayuda de su familia. Actualmente trabaja todos los días de la semana vendiendo artículos de hogar. Y los fines de semana se dedican a vender meriendas en el portal de su domicilio. Recibe la ayuda de uno de sus hijos en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su negocio. Adecuara su local para mejorar su atención. Además invertirá en compra de pollos para vender por libras.

Información Personal

Daisy es casada. Tiene 2 hijos mayores. Su esposo trabaja en la pesca. Pasa viajando y regresa cada 15 días al hogar. De esta manera ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de caña. Esperando a futuro poder comenzar su construcción de cemento.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and invest in her secondary business/Comprar mercaderia y invertir en su negocio secundario

loans.name: Bélgica

texts.es:
Description of Business

Belgica has 5-years experience at this business. She was able to raise enough money for the business by selling movies in another province. People began asking for her merchandise and she was able to meet the demands of her customers. She used to work everyday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. When she was able, she worked in a packing plant to generate a second income for her household.

Plans for the Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for sale: bedding, clothing, glassware, etc. In the future, she’s thinking of adapting part of her house to set up a small store.

Personal Information

Belgica is a single mother. She’s 36 years old and has 3 children in school. Her small house is made of cana (a reed-like wood) and only has a dirt floor. She hopes to use the loan to improve her income which, in turn, will allow her to begin to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Bélgica tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad. Ella pudo conseguir su capital del negocio de venta de películas que posee en otra provincia. La gente le comenzó a pedir mercadería y ella pudo satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Cuando ella puede se va ha trabajar en una empacadora. Generando de esta manera otro ingreso para su hogar.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería como lo es : sabanas, prendas de vestir, colchones, vasos. A futuro piensa adecuar un lugar en su domicilio para montar un local.

Información Personal

Bélgica es madre soltera. Tiene 36 años. Y 3 hijos los que estudian. Su casita es de caña y tiene piso de tierra. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos y comenzar ha adecuar su domicilio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Description of Business

Maria has 5 years experience selling electrical goods. Her husband helped her raise a loan to start the business. She used to work everyday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. covering not only her own neighborhood but others too. She was welcomed everywhere she went for the quality of her products.

Purpose of the Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise. She hopes to enter the market for clothing sales. She also wants to stock her business with electrical products such as irons, toasters, microwaves, etc.

Personal Information

Maria is married. She is 36 years old and has 3 children who study in nearby schools. Her husband fishes [which helps?] with the household expenses. Her small house is made of cana (a reed-like wood). With both incomes, they hope to improve their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Maria tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad de venta de articulos electricos. Su esposo fue la persona que le ayudo en conseguir el capital. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Recorriendo las calles de su sector y además visitando referidos de otro sector. Tiene buena acogida por la calidad de sus productos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería. Espera poder incursionar con la venta de prendas de vestir. Y además surtir su negocio con artículos eléctricos como lo son: planchas, tostadoras, microondas.

Información Personal

Maria es casada. Tiene 36 años y 3 hijos. Los cuales estudian en una escuela cerca del sector donde viven. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ayudándole con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de caña. Con el ingreso de ambos esperan adecuar su domicilio.

loans.use: Buy more electrical goods and other items for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Description of Business

Cecilia has 4 years experience at her business. She began, selling various things, as a street vendor, something that required that she spend a lot of time away from home. Her husband helped her start a business at home selling juices, soft drinks and other beverages. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Purpose of Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her business. She hopes to stock it with other kinds of beverages. She also wants to buy confectionaries. She would like to help her husband, a fisherman, buy fishing gear that he needs.

Personal Information

Cecilia is married. She’s 38 years old and she has 3 children, only one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman. He comes home every 15 days to help with the household. Their house is made of cana (a reed-like wood) and has a dirt floor. Their goal is to have a small house made of cement which would improve the life of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Cecilia tiene una experiencia de 4 años en el comercio. Se inicio vendiendo artículos varios recorriendo las calles. Debido a que esta actividad le demandaba pasar mucho tiempo fuera de su domicilio. Recibe la ayuda de su esposo y monta un negocio de venta de jugos, colas, bebidas en su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su negocio. Espera surtirlo con otra clase de bebidas, jugos, colas. Además de comprar productos de confitería. Desea ayudar a su esposo en la compra de una malla para que realice labores de pesca.

Información Personal

Cecilia es casada. Tiene 38 años. Su familia esta conformada además con 3 hijos. Solo uno estudia. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Regresa cada 15 días a su domicilio. Dando de esta manera un apoyo al hogar. Su casita es de caña y piso de tierra. Su meta es poder tener su casita de cemento. Dando de esta manera una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: Diversify the products that she sells.

loans.name: Nata

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six women of the Kamutene Association, led by Ms. Nata C.. The Kamutene group hails from the island of Carabane at the mouth of the Casamance River in southern Senegal. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The business is located in the village of Carabane, in the district of Oussouye. Carabane is a very isolated village that is difficult to access, which makes it very difficult for its inhabitants to get credit. This is why we are requesting a loan of $1200.

Objectives: To alleviate the housewife's burden and to improve the income and living conditions of the group members.

Business: The group plans to purchase products in Ziguinchor [the nearest city] and resell them on the island of Carabane. They plan to do the same with seafood products from Carabane, transporting them to the mainland for sale.”

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Le projet se situe dans l’éco village de carabane ; dans le département de Oussouye. De part sa position géographique, Carabane est un village trés enclavé et d’accés difficile ; ce qui ne facilite pas les populations d’accédés aux crédit. C’est pouquoi le groupement sollicite un prêt de 600 000f

Objectifs : Alléger le panier de la ménagère Améliorer les revenus et les conditions de vie des membres du groupement.

Activités : Il s’agit d’acheter les produits à Ziguinchor et les revendre dans l’île de carabane. Et faire la même chose avec les produits halieutiques venant de Carabane vers la terre ferme.»

loans.use: Bulk purchase of goods, storage and transport for long-distance trading

loans.name: Abdou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the four members of the Ndigne group, led by Mr. Abdou D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The Ndigne group is located in the village of Louly Ngogom. Situated in the interior of the country, Louly is an agricultural village that specializes in peanut farming.

Purpose: To support the families of the village in between harvests, and improve living conditions.

Activities: The business consists of buying sheep, fattening them and selling them at the weekly markets.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Le groupement Ndiguné est un groupement du village de Louly Ngokhom ; Situer au centre du pays,le village de louly est un village d’agriculteur qui se donne surtout à la culture de l’arachide .

Objectif : Soutenir les familles en période de soudure Améliorer les conditions de vie

Activités : l’activité consiste a acheter des moutons, les engraissés et les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires.»

loans.use: Purchase and fattening of sheep for resale

loans.name: Yero

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Bayamba Association, led by Ms. Yero B.. The Bayamba group is from the village of Colufifa in the southern Casamance region of Senegal, until recently the scene of a devastating separatist conflict. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The women of Casamance are brave and hardworking, especially when it comes to trade. However they lack the chance to put these attributes to good use, because they are trapped in a vicious cycle of poverty and deprivation. In fact, in many cases the wife is the most important member of the household, thanks to her role in producing food for the family and countless other responsibilities.

Purpose: The objectives of this trading business include restarting local economic activities, motivating young women to stay in their home villages by creating revenue-generating activities, creating revenue for women at the household level, fighting poverty by increasing income, guaranteeing the grassroots development of the locality, fighting malnutrition among mothers and children, and providing good-quality products to the inhabitants of the village.

Business activities: This business consists of lending money to the women of the village group so that they can engage in the trade of products such as fresh, dried and smoked fish, sugar, palm oil, vegetables, rice, oil, etc. At the same time, the women will purchase millet, cashew nuts, and other specialties of their own village to resell in the large town markets. This will allow the women to make a profit and repay the loan.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : La femme de la Casamance est très brave et tenace face au travail et le commerce en particulier cependant elle ne trouve pas de moyens ou d’opportunités pour exploiter ses potentialités car elle est contrecarrée par un cercle vicieux pauvreté et manque de moyens.

En effet, dans bon nombre de cas, la femme est plus importante dans le ménage, vu son rôle de production de vivres et tant d’autres.

Objectifs : Les objectifs visées sont par le projet commerce sont entre autre :

-Relancer les activités économiques dans la localité -Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenues -Créer des revenus aux femmes au niveau des ménages -Lutter contre la pauvreté par la distribution de revenus -Garantir l’auto développement de la localité -Lutter contre la malnutrition maternelle et infantile -Mettre à la disposition des populations des produits de bonne qualité

Activités : Ce projet consiste à prêter de l’argent aux femmes des groupements villageois pour faire du commerce des produits tels que poissons frais, secs ou fumés, sucre, thé, huile de palme, légumes, riz, huile etc. Il y’a lieu de noter que les femmes vont en même temps acheter dans leur village du mil, des noix de cajou et d’autres pour les revendre dans les grands marchés. A partir de cette activité, les femmes vont fructifier l’argent pour arriver au bout de la dette. »

loans.use: Trading business: purchase of goods, storage and transport

loans.name: Chey

texts.en:
Mr. Chey Samnag is 35 years old and lives with his wife and their child, who is of schoolgoing age, in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To provide for his family's living expenses, he works as an electrician fixing TVs, radios and other electrical equipment . He makes about $5 a day on average. His wife is a landlord and rents different rooms to the people in her community, earning about $2 each day.

Due to an increasing demand for rooms, this couple hopes to effectively use this $300 loan to build more rooms to earn more for their family's expenses.

loans.use: To build more rooms to accommodate his tenants.

loans.name: Mata

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Sare Doro Association, led by Ms. Mata D.. The Sare Doro group is from the village of Colufifa in the southern Casamance region of Senegal, until recently the scene of a devastating separatist conflict. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: Casamance is a very remote region of Senegal. It has the potential to be rich, but is nevertheless very poor. Its population is young and it is the women who dominate the local economy and constitute the engine of development. However, the majority of young girls and women do not have any source of income, and this is the cause of the exponential growth in migration away from rural areas.

Purpose: The objectives of this trading business include restarting local economic activities, motivating young women to stay in their home villages by creating revenue-generating activities, creating revenue for women at the household level, fighting poverty by increasing income, guaranteeing the grassroots development of the locality, fighting malnutrition among mothers and children, and providing good-quality products to the inhabitants of the village.

Business activities: This business consists of lending money to the women of the village group so that they can trade products such as fresh, dried and smoked fish, sugar, palm oil, vegetables, rice, oil, etc. At the same time, the women will purchase millet, cashew nuts, and other specialties of their own village to resell in the large town markets. This will allow the women to make a profit and repay the loan.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Contexte : La Casamance est une région très enclavée du Sénégal. Elle est potentiellement riche mais très pauvre. Sa population est jeune avec une majorité des femmes qui sont prépondérantes dans l’économie locale et constituent le moteur du développement. Dans la localité, la plupart des jeunes filles et femmes n’ont pas de sources de revenus et ceci est la cause de la croissance exponentielle de l’exode rural.

Objectifs : Les objectifs visées sont par le projet commerce sont entre autre :

-Relancer les activités économiques dans la localité -Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenues -Créer des revenus aux femmes au niveau des ménages -Lutter contre la pauvreté par la distribution de revenus -Garantir l’auto développement de la localité -Lutter contre la malnutrition maternelle et infantile -Mettre à la disposition des populations des produits de bonne qualité

Activités : Ce projet consiste à prêter de l’argent aux femmes des groupements villageois pour faire du commerce des produits tels que poissons frais, secs ou fumés, sucre, thé, huile de palme, légumes, riz, huile etc. Il y’a lieu de noter que les femmes vont en même temps acheter dans leur village du mil, des noix de cajou et d’autres pour les revendre dans les grands marchés. A partir de cette activité, les femmes vont fructifier l’argent pour arriver au bout de la dette. »

loans.use: Purchase of goods, storage and transport for traveling sales.

loans.name: Fatou Gueye

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Ujokoral Association, led by Ms. Fatou Gueye N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The project is located in the village of Carabane, in the district of Oussouye. The village is on an island at the mouth of the Casamance River and is very isolated village and difficult to get to. This makes it very difficult for its inhabitants to obtain credit and the reason why the group is requesting a loan of $1200.

Purpose: To alleviate the burden of the housewife, and to improve the income and living conditions of the group's members.

Business activities: The group plans to produce and sell seafood products, such as oysters, shellfish, shrimp, and fresh and dried fish.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte: Le projet se situe dans l’éco village de carabane ; dans le département de Oussouye. De part sa position géographique, Carabane est un village trés enclavé et d’accés difficile ; ce qui ne facilite pas les populations d’accédés aux crédit. C’est pouquoi le groupement sollicite un prêt de 600 000f

Objectifs : Alléger le panier de la ménagère Améliorer les revenus et les conditions de vie des membres du groupement.

Activités : Le groupement se propose la production et la vente des produits halieutiques ; tel que : huître, arches, crevettes, poissons séchés et frais.»

loans.use: Seafood harvesting equipment, small canoe, transportation to mainland for resale, construction of fish-smoking oven, storage fees for one year

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S. is a 63 year old diligent mother of 3 children. She works selling porridge and pork rice to the people in her community. She has to get up very early each morning to cook the porridge and rice. She typically earns about $5 each day. S.'s husband is a village chef and also earns roughly $5 /day. All 3 of their children are employed at a garment factory.

Mrs. S. is requesting a $300 loan to purchase more equipment and some utensils for her business.

loans.use: To invest in more equipment and some utensils.

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six women of the Urokal Association, led by Ms. Awa D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The project is located in the village of Mlomp, about 9 km from the town of Oussouye. It is intended to facilitate the villagers' provision of beef and live cows. In order to combate emigration from rural areas and to create employment for young people, our group is requesting a loan of $1200 to carry out our business activities.

Purpose: The group works to improve the living conditions of its members, to alleviate the burden of the housewives, and to create employment for young people.

The business activities will consist of purchasing cows, fattening them for six months, and reselling them live or in pieces, according to the needs of the local villagers.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le projet se situ dans l’éco village de Mlomp distant de 9Km de la capitale départementale : Oussouye. Il vise à facilité la procuration des populations en viande de bœuf ou en vente sur pied. Afin de lutter contre l’exode, et créer de l’emploi pour les jeunes, le groupement sollicite un financement de 600 000F pour mener a bien ces activités.

Objectif : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif : - D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres ; - D’allégé le panier de la ménagère - de créer de l’emplois pour les jeunes

Activités : Elle consiste à acheter des boeufs, les engraissés pour une période de six (06) mois et les revendre sur pied ou en pièce selon les besoins des populations.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational lifestyle distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and has restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of five cows, feed and veterinary supplies

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband fixes cars and her children study in school. After Tajikistan’s civil war, factories closed, life became very hard and Rano started making ground meat. She started her business with $30. Rano rented a refrigerator to store the ground meat.

In 2004 Rano received her first loan from MicroInvest. Back then her assets were worth $100. After several loans she started purchasing meat wholesale and purchased a refrigerator. Today her assets have risen to $380. In the future she plans on purchasing a large scale and improving her business location.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Орипова Рано – 37лет. Замужем, мать троих детей. Муж занимается ремонтом автомашины, дети учатся в школе. После гражданской войны в Таджикистане заводы и фабрики закрылись, жить стала очень трудной и Рано начала заниматься изготовлением и реализацией фарша. Начала свою деятельность с 30$. Она арендовала холодильник для хранения фарша. В 2004году получила первый займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда её активы составляли 100$. После неоднократного получения займа она стала закупать оптом мясо, приобрела холодильник. Сейчас её активы возросли до 380$. В будущем она планирует купить большие весы и улучшить место деятельности.
